quote: Satire is what closes Saturday night.
author: George S. Kaufman

quote: A play should give you something to think about. When I see a play and understand it the first time  then I know it can't be much good.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: By increasing the size of the keyhole  today's playwrights are in danger of doing away with the door.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: We do not go (to the theatre) like our ancestors  to escape from the pressure of reality  so much as to confirm our experience of it.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: A play visibly represents pure existing.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: I sweat. If anything comes easy to me  I mistrust it.
author: Lilli Palmer

quote: I sometimes wish they would swagger more now  buy bigger overcoats and wilder hats  and retain those traces of make-up that put them outside respectability and keep them rogues and vagabonds  which is what  at heart - bless 'em - they are.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: Actor-manager - one to whom the part is greater than the whole.
author: Ronald Jeans

quote: I know it was wonderful  but I don't know how I did it.
author: Laurence Olivier

quote: Very few people go to the doctor when they have a cold  they go to the theatre instead.
author: W. Boyd Gatewood

quote: The unique thing about Margaret Rutherford is that she can act with her chin alone. Among its many moods I especially cherish the chin commanding  the chin in doubt  and the chin at bay.
author: Kenneth Tynan

quote: There are five stages to an actor's career: who is Herschel Bernardi? get me Herschel Bernardi  get me a Herschel Bernardi type  get me a young Herschel Bernardi  and who is Herschel Bernardi?
author: Herschel Bernardi

quote: On stage I make love to twenty-five thousand people  then I go home alone.
author: Janis Joplin

quote: In Hollywood  if you don't have happiness  you send out for it.
author: Rex Reed

quote: Long experience has taught me that in England nobody goes to the theatre unless he or she has bronchitis.
author: James Agate

quote: Playing Shakespeare is very tiring. You never get to sit down  unless you're a king.
author: Josephine Hull

quote: Theatre is simply what cannot be expressed by any other means  a complexity of words  movements  gestures that convey a vision of the world inexpressible in any other way.
author: Eugene Ionesco

quote: As an actor  he should be an extra in police line-ups.
author: Robert H. Gurney

quote: The most difficult character in comedy is that of the fool  and he must be no simpleton that plays that part.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: When an actor has money  he doesn't send letters but telegrams.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: The drama's laws  the drama's patrons give. For we that live to please  must please to live.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The play's the thing.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: After all is said and done  more is said than done.
author: Anonymous

quote: Between saying and doing many a pair of shoes is worn out.
author: Italian proverb

quote: But search the land of living men  Where wilt thou find their like again.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: Deliberation is the work of many men. Action  of one alone.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: Go and wake up your cook.
author: Arabian proverb

quote: He who wants a rose must respect the thorn.
author: Persian proverb

quote: I want to see you shoot the way you shout.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: If you want something done right  get someone else to do it.
author: Marion Giacomini

quote: Looking at small advantages prevents great affairs from being accomplished.
author: Confucius

quote: Noble deeds and hot baths are the best cures for depression.
author: Dodie Smith

quote: Play out the game  act well your part  and if the gods have blundered  we will not.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The central problem of our age is how to act decisively in the absence of certainty.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The fair request ought to be followed by the deed  in silence.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: To knock a thing down  especially if it is cocked at an arrogant angle  is a deep delight to the blood.
author: George Santayana

quote: When written in Chinese  the word crisis is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Why  then the world's mine oyster Which I with sword will open.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Through the picture  I see reality. Through the word  I understand it.
author: Sven Lidman

quote: He who desires  but acts not  breeds pestilence.
author: William Blake

quote: The frontiers are not east or west  north or south  but wherever a man fronts a fact.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: If you want a thing done  go - if not  send.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: All glory comes from daring to begin.
author: Anonymous

quote: Action is eloquence.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: From the moment of birth we are immersed in action  and can only fitfully guide it by taking thought.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: The great end of life is not knowledge  but action.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The men who act stand nearer to the mass of man than the men who write  and it is in their hands that new thought gets its translation into the crude language of deeds.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: We accept the verdict of the past until the need for change cries out loudly enough to force upon us a choice between the comforts of further inertia and the irksomeness of action.
author: Learned Hand

quote: It is much easier to do and die than it is to reason why.
author: G. A. Studdert-Kennedy

quote: 'Mean to' don't pick no cotton.
author: Anonymous

quote: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: It is only in marriage with the world that our ideals can bear fruit  divorced from it  they remain barren.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: There are risks and costs to a program of action. But they are far less than the long-range risks and costs of comfortable inaction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Take time to deliberate  but when the time for action arrives  stop thinking and go in.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: You may be disappointed if you fail  but you are doomed if you don't try.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: When you appeal to force  there's one thing you must never do - lose.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: In action  be primitive  in foresight  a strategist.
author: Rene Char

quote: I am not built for academic writings. Action is my domain.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Trust only movement. Life happens at the level of events  not of words. Trust movement.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: Let us act on what we have  since we have not what we wish.
author: Cardinal Newman

quote: Nothing is often a good thing to do and always a good thing to say.
author: Will Durant

quote: A = r + p (or Adventure equals risk plus purpose.)
author: Robert McClure

quote: For purposes of action nothing is more useful than narrowness of thought combined with energy of will.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: I shall tell you a great secret  my friend. Do not wait for the last judgement  it takes place every day.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Blessed is he who carries within himself a god and an ideal and who obeys it - an ideal of art  of science  or gospel virtues. Therein lie the springs of great thoughts and great actions.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: I learn by going where I have to go.
author: Theodore Roethke

quote: He who is outside his door already has a hard part of his journey behind him.
author: Dutch proverb

quote: The shortest answer is doing.
author: English proverb

quote: Action is consolatory. It is the enemy of thought and the friend of flattering illusions.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: We will either find a way  or make one.
author: Hannibal

quote: If you have anything to tell me of importance  for God's sake begin at the end.
author: Sara Jeannette Duncan

quote: There are only two forces that unite men - fear and interest.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Having the world's best idea will do you no good unless you act on it. People who want milk shouldn't sit on a stool in the middle of a field in hopes that a cow will back up to them.
author: Curtis Grant

quote: Ideas are powerful things  requiring not a studious contemplation but an action  even if it is only an inner action.
author: Midge Dector

quote: The only way to get positive feelings about yourself is to take positive actions. Man does not live as he thinks  he thinks as he lives.
author: Reverend Vaughan Quinn

quote: The only measure of what you believe is what you do. If you want to know what people believe  don't read what they write  don't ask them what they believe  just observe what they do.
author: Ashley Montagu

quote: Our nature consists in motion  complete rest is death.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Who can separate his faith from his actions  or his belief from his occupations?
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: The prayer of the chicken hawk does not get him the chicken.
author: Swahili proverb

quote: The superior man is modest in his speech  but excels in his actions.
author: Confucius

quote: There is no genius in life like the genius of energy and activity.
author: Donald G. Mitchell

quote: An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory.
author: Friedrich Engels

quote: Action is the only reality  not only reality but morality  as well.
author: Abbie Hoffman

quote: Life happens at the level of events  not words.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: Let us work as if success depended upon ourselves alone  but with heartfelt conviction that we are doing nothing  and God everything.
author: Saint Ignatius of Loyola

quote: Right action is the key to good living.
author: Twelve Steps and

quote: Even if you're on the right track  you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: If faith without works is dead  willingness without action is fantasy.
author: Anonymous

quote: Inspirations never go in for long engagements  they demand immediate marriage to action.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: The door of opportunity won't open unless you do some pushing.
author: Anonymous

quote: The life of the spirit is centrally and essentially a life of action. Spirituality is something done  not merely something believed  or known or experienced.
author: Mary McDermott Shideler

quote: It is a great piece of skill to know how to guide your luck  even while waiting for it.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: The man who has done nothing but wait for his ship to come in has already missed the boat.
author: Anonymous

quote: God doesn't make orange juice  God makes oranges.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: Learn to do thy part and leave the rest to Heaven.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: Trust in God and do something.
author: Mary Lyon

quote: God helps them that helps themselves.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The true secret of giving advice is  after you have honestly given it  to be perfectly indifferent whether it is taken or not and never persist in trying to set people right.
author: Hannah Whitall Smith

quote: The success of your presentation will be judged not by the knowledge you send but by what the listener receives.
author: Lily Walters

quote: He will hew the line of right  let the chips fall where they may.
author: Roscoe Conkling

quote: You take people as far as they will go  not as far as you would like them to go.
author: Jeannette Rankin

quote: Oh Lord  thou givest us everything  at the price of an effort.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: It's astonishing in this world how things don't turn out at all the way you expect them to.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: On God for all events depend  You cannot want when God's your friend. Weigh well your part and do your best  Leave to your Maker all the rest.
author: Nathaniel Cotton

quote: You  yourself  must make the effort. The buddhas are only teachers.
author: Buddhist proverb

quote: There is a time for all things  a time to preach and a time to pray  but those times have passed away  there is a time to fight  and that time has come!
author: General Peter Muhlenberg

quote: Doing what's right is no guarantee against misfortune.
author: William McFee

quote: It is not yours to finish the task  but neither are you free to take no part in it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Life has ... taught me not to expect success to be the inevitable result of my endeavors. She taught me to seek sustenance from the endeavor itself  but to leave the result to God.
author: Alan Paton

quote: That man is blest who does his best and leaves the rest  do not worry.
author: Charles F. Deems

quote: 'Tis man's to fight  but Heaven's to give success.
author: Homer

quote: If people are suffering  then they must look within themselves. ... Happiness is not something ready-made [Buddha] can give you. It comes from your own actions.
author: The Dalai Lama

quote: I am not bound to win  but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed  but I am bound to live up to what light I have.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: No way exists in the present to accurately determine the future effect of the least of our actions.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: In vain our labours are  whatsoe'er they be  unless God gives the Benediction.
author: Robert Herrick

quote: God alone can finish.
author: John Ruskin

quote: In all human affairs there are efforts  and there are results  and the strength of the effort is the measure of the result.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: God hasn't called me to be successful. He's called me to be faithful.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: An act of love that fails is just as much a part of the divine life as an act of love that succeeds  for love is measured by its own fullness  not by its reception.
author: Harold Loukes

quote: Happy people plan actions  they don't plan results.
author: Dennis Wholey

quote: On earth we have nothing to do with success or results  but only with being true to God  and for God. Defeat in doing right is nevertheless victory.
author: Frederick W. Robertson

quote: The man who has done his level best  and who is conscious that he has done his best  is a success  even though the world may write him down a failure.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: To create is to boggle the mind and alter the mood. Once the urge has surged  it maintains its own momentum. We may go along for the ride  but when we attempt to steer the course  the momentum dies.
author: Sue Atchley Ebaugh

quote: Try first thyself  and after call in God  For to the worker God himself lends aid.
author: Euripides

quote: If thou workest at that which is before thee ... expecting nothing  fearing nothing  but satisfied with thy present activity according to Nature  and with heroic truth in every word and sound which thou utterest  thou wilt live happy. And there is no man who is able to prevent this.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It is the mark of great people to treat trifles as trifles and important matters as important.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: If it is your time  love will track you down like a cruise missile.
author: Lynda Barry

quote: You always feel when you look it straight in the eye that you could have put more into it  could have let yourself go and dug harder.
author: Emily Carr

quote: If you can react the same way to winning and losing  that's a big accomplishment. That quality is important because it stays with you the rest of your life.
author: Chris Evert

quote: You have striven so hard  and so long  to compel life. Can't you now slowly change  and let life slowly drift into you ... let the invisible life steal into you and slowly possess you.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Coercive power is the curse of the universe  coactive power  the enrichment and advancement of every human soul.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: I began to have an idea of my life  not as the slow shaping of achievement to fit my preconceived purposes  but as the gradual discovery and growth of a purpose which I did not know.
author: Joanna Field

quote: A guru might say that spiritual deepening involves a journey toward the unselfconscious living of life as it unfolds  rather than toward a willful determination to make it happen.
author: John Fortunato

quote: Events that are predestined require but little management. They manage themselves. They slip into place while we sleep  and suddenly we are aware that the thing we fear to attempt  is already accomplished.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: O golden Silence  bid our souls be still  and on the foolish fretting of our care lay thy soft touch of healing unaware!
author: Julia Dorr

quote: Stress is basically a disconnection from the earth  a forgetting of the breath. Stress is an ignorant state. It believes that everything is an emergency. Nothing is that important. Just lie down.
author: Natalie Goldberg

quote: When you learn not to want things so badly  life comes to you.
author: Jessica Lange

quote: No day is so bad it can't be fixed with a nap.
author: Carrie Snow

quote: Believe there is a great power silently working all things for good  behave yourself and never mind the rest.
author: Beatrix Potter

quote: One by one the sands are flowing  One by one the moments fall  Some are coming  some are going  Do not strive to grasp them all.
author: Adelaide Proctor

quote: Somehow  when we no longer feel in control  we become available to deeper aliveness.
author: Richard Moss

quote: Nothing fruitful ever comes when plants are forced to flower in the wrong season.
author: Bette Bao Lord

quote: The best direction is the least possible direction.
author: Joan Manley

quote: Coercion. The unpardonable crime.
author: Dorothy Miller Richardson

quote: People who make some other person part of their job are dangerous.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: We cannot alter facts  but we can alter our ways of looking at them.
author: Phyllis Bottome

quote: It had been my repeated experience that when you said to life calmly and firmly (but very firmly!) "I trust you  do what you must " life had an uncanny way of responding to your need.
author: Olga Ilyin

quote: It is easy and dismally enervating to think of opposition as merely perverse or actually evil-far more invigorating to see it as essential for honing the mind  and as a positive good in itself. For the day that moral issues cease to be fought over is the day the word "human" disappears from the race.
author: Jill Tweedie

quote: Living upon a basis of unsatisfied demands  we were in a state of continual disturbance and frustration. Therefore  no peace was to be had unless we could find a means of reducing these demands.
author: Anonymous

quote: You have freedom when you're easy in your harness.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The bird of paradise alights only upon the hand that does not grasp.
author: John Berry

quote: Life is made up of desires that seem big and vital one minute  and little and absurd the next. I guess we get what's best for us in the end.
author: Alice Caldwell Rice

quote: As the soft yield of water cleaves obstinate stone  So to yield with life solves the insolvable: To yield  I have learned  is to come back again.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: As your faith is strengthened  you will find that there is no longer the need to have a sense of control  that things will flow as they will  and that you will flow with them  to your great delight and benefit.
author: Emmanuel

quote: For peace of mind  resign as general manager of the universe.
author: Anonymous

quote: Eventually I lost interest in trying to control my life  to make things happen in a way that I thought I wanted them to be. I began to practice surrendering to the universe and finding out what "it" wanted me to do.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: It had been my repeated experience that when you said to life calmly and firmly (but very firmly!)  "I trust you  do what you must " life had an uncanny way of responding to your need.
author: Olga Ilyin

quote: Men never cling to their dreams with such tenacity as at the moment when they are losing faith in them  and know it  but do not dare yet to confess it to themselves.
author: William Graham Sumner

quote: So often we try to alter circumstances to suit ourselves  instead of letting them alter us.
author: Mother Maribel

quote: Willfulness must give way to willingness and surrender. Mastery must yield to mystery.
author: Gerald G. May

quote: The worst thing you can do is to try to cling to something that's gone  or to recreate it.
author: Johnette Napolitano

quote: I claim not to have controlled events  but confess plainly that events have controlled me.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Letting people be okay without us is how we get to be okay without them.
author: Merrit Malloy

quote: We are the wire  God is the current. Our only power is to let the current pass through us.
author: Carlo Carretto

quote: There are two kinds of people: those who say to God  "Thy will be done " and those to whom God says  "All right  then  have it your way."
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Here am I  send me.
author: Bible

quote: 'Tis God gives skill  but not without men's hands: he could not make Antonio Stradivarius violins without Antonio.
author: George Eliot

quote: I am like a little pencil in God's hand. He does the writing. The pencil has nothing to do with it.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Life is God's novel. Let him write it.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: I see not a step before me as I tread on another year  But I've left the Past in God's keeping  the Future His mercy shall clear  And what looks dark in the distance may brighten as I draw near.
author: Mary Gardiner Brainard

quote: To character and success  two things  contradictory as they may seem  must go together-humble dependence and manly independence: humble dependence on God  and manly reliance on self.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Whate'er we leave to God  God does and blesses us.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: God will help you if you try  and you can if you think you can.
author: Anna Delaney Peale

quote: Doing what is right isn't the problem  it's knowing what is right.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: Let each look to himself and see what God wants of him and attend to this  leaving all else alone.
author: Henry Suso

quote: If you can't help it  don't think about it.
author: Carmel Myers

quote: God tests His real friends more severely than the lukewarm ones.
author: Katheryn Hulme

quote: In vain our labours are  whatsoe'er they be  unless God gives the Benediction.
author: Robert Herrick

quote: Much that I sought  I could not find  much that I found  I could not bind  much that I bound  I could not free  much that I freed  returned to me.
author: Lee Wilson Dodd

quote: Wanna fly  you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: The soul will take that love and put it where it can best be used.
author: Emmanuel

quote: God alone can finish.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Be God or let God.
author: Anonymous

quote: With us is the Lord our God  to help us and to fight our battles.
author: Bible

quote: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in man.
author: Bible

quote: Cast thy burden on the Lord  and he shall sustain thee.
author: Bible

quote: But I trusted in thee  O Lord  I said  Thou art my God. My times are in thy hand.
author: Bible

quote: God's will is not an itinerary  but an attitude.
author: Andrew Dhuse

quote: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart  and lean not unto thine own understanding  in all thy ways acknowledge Him  and He shall direct thy paths.
author: Bible

quote: Casting all your care upon Him  for He careth for you.
author: Bible

quote: My life is ... a mystery which I do not attempt to really understand  as though 1 were led by the hand in a night where I see nothing  but can fully depend on the love and protection of Him who guides me.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Be like the bird that  passing on her flight awhile on boughs too slight  feels them give way beneath her  and yet sings  knowing that she hath wings.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: I come to the office each morning and stay for long hours doing what has to be done to the best of my ability. And when you've done the best you can  you can't do any better. So when I go to sleep I turn everything over to the Lord and forget it.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Even now I am full of hope  but the end lies in God.
author: Pindar

quote: Let us do or die.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Did nothing in particular And did it very well.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: He started to sing as he tackled the thing That couldn't be done  and he did it.
author: Edgar A. Guest

quote: Do well and right  and let the world sink.
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: Trust no future  howe'er pleasant! Let the dead past bury its dead! Act   - act in the living Present! Heart within and God o'erhead.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Let us then be up and doing  With a heart for any fate  Still achieving  still pursuing  Learn to labor and to wait.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Every man feels instinctively that all the beautiful sentiments in the world weigh less than a single lovely action.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: He nothing common did  or mean  Upon that memorable scene.
author: Andrew Marvell

quote: Go  and do thou likewise.
author: Bible

quote: So much to do  so little done.
author: Cecil Rhodes

quote: Get good counsel before you begin: and when you have decided  act promptly.
author: Sallust

quote: He that is overcautious will accomplish little.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: What's done can't be undone.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Heaven ne'er helps the men who will not act.
author: Sophocles

quote: Theirs not to make reply  Theirs not to reason why  Theirs but to do and die.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Out of the strain of the doing  Into the peace of the done.
author: Julia Woodruff

quote: Adam and Eve had many advantages  but the principal one was that they escaped teething.
author: S. L. Clemens

quote: Whilst Adam slept  Eve from his side arose  Strange his first sleep would be his last repose.
author: Anonymous

quote: When Adam dolve  and Eve span  Who was then the gentleman?
author: John Ball

quote: When Eve upon the first of men The apple pressed with specious cant  Oh! what a thousand pities then That Adam was not adamant.
author: Thomas Hood

quote: Adam ate the apple  and our teeth still ache.
author: Hungarian proverb

quote: In Adam's fall -  We sinned all.
author: New England Primer

quote: Admiration is a very short-lived passion  that immediately decays upon growing familiar with its object.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Our polite recognition of another's resemblance to ourselves.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Distance is a great promoter of admiration!
author: Denis Diderot

quote: We always love those who admire us  and we do not always love those whom we admire.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: For fools admire  but men of sense approve.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: An earthquake achieves what the law promises but does not in practice maintain - the equality of all men.
author: Ignazio Silone

quote: I don't deserve this award  but I have arthritis and I don't deserve that either.
author: Jack Benny

quote: I have an inward treasure born within me  which can keep me alive if all the extraneous delights should be withheld  or offered only at a price I cannot afford.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: Nothing is more desirable than to be released from an affliction  but nothing is more frightening than to be divested of a crutch.
author: James Baldwin

quote: People don't ever seem to realize that doing what's right is no guarantee against misfortune.
author: William McFee

quote: The struggle to the top is in itself enough to fulfill the human heart. Sisyphus should be regarded as happy.
author: Albert Camus

quote: There are three modes of bearing the ills of life: by indifference  by philosophy and by religion.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Weeping may endure for a night  but joy cometh in the morning.
author: Bible

quote: Night brings our troubles to the light rather than banishes them.
author: Seneca

quote: Too much happens ... Man performs  engenders so much more than he can or should have to bear. That's how he finds that he can bear anything.
author: William Faulkner

quote: A great man does not lose his self-possession when he is afflicted  the ocean is not made muddy by the falling in of its banks.
author: Panchatantra

quote: I've had an unhappy life  thank God.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Do not show your wounded finger  for everything will knock up against it.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: They sicken of the calm that know the storm.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

quote: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience  but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Great occasions do not make heroes or cowards  they simply unveil them to the eyes of men. Silently and imperceptibly  as we wake or sleep  we grow strong or weak  and at last some crisis shows what we have become.
author: Brooke Foss Westcott

quote: What does not destroy me  makes me strong.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: I long ago came to the conclusion that all life is six to five against.
author: Damon Runyon

quote: (Adversity is) the state in which a man most easily becomes acquainted with himself  being especially free from admirers then.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Adversity has the same effect on a man that severe training has on the pugilist - it reduces him to his fighting weight.
author: Josh Billings

quote: From a fallen tree  all make kindling.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: The virtue of prosperity is temperance  the virtue of adversity is fortitude  which in morals is the heroical virtue.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.
author: Sophocles

quote: No untroubled day has ever dawned for me.
author: Seneca

quote: You can't have more bugs than a blanketful.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Even in the deepest sinking there is the hidden purpose of an ultimate rising. Thus it is for all men  from none is the source of light withheld unless he himself withdraws from it. Therefore the most important thing is not to despair.
author: Hasidic saying

quote: Trouble will rain on those who are already wet.
author: Anonymous

quote: They say a reasonable amount o' fleas is good for a dog - it keeps him from broodin' over bein' a dog mebbe.
author: Edward Noyes Westcott

quote: There is nothing the body suffers which the soul may not profit by.
author: George Meredith

quote: The burden is equal to the horse's strength.
author: The Talmud

quote: Nothing befalls a man except what is in his nature to endure.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: I am escaped by the skin of my teeth.
author: Bible

quote: Prosperity tries the fortunate  adversity the great.
author: Pliny the Younger

quote: Be willing to have it so  acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequences of any misfortune.
author: William James

quote: If all our misfortunes were laid in one common heap  whence every one must take an equal portion  most people would be content to take their own and depart.
author: Solon

quote: I never knew any man in my life who could not bear another's misfortunes perfectly like a Christian.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: When the world has once begun to use us ill  it afterwards continues the same treatment with less scruple or ceremony  as men do to a whore.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there?
author: Bible

quote: Every difficulty slurred over will be a ghost to disturb your repose later on.
author: Fridiric Chopin

quote: Fire tries gold  misfortune men.
author: Anonymous

quote: The fiery trials through which we pass will light us down in honour or dishonour to the latest generation.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Thou hast shown thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.
author: Bible

quote: A wounded deer leaps the highest.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: The difficulties which I meet with in order to realize my existence are precisely what awaken and mobilize my activities  my capacities.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Whenever there is chaos  it creates wonderful thinking. I consider chaos a gift.
author: Septima Poinsette Clark

quote: I have always been pushed by the negative.... The apparent failure of a play sends me back to my typewriter that very night  before the reviews are out. I am more compelled to get back to work than if I had a success.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: What we want is never simple.
author: Linda Pastan

quote: For me life is a challenge. And it will be a challenge if I live to be a hundred or if I get to be a trillionaire.
author: Beah Richards

quote: To be thrown upon one's own resources is to be cast into the very lap of fortune  for our faculties then undergo a development and display an energy of which they were previously unsusceptible.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Every failure made me more confident. Because I wanted even more to achieve things  as revenge. To show that I could.
author: Roman Polanski

quote: Adversity is  to me at least  a tonic and a bracer.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: Difficulties should act as a tonic. They should spur us to greater exertion.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: There are times in everyone's life when something constructive is born out of adversity ... when things seem so bad that you've got to grab your fate by the shoulders and shake it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Brave men rejoice in adversity  just as brave soldiers triumph in war.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Some minds seem almost to create themselves  springing up under every disadvantage and working their solitary but irresistible way through a thousand obstacles.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Every calamity is a spur and valuable hint.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Treasure the memories of past misfortunes  they constitute our bank of fortitude.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: If you will call your troubles experiences  and remember that every experience develops some latent force within you  you will grow vigorous and happy  however adverse your circumstances may seem to be.
author: John Heywood

quote: Necessity is often the spur to genius.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Necessity is the mother of "taking chances."
author: Mark Twain

quote: Necessity makes even the timid brave.
author: Sallust

quote: People wish to be settled  only as far as they are unsettled is there any hope for them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Difficulties are meant to rouse  not discourage. The human spirit is to grow strong by conflict.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Adversity causes some men to break  others to break records.
author: William A. Ward

quote: I think there is this about the great troubles - they teach us the art of cheerfulness  whereas the small ones cultivate the industry of discontent.
author: Mary Adams

quote: Opposition inflames the enthusiast  never converts him.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: The thought that we are enduring the unendurable is one of the things that keeps us going.
author: Molly Haskell

quote: If you do things well  do them better. Be daring  be first  be different  be just.
author: Anita Roddick

quote: A certain amount of opposition is a great help to a man  it is what he wants and must have to be good for anything. Hardship and opposition are the native soil of manhood and self-reliance.
author: John Neal

quote: Difficulties  opposition  criticism -  these things are meant to be overcome  and there is a special joy in facing them and in coming out on top. It is only when there is nothing but praise that life loses its charm and I begin to wonder what I should do about it.
author: Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit

quote: They sicken of calm  who know the storm.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Without the burden of afflictions it is impossible to reach the height of grace. The gift of grace increases as the struggles increase.
author: Saint Rose of Lima

quote: When the going gets tough  the tough get going.
author: Frank Leahy

quote: The effects of opposition are wonderful. There are men who rise refreshed on hearing of a threat  men to whom a crises  which intimidates and paralyzes the majority  comes as graceful and beloved as a bride!
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Remember that the Devil doesn't sleep  but seeks our ruin in a thousand different ways
author: Angela Merici

quote: Down you mongrel  Death! Back into your kennel!
author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

quote: He that wrestles with us strengthens our nerves and sharpens our skills. Our antagonist is our helper.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The block of granite which was an obstacle in the path of the weak becomes a steppingstone in the path of the strong.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Strong people are made by opposition  like kites that go up against the wind.
author: Frank Harris

quote: Men strive for peace  but it is their enemies that give them strength  and I think if man no longer had enemies  he would have to invent them  for his strength only grows from struggle.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: You'll never find a better sparring partner than adversity.
author: Walt Schmidt

quote: The English nation is never so great as in adversity.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Enemies can be an incentive to survive and become someone in spite of them. Enemies can keep you alert and aware.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Problems are the cutting edge that distinguishes between success and failure. Problems ... create our courage and wisdom.
author: M. Scott Peck

quote: It is often better to have a great deal of harm happen to one than a little  a great deal may rouse you to remove what a little will only accustom you to endure.
author: Grenville Kleiser

quote: When things come to the worse  they generally mend.
author: Susanna Moodie

quote: Things have got to be wrong in order that they may be deplored.
author: Whitney Griswold

quote: Remorse begets reform.
author: William Cowper

quote: "The world is a wheel always turning " philosophized Mrs. Pelz. "Those who were high go down low  and those who've been low go up higher."
author: Anzia Yezierska

quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: It constantly happens that the Lord permits a soul to fall so that it may grow humbler.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: In order to change  we must be sick and tired of being sick and tired.
author: Anonymous

quote: I have been in sorrow's kitchen and licked out all the pots. Then I have stood on the peaky mountain wrapped in rainbows  with a harp and sword in my hands.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: There is often in people to whom "the worst" has happened an almost transcendent freedom  for they have faced "the worst" and survived it.
author: Carol Pearson

quote: I didn't know I'd have to be torn down before I could be built up.
author: Anonymous

quote: Suffering! ... We owe to it all that is good in us  all that gives value to life  we owe to it pity  we owe to it courage  we owe to it all the virtues.
author: Anatole France

quote: It is only the women whose eyes have been washed clear with tears who get the broad vision that makes them little sisters to all the world.
author: Dorothy Dix

quote: Much of your pain is the bitter potion by which the physician within you heals your sick self.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Man cannot remake himself without suffering  for he is both the marble and the sculptor.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls  the most massive characters are seared with scars.
author: Edwin H. Chapin

quote: The pain of love is the pain of being alive. It is a perpetual wound.
author: Maureen Duffy

quote: There is no coming to consciousness without pain.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Everybody's heart is open  you know  when they have recently escaped from severe pain  or are recovering the blessing of health.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Suffering is the sole origin of consciousness.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: Pain makes man think. Thought makes man wise. Wisdom makes life endurable.
author: John Patrick

quote: Time engraves our faces with all the tears we have not shed.
author: Natalie Clifford Barney

quote: Suffering raises up those souls that are truly great  it is only small souls that are made mean-spirited by it.
author: Alexandra David-Neel

quote: To live is to suffer  to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
author: Roberta Flack

quote: If you suffer  thank God! It is a sure sign that you are alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Suffering is also one of the ways of knowing you're alive.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: Don't look forward to the day when you stop suffering. Because when it comes  you'll know you're dead.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: How sublime a thing it is to suffer and be strong.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: He disposes Doom who hath suffered him.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: They merit more praise who know how to suffer misery than those who temper themselves in contentment.
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened  vision cleared  ambition inspired  and success achieved.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Never to suffer would have been never to have been blessed.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: It is somehow reassuring to discover that the word "travel" is derived from "travail " denoting the pains of childbirth.
author: Jessica Mitford

quote: True knowledge comes only through suffering.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Suffering raises up those souls that are truly great  it is only small souls that are made mean-spirited by it.
author: Alexandra David-Neel

quote: He disposes Doom who hath suffered him.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Suffering has always been with us  does it really matter in what form it comes? All that matters is how we bear it and how we fit it into our lives.
author: Etty Hillesum

quote: We are healed of a suffering only by experiencing it to the full.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Those who have suffered understand suffering and therefore extend their hand.
author: Patti Smith

quote: The saints rejoiced at injuries and persecutions  because in forgiving them they had something to present to God when they prayed to Him.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: The difficulties and struggles of today are but the price we must pay for the accomplishments and victories of tomorrow.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: Experience may be hard but we claim its gifts because they are real  even though our feet bleed on its stones.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: And I think that's important  to know how the water's gone over the dam before you start to describe it. It helps to have been over the dam yourself.
author: E. Annie Proulx

quote: I think these difficult times have helped me to understand better than before how infinitely rich and beautiful life is in every way that so many things that one goes around worrying about are of no importance whatsoever.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: Problems are the price of progress. Don't bring me anything but trouble.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quote: Trouble is the thing that strong men grow by. Met in the right way  it is a sure-fire means of putting iron into the victim's will and making him a tougher man to down forever after.
author: H. Bertram Lewis

quote: Every time you meet a situation  though you think at the time it is an impossibility and you go through the torture of the damned  once you have met it and lived through it  you find that forever after you are freer than you were before.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: I have always fought for ideas - until I learned that it isn't ideas but grief  struggle  and flashes of vision which enlighten.
author: Margaret Anderson

quote: I have learned in the great University of Hard Knocks a philosophy that no woman who has had an easy life ever acquires. I have learned to live each day as it comes  and not to borrow trouble by dreading tomorrow. It is the dark menace of the future that makes cowards of us.
author: Dorothy Dix

quote: Discontent and disorder were signs of energy and hope  not of despair.
author: C. V. Wedgwood

quote: We say: mad with joy. We should say: wise with grief.
author: Marguerite Yourcenar

quote: There are some things you learn best in calm  and some in storm.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Discontent is the first step in the progress of a man or a nation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Were there none who were discontented with what they have  the world would never reach anything better.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: Woman's discontent increases in exact proportion to her development.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: Restlessness is discontent  and discontent is the first necessity of progress.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Noble discontent is the path to heaven.
author: Thomas W. Higginson

quote: No pain  no palm  no thorns  no throne  no gall  no glory  no cross  no crown.
author: William Penn

quote: Times of stress and difficulty are seasons of opportunity when the seeds of progress are sown.
author: Thomas F. Woodlock

quote: The gem cannot be polished without friction  nor man perfected without trials.
author: Confucius

quote: As there is no worldly gain without some loss  so there is no worldly loss without some gain.... Set the allowance against the loss  and thou shalt find no loss great.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: Never complain about your troubles  they are responsible for more than half of your income.
author: Robert R. Updegraff

quote: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: Emergencies have always been necessary to progress. It was darkness which produced the lamp. It was fog that produced the compass. It was hunger that drove us to exploration. And it took a depression to teach us the real value of a job.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Many men owe the grandeur of their lives to their tremendous difficulties.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: It is often hard to distinguish between the hard knocks in life and those of opportunity.
author: Frederick Phillips

quote: Fire is the test of gold  adversity of strong men.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: I think my biggest achievement is that after going through a rather difficult time  I consider myself comparatively sane. I'm proud of that.
author: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

quote: To be tested is good. The challenged life may be the best therapist.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: I think hearts are very much like glasses - if they do not break with the first ring  they usually last a considerable time.
author: L. E. Landon

quote: Your first big trouble can be a bonanza if you live through it. Get through the first trouble  and you'll probably make it through the next one.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: Calamity is the test of integrity.
author: Richardson

quote: The secret of a leader lies in the tests he has faced over the whole course of his life and the habit of action he develops in meeting those tests.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: The fiery trials through which we pass will light us down in honor or dishonor to the last generation.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Our trials are tests  our sorrows pave the way for a fuller life when we have earned it.
author: Jerome P. Fleishman

quote: Times of general calamity and confusion have ever been productive of the greatest minds. The purist ore is produced from the hottest furnace  and the brightest thunderbolt is elicited from the darkest storms.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The habits of a vigorous mind are formed in contending with difficulties.
author: Abigail Adams

quote: A diamond is a chunk of coal that made good under pressure.
author: Anonymous

quote: A clay pot sitting in the sun will always be a clay pot. It has to go through the white heat of the furnace to become porcelain.
author: Mildred W. Struven

quote: It is the surmounting of difficulties that makes heroes.
author: Kossuth

quote: Men habitually use only a small part of the powers which they possess and which they might use under appropriate circumstances.
author: William James

quote: It is the north wind that lashes men into Vikings  it is the soft  luscious south wind which lulls them to lotus dreams.
author: Ouida

quote: It is grief that develops the powers of the mind.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Unless a man has been kicked around a little  you can't really depend upon him to amount to anything.
author: William Feather

quote: Troubles cured you salty as a country ham  smoky to the taste  thick-skinned and tender inside.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: If you have to be careful because of oppression and censorship  this pressure produces diamonds.
author: Tatyana Tolstaya

quote: Adversity is another way to measure the greatness of individuals. I never had a crisis that didn't make me stronger.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: It is not in the still calm of life  or the repose of a pacific station  that great characters are formed. ... Great necessities call out great virtues.
author: Abigail Adams

quote: Of all the advantages which come to any young man ... poverty is the greatest.
author: Josiah G. Holland

quote: My luck was my father not striking oil... we'd have been rich. I'd never have set out for Hollywood with my camera  and I'd have had a lot less interesting life.
author: King Vidor

quote: [A difficult childhood gave me] a kind of cocky confidence. ... I could never have so little that I hadn't had less. It took away my fear.
author: Jacqueline Cochran

quote: If you have been sunned through and through like an apricot on a wall from your earliest days  you are oversensitive to any withdrawal of heat.
author: Margot Asquith

quote: I was lucky I wasn't a better boxer  or that's what I'd be now - a punchy ex-pug.
author: Bob Hope

quote: At every step the child should be allowed to meet the real experience of life  the thorns should never be plucked from his roses.
author: Ellen Key

quote: Hot water is my native element. I was in it as a baby  and I have never seemed to get out of it ever since.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: When I was very young  I tried selling used cars. It didn't last long. I guess that was my good luck too  that I didn't show more promise at it  or I might have been an automobile dealer.
author: King Vidor

quote: Supporting myself at an early age was the best training for life I could have possibly received.
author: Lea Thompson

quote: In my youth  poverty enriched me  but now I can afford wealth.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: I'm very grateful that I was too poor to get to art school until I was 21. ... I was old enough when I got there to know how to get something out of it.
author: Henry Moore

quote: The most valuable gift I ever received was ... the gift of insecurity ... my father left us. My mother's love might not have prepared me for life the way my father's departure did. He forced us out on the road  where we had to earn our bread.
author: Lillian Gish

quote: Americans are like a rich father who wishes he knew how to give his sons the hardships that made him rich.
author: Robert Frost

quote: I would never have amounted to anything were it not for adversity. I was forced to come up the hard way.
author: J. C. Penney

quote: Adversity introduces a man to himself.
author: Anonymous

quote: I thank God for my handicaps for  through them  I have found myself  my work  and my God.
author: Helen Keller

quote: When one's own problems are unsolvable and all best efforts are frustrated  it is lifesaving to listen to other people's problems.
author: Suzanne Massie

quote: This struggle of people against their conditions  this is where you find the meaning in life.
author: Rose Chernin

quote: Adversity has ever been considered as the state in which a man most easily becomes acquainted with himself  being free from flatterers.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: In all things preserve integrity  and the consciousness of thine own uprightness will alleviate the toil of business  soften the hardness of ill-success and disappointments  and give thee an humble confidence before God  when the ingratitude of man  or the iniquity of the times may rob thee of other rewards.
author: Barbara Paley

quote: He knows not his own strength who hath not met adversity.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Adversity leads us to think properly of our state  and so is most beneficial to us.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: In the depth of winter  I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Who hath not known ill fortune  never knew himself  or his own virtue.
author: David Mallett

quote: Adversity is the trial of principle. Without it a man hardly knows whether he is honest or not.
author: Henry Fielding

quote: I think the years I have spent in prison have been the most formative and important in my life because of the discipline  the sensations  but chiefly the opportunity to think clearly  to try to understand things.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: We only really face up to ourselves when we are afraid.
author: Thomas Bernhard

quote: Difficulties are things that show what men are.
author: Epictetus

quote: Even if misfortune is only good for bringing a fool to his senses  it would still be just to deem it good for something.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Never does a man know the force that is in him till some mighty affection or grief has humanized the soul.
author: Frederick W. Robertson

quote: Disappointment is the nurse of wisdom.
author: Sir Boyle Roche

quote: Challenges make you discover things about yourself that you never really knew. They're what make the instrument stretch  what make you go beyond the norm.
author: Cicely Tyson

quote: A woman is like a tea bag: you never know her strength until you drop her in hot water.
author: Nancy Reagan

quote: Trouble brings experience  and experience brings wisdom.
author: Anonymous

quote: A woman has got to love a bad man once or twice in her life to be thankful for a good one.
author: Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings

quote: Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents  which  in prosperous circumstances  would have lain dormant.
author: Horace

quote: Adversity is a severe instructor. ... He that wrestles with us strengthens our nerves and sharpens our skill. Our antagonist is our helper.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Experience is a good teacher  but she sends in terrific bills.
author: Minna Antrim

quote: Forget the times of your distress  but never forget what they taught you.
author: Herbert Gasser

quote: You can learn little from victory. You can learn everything from defeat.
author: Christy Mathewson

quote: A smooth sea never made a skillful mariner.
author: English proverb

quote: When a man is pushed  tormented  defeated  he has a chance to learn something  he has been put on his wits ... he has gained facts  learned his ignorance  is cured of the insanity of conceit  has got moderation and real skill.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: From their errors and mistakes  the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
author: Plutarch

quote: By becoming more unhappy  we sometimes learn how to be less so.
author: Madame Swetchine

quote: Every experience  however bitter  has its lesson  and to focus one's attention on the lesson helps one overcome the bitterness.
author: Edward Howard Griggs

quote: A good scare is worth more to a man than good advice.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: It is from the level of calamities ... that we learn impressive and useful lessons.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: When I have listened to my mistakes  I have grown.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: We only think when we are confronted with a problem.
author: John Dewey

quote: Adversity comes with instruction in its hand.
author: Anonymous

quote: Mistakes are often the best teachers.
author: James A. Froude

quote: Pain  indolence  sterility  endless ennui have also their lesson for you.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Prosperity is a great teacher  adversity is a greater. Possession pampers the mind  privation trains and strengthens it.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Wisdom comes by disillusionment.
author: George Santayana

quote: You have learned something. That always feels at first as if you had lost something.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: I have always grown from my problems and challenges  from the things that don't work out. That's when I've really learned.
author: Carol Burnett

quote: Those things that hurt  instruct.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Pain is the root of knowledge.
author: Simone Weil

quote: Life can be real tough ... you can either learn from your problems  or keep repeating them over and over.
author: Marie Osmond

quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Prosperity is not without many fears and distastes  and adversity is not without comforts and hopes.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: If we had no winter  the spring would not be so pleasant  if we did not sometimes taste of adversity  prosperity would not be so welcome.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: The good things that belong to prosperity are to be wished  but the good things that belong to adversity are to be admired.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: One who was adored by all in prosperity is abhorred by all in adversity.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Prosperity provideth  but adversity proveth friends.
author: Queen Elizabeth I

quote: The human race has had long experience and a fine tradition in surviving adversity. But we now face a task for which we have little experience  the task of surviving prosperity.
author: Alan Gregg

quote: Adversity reveals genius  prosperity conceals it.
author: Horace

quote: The virtue of prosperity is temperance  the virtue of adversity is fortitude.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: In the day of prosperity be joyful  but in the day of adversity consider.
author: Bible

quote: In victory even the cowardly like to boast  while in adverse times even the brave are discredited.
author: Sallust

quote: Adversity is sometimes hard upon a man  but for one man who can stand prosperity  there are a hundred that will stand adversity.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Some knowledge and some song and some beauty must be kept for those days before the world again plunges into darkness.
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

quote: There is not enough darkness in all the world to put out the light of even one small candle.
author: Robert Alden

quote: Hope begins in the dark  the stubborn hope that if you just show up and try to do the right thing  the dawn will come. You wait and watch and work: you don't give up.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: Truth  like the burgeoning of a bulb under the soil  however deeply sown  will make its way to the light.
author: Ellis Peters

quote: Flowers grow out of dark moments.
author: Corita Kent

quote: I have brightness in my soul  which strains toward Heaven. I am like a bird!
author: Jenny Lind

quote: When it is dark enough  you can see the stars.
author: Charles A. Beard

quote: All sorts of spiritual gifts come through privations  if they are accepted.
author: Janet Erskine Stuart

quote: There is nothing the body suffers which the soul may not profit by.
author: George Meredith

quote: Often God has to shut a door in our face  so that He can subsequently open the door through which He wants us to go.
author: Catharine Marshall

quote: God will not look you over for medals  degrees or diplomas  but for scars.
author: Anonymous

quote: He who serves God with what costs him nothing  will do very little service  you may depend on it.
author: Susan Warner

quote: There are three modes of bearing the ills of life: by indifference  by philosophy  and by religion.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Sorrow has its reward. It never leaves us where it found us.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The same reason makes a man a religious enthusiast that makes a man an enthusiast in any other way: an uncomfortable mind in an uncomfortable body.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Adversity introduces a man to himself.
author: Anonymous

quote: Constant success shows us but one side of the world  adversity brings out the reverse of the picture.
author: Walter Colton

quote: Prosperity is a great teacher  adversity is a greater. Possession pampers the mind  privation trains and strengthens it.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Sweet are the uses of adversity  Which  like the toad  ugly and venomous  Wears yet a precious jewel in his head.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: There is no education like adversity.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The incessant witless repetition of advertisers' moron-fodder has become so much a part of life that if we are not careful  we forget to be insulted by it.
author: The London Times

quote: There is no such thing as bad publicity except your own obituary.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: The advertisements in a newspaper are more full of knowledge in respect to what is going on in a state or community than the editorial columns are.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: If it doesn't sell  it isn't creative.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: In advertising not to be different is virtually suicidal.
author: Bill Bernback

quote: Advertising - a judicious mixture of flattery and threats.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Advertising may be described as the science of arresting the human intelligence long enough to get money from it.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: The best ad is a good product.
author: Alan H. Meyer

quote: The philosophy behind much advertising is based on the old observation that every man is really two men - the man he is and the man he wants to be.
author: William Feather

quote: The number of agency people required to shoot a commercial on location is in direct proportion to the mean temperature of the location.
author: Shelby Page

quote: Advertising is the most fun you can have with your clothes on.
author: Jerry Delia Femina

quote: Buy me and you will overcome the anxieties I have just reminded you of.
author: Michael Schudson

quote: If I were starting life over again  I am inclined to think that I would go into the advertising business in preference to almost any other. The general raising of standards of modern civilization among all groups of people during the past half-century would have been impossible without that spreading of the knowledge of higher standards by means of advertising.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Promise  large promise  is the soul of an advertisement.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The deeper problems connected with advertising come less from the unscrupulousness of our 'deceivers' than from our pleasure in being deceived  less from the desire to seduce than from the desire to be seduced.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: Ads are the cave art of the twentieth century.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: The advertisement is one of the most interesting and difficult of modern literary forms.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: What kills a skunk is the publicity it gives itself.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Few people at the beginning of the nineteenth century needed an adman to tell them what they wanted.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: The art of publicity is a black art.
author: Learned Hand

quote: Advertising is legalized lying.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Advertising is what you do when you can't go to see somebody. That's all it is.
author: Fairfax Cone

quote: The consumer is not a moron. She's your wife.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: When business is good it pays to advertise  when business is bad you've got to advertise.
author: Anonymous

quote: You can tell the ideals of a nation by its advertisements.
author: George Norman Douglas

quote: Advertisements contain the only truth to be relied on in a newspaper.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: But one must know where one stands  and where the others wish to go.
author: Goethe

quote: No man ever listened himself out of a job.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Thanksgiving comes after Christmas.
author: Peter Kreeft

quote: The proverb warns that  "You should not bite the hand that feeds you." But maybe you should  if it prevents you from feeding yourself.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: I remember my father telling me the story of the preacher delivering an exhortation to his flock  and as he reached the climax of his exhortation  a man in the front row got up and said  'O Lord  use me. Use me  O Lord - in an advisory capacity!'
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Be frank and explicit. That is the right line to take when you wish to conceal your own mind and to confuse the minds of others.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To make pleasure pleasant  shorten.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: Put all thine eggs in one basket and - watch that basket.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It has seemed to be more necessary to have regard to the weight of words rather than to their number.
author: Cicero

quote: Don't offer me advice  give me money.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: If you aren't rich  you should always look useful.
author: Louis-Ferdinand Celine

quote: He who can lick can bite.
author: French proverb

quote: When a man comes to me for advice  I find out the kind of advice he wants  and I give it to him.
author: Josh Billings

quote: We only make a dupe of the friend whose advice we ask  for we never tell him all  and it is usually what we have left unsaid that decides our conduct.
author: Diane de Poitiers

quote: I give myself  sometimes  admirable advice  but I am incapable of taking it.
author: Mary Wortley Montagu

quote: Advice is like snow  the softer it falls  the longer it dwells upon  and the deeper it sinks into  the mind.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The true secret of giving advice is  after you have honestly given it  to be perfectly indifferent whether it is taken or not and never persist in trying to set people right.
author: Hannah Whitall Smith

quote: 'Be yourself!' is about the worst advice you can give to some people.
author: Tom Masson

quote: A bull does not enjoy fame in two herds.
author: Rhodesian proverb

quote: The advice of the elders to young men is very apt to be as unreal as a list of the hundred best books.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Fewer things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A good scare is worth more to a man than good advice.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: There is little serenity comparable to the serenity of the inexperienced giving advice to the experienced.
author: Anonymous

quote: Advice is seldom welcome  and those who want it the most always like it the least.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: It is well enough  when one is talking to a friend  to lodge in an odd word by way of counsel now and then  but there is something mighty irksome in its staring upon one in a letter  where one ought to see only kind words and friendly remembrances.
author: Mary Lamb

quote: Men of much depth of mind can bear a great deal of counsel  for it does not easily deface their own character  nor render their purposes indistinct.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: Have more than thou showest  Speak less than thou knowest.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: What you don't see with your eyes  don't invent with your tongue.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: If you keep your mind sufficiently open  people will throw a lot of rubbish into it.
author: William A. Orton

quote: Don't fight forces  use them.
author: Buckminster Fuller

quote: Drink nothing without seeing it  sign nothing without reading it.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: What is important is to keep learning  to enjoy challenge  and to tolerate ambiguity. In the end there are no certain answers.
author: Marina Horner

quote: Simplicity  simplicity  simplicity. I say  let your affairs be as two or three  and not a hundred or a thousand  instead of a million count half a dozen  and keep your accounts on your thumbnail.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: You must not think  sir  to catch old birds with chaff.
author: Cervantes

quote: Never give advice in a crowd.
author: Arab proverb

quote: Never give advice unless asked.
author: German proverb

quote: Whatever advice you give  be short.
author: Horace

quote: Old men are fond of giving good advice  to console themselves for being no longer in a position to give bad examples.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: We give advice  but we do not inspire conduct.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Good counsel has no price.
author: Guiseppe Mazzini

quote: Never advise anyone to go to war or to marry.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Many receive advice  only the wise profit by it.
author: Syrus

quote: Admonish your friends privately  but praise them openly.
author: Syrus

quote: The eternal stars shine out as soon as it is dark enough.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth.
author: Bible

quote: Be still  sad heart  and cease repining  Behind the clouds the sun is shining  Thy fate is the common fate of all  Into each life some rain must fall  -  Some days must be dark and dreary.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: It is always in season for old men to learn.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Youth is a blunder  Manhood a struggle  Old Age a regret.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To know how to grow old is the master work of wisdom  and one of the most difficult chapters in the great art of living.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Old wood best to burn  old wine to drink  old friends to trust  and old authors to read.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: At 20 years of age the will reigns  at 30 the wit  at 40 the judgment.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: If wrinkles must be written upon our brows  let them not be written upon the heart. The spirit should not grow old.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: The riders in a race do not stop short when they reach the goal. There is a little finishing canter before coming to a standstill. There is time to hear the kind voice of friends and to say to one's self: "The work is done."
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Study until twenty-five  investigation until forty  profession until sixty  at which age I would have him retired on a double allowance.
author: William Osier

quote: In youth the days are short and the years are long  in old age the years are short and the days long.
author: Panin

quote: The days of our years are threescore years and ten  and if by reason of strength they be fourscore years  yet is their strength labour and sorrow  for it is soon cut off  and we fly away.
author: Bible

quote: The first forty years of life give us the text  the next thirty supply the commentary on it.
author: Schopenhauer

quote: Age cannot wither her  nor custom stale Her infinite variety.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: An old man is twice a child.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The old believe everything: the middle-aged suspect everything: the young know everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Age and treachery will triumph over youth and skill.
author: Anonymous

quote: All the best sands of my life are somehow getting into the wrong end of the hourglass. If I could only reverse it! Were it in my power to do so  would I?
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: All would live long  but none would be old.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: An old man concludeth from his knowing mankind that they know him too  and that maketh him very wary.
author: George Saville

quote: An old man loved is Winter with flowers.
author: German proverb

quote: An older author is constantly rediscovering himself in the more or less fossilized productions of his earlier years.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: But  Lord Crist! whan that it remembreth me Upon my yowthe  and on my jolitee  It tickleth me aboute myn herte roote. Unto this day it dooth myn herte boote That I have had my world as in my tyme. But age  alias! that al wole envenyme  Hath me biraft my beautee and my pith. Lat go  farewel! the devel go therwith! The flour is goon  ther is namoore to telle  The bren  as I best kan  now most I selle.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: Grow old with me! The best is yet to be  The last of life  for which the first was made: Our times are in his hands Who sayeth "a whole I plant  Youth shows but half  Trust God  see all nor be afraid."
author: Robert Browning

quote: Growing old is like being increasingly penalized for a crime you have not committed.
author: Anthony Powell

quote: Here's a new day. 0 Pendulum move slowly!
author: Harold Munro

quote: I am 65 and I guess that puts me in with the geriatrics. But if there were 15 months in every year  I'd only be 48. That's the trouble with us. We number everything. Take women  for example  I think they deserve to have more than 12 years between the ages of 28 and 40.
author: James Thurber

quote: I am just turning 40 and taking my time about it.
author: Harold Lloyd

quote: I haven't asked you to make me young again. All I want is to go on getting older.
author: Konrad Adenauer

quote: I refuse to admit that I am more than 52  even if that makes my sons illegitimate.
author: Nancy Lady Astor

quote: If I'd known I was gonna live this long (100 years)  I'd have taken better care of myself.
author: James Hubert Blake

quote: If the young only knew  if the old only could.
author: French saying

quote: Is it not strange that desire should so many years outlive performance?
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Middle age snuffs out more talent than even wars or sudden deaths do.
author: Richard Hughes

quote: Old age is the Outpatient's Dept of purgatory.
author: Lord Cecil

quote: Old age takes away from us what we have inherited and gives us what we have earned.
author: Gerald Brenan

quote: The difference between being an elder statesman And posing successfully as an elder statesman Is practically negligible.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: The old repeat themselves and the young have nothing to say. The boredom is mutual.
author: Jacques Bainville

quote: There is many a good tune played on an old fiddle.
author: Old saying

quote: Time goes by: reputation increases  ability declines.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled  to be hopeful  kindly  cheerful  reverent -that is to triumph over old age.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: We do not die wholly at our deaths: we have moldered away gradually long before. Faculty after faculty  interest after interest  attachment after attachment disappear: we are torn from ourselves while living.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Wrinkles - the service stripes of life.
author: Anonymous

quote: To be seventy years young is sometimes far more cheerful and hopeful than to be forty years old.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: One of the delights known to age  and beyond the grasp of youth  is that of 'not going'!
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: A man of sixty has spent twenty years in bed and over three years in eating.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: The role of a retired person is no longer to possess one.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Middle age: when you're sitting at home on Saturday night and the telephone rings and you hope it isn't for you.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: No Spring  nor Summer beauty hath such grace  As I have seen in one Autumnal face.
author: John Donne

quote: If you live long enough the venerability factor creeps in  you get accused of things you never did and praised for virtues you never had.
author: I. F. Stone

quote: I advise you to go on living solely to enrage those who are paying your annuities. It is the only pleasure I have left.
author: Voltaire

quote: Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy man has no time to form.
author: Andri Maurois

quote: Old age is an island surrounded by death.
author: Juan Montalvo

quote: It is time to be old  To take in sail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I feel age like an icicle down my back.
author: Dyson Carter

quote: Old age is a time of humiliations  the most disagreeable of which  for me  is that I cannot work long at sustained high pressure with no leaks in concentration.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: Dignity  high station  or great riches are in some sort necessary to old men  in order to keep the younger at a distance  who are otherwise too apt to insult them upon the score of their age.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: The young feel tired at the end of an action  The old at the beginning.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Old foxes want no tutors.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Old birds are hard to pluck.
author: German proverb

quote: A man of fifty looks as old as Santa Claus to a girl of twenty.
author: William Feather

quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?
author: Satchel Paige

quote: The young always have the same problem - how to rebel and conform at the same time. They have now solved this by defying their parents and copying one another.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: Before you contradict an old man  my fair friend  you should endeavour to understand him.
author: George Santayana

quote: Zsa Zsa Gabor  when asked which of the Gabor women was the oldest  said "She'll never admit it  but I believe it is Mama." When men grow virtuous in their old age  they only make a sacrifice to God of the devil's leavings.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: When you are forty  half of you belongs to the past. . . And when you are seventy  nearly all of you.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: To an old man any place that's warm is homeland.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: By the time a man gets well into his seventies his continued existence is a mere miracle.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: One trouble with growing older is that it gets progressively tougher to find a famous historical figure who didn't amount to much when he was your age.
author: Bill Vaughan

quote: Forty is the old age of youth  fifty is the youth of old age.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Middle age is youth without its levity  And age without decay.
author: Daniel Defoe

quote: And he (King David) died in a good old age  full of days  riches and honour.
author: Bible

quote: I never dared be radical when young For fear it would make me conservative when old.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Old age is by nature rather talkative.
author: Cicero
