quote: I don't believe in God because I don't believe in Mother Goose.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: The fool hath said in his heart  There is no God.
author: Bible

quote: That the universe was formed by a fortuitous concourse of atoms  I will no more believe than that the accidental jumbling of the alphabet would fall into a most ingenious treatise of philosophy.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: By night an atheist half believes in God.
author: Edward Young

quote: Audacity  more audacity  always audacity.
author: Georges Jacques Danton

quote: Fortune favors the audacious.
author: Erasmus

quote: Every great advance in natural knowledge has involved die absolute rejection of authority.
author: Anonymous

quote: All authority belongs to the people.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The highest duty is to respect authority.
author: Pope Leo

quote: He who writes prose builds his temple to Fame in rubble  he who writes verses builds it in granite.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: The pen is the tongue of the mind.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: The author who speaks about his own books is almost as bad as a mother who talks about her own children.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: An incurable itch for scribbling takes possession of many  and grows inveterate in their insane breasts.
author: Juvenal

quote: You do not publish your own verses  Laelius  you criticise mine. Pray cease to criticise mine  or else publish your own.
author: Martial

quote: The ink of the scholar is more sacred than the blood of the martyr.
author: Mohammed

quote: The melancholy days have come  the saddest of the year  Of wailing winds  and naked woods  and meadows brown and sear.
author: William Cullen Bryant

quote: The year's in the wane  There is nothing adoring  The night has no eve  And the day has no morning  Cold winter gives warning!
author: Thomas Hood

quote: O  it sets my heart a clickin' like the tickin' of a clock  When the frost is on the punkin and the fodder's in the shock.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

quote: What can you conceive more silly and extravagant than to suppose a man racking his brains  and studying night and day how to fly?
author: William Law

quote: The birds can fly  An' why can't I?
author: John Trowbridge

quote: He rode upon a cherub  and did fly: yea  he did fly upon the wings of the wind.
author: Bible

quote: Here we have baby. It is composed of a bald head and a pair of lungs.
author: Eugene Field

quote: Where did you come from  baby dear? Out of the Everywhere into here.
author: George Macdonald

quote: Rock-a-bye baby on the tree top  When the wind blows the cradle will rock  When the bough bends the cradle will fall  Down comes the baby  cradle and all.
author: Old Nursery Rhyme

quote: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength.
author: Bible

quote: Hush  my dear  lie still and slumber  Holy angels guard thy bed! Heavenly blessings without number Gently falling on thy head.
author: Isaac Watts

quote: Sweetest li'l feller  everybody knows  Dunno what to call him  but he's mighty lak' a rose  Lookin' at his mammy wid eyes so shiny blue Mek' you think that Heav'n is comin' clost ter you.
author: Frank L. Stanton

quote: A bachelor is one who enjoys the chase but does not eat the game.
author: Anonymous

quote: A bachelor is a souvenir of some woman who found a better one at the last minute.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best work  and of greatest merit for the public  has proceeded from the unmarried or childless men.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: A single man has not nearly the value he would have in a state of union. He is an incomplete animal. He resembles the odd half of a pair of scissors.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: By persistently remaining single a man converts himself into a permanent public temptation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A banker is a man who lends you an umbrella when the weather is fair  and takes it away from you when it rains.
author: Anonymous

quote: Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: It takes two to make a bargain.
author: English proverb

quote: It's a bad bargain where nobody gains.
author: English proverb

quote: The best of a bad bargain.
author: Samuel Pepys

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.
author: Jere Carlson

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.
author: Jere Carlson

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.
author: Jere Carlson

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.
author: Jere Carlson

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.
author: Jere Carlson

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.
author: Jere Carlson

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.
author: Jere Carlson

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Today at the beach I could feel the men dressing me with their eyes.
author: Jere Carlson

quote: And all the loveliest things there be Come simply  so it seems to me.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Beauty without expression tires.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Mathematics possesses not only truth  but supreme beauty - a beauty cold and austere  like that of a sculpture.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Remember that the most beautiful things in the world are the most useless  peacocks and lilies for instance.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Beauty is unbearable  drives us to despair  offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Beauty is potent but money is omnipotent.
author: Old saying

quote: Beauty is truth - truth  beauty - that is all Ye know on earth  and all ye need to know.
author: John Keats

quote: Ask a toad what is beauty? ... a female with two great round eyes coming out of her little head  a large flat mouth  a yellow belly and a brown back.
author: Voltaire

quote: Grace is the absence of everything that indicates pain or difficulty  hesitation or incongruity.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful  we must carry it with us or we find it not.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Beauty is an ecstacy  it is as simple as hunger. There is really nothing to be said about it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: As a beauty I am not a star  There are others more handsome by far  But my face - I don't mind it For I am behind it. It's the people in front get the jar.
author: Anthony Euwer

quote: Until I saw Chardin's painting  I never realized how much beauty lay around me in my parents' house  in the half-cleared table  in the corner of a tablecloth left awry  in the knife beside the empty oyster shell.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: The beauty of the animal form is in exact proportion to the amount of moral and intellectual virtue expressed by it.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Do you love me because I'm beautiful  or am I beautiful because you love me?
author: Oscar Hammerstein

quote: Beauty is everlasting And dust is for a time.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: Beauty  more than bitterness Makes the heart break.
author: Sara Teasdale

quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: We ascribe beauty to that which is simple  which has no superfluous parts  which exactly answers its ends.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Something wonderful and strange that the artist fashions out of the chaos of the world in the torment of his soul.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Beauty is the purgation of superfluities.
author: Michelangelo

quote: Beauty - the adjustment of all parts proportionately so that one cannot add or subtract or change without impairing the harmony of the whole.
author: Leon Battista Alberti

quote: Underneath this stone doth lie As much beauty as could die.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: A very beautiful woman hardly ever leaves a clear-cut impression of features and shape in the memory: usually there remains only an aura of living colour.
author: William Bolitho

quote: The excellence of every art is its intensity  capable of making all disagreeables evaporate  from their being in close relationship with beauty and truth.
author: John Keats

quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Exuberance is beauty.
author: William Blake

quote: The Nature of This Flower is to bloom.
author: Alice Walker

quote: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
author: Margaret Hungerford

quote: Some thoughts always find us young  and keep us so. Such a thought is the love of the universal and eternal beauty.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Let the beauty you love be what you do. There are a thousand ways to kneel and kiss the earth.
author: Rumi

quote: Beautiful is greater than Good  for it includes the Good.
author: Goethe

quote: The most natural beauty in the world is honesty and moral truth. For all beauty is truth.
author: Lord Shaftesbury

quote: To do the useful thing  to say the courageous thing  to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: I'm tired of all the nonsense about beauty being only skin-deep. That's deep enough. What do you want - an adorable pancreas?
author: Jean Kerr

quote: The fountain of beauty is the heart  and every generous thought illustrates the walls of your chamber.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: Beauty as we feel it is something indescribable  what it is or what it means can never be said.
author: George Santayana

quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: There is certainly no absolute standard of beauty. That precisely is what makes its pursuit so interesting.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever.
author: John Keats

quote: When your inner eyes open  you can find immense beauty hidden within the inconsequential details of daily life. When your inner ears open  you can hear the subtle  lovely music of the universe everywhere you go.
author: Timothy Ray Miller

quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful  we must carry it with us or we will not find it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
author: Lady Blessington

quote: That which is striking and beautiful is not always good  but that which is good is always beautiful.
author: Ninon de L'Enclos

quote: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever.
author: Keats Endymion

quote: Beauty is truth  truth beauty.
author: John Keats

quote: She walks in beauty like the night Of cloudless climes and starry skies  And all that's best of dark and bright Meet in her aspect and her eyes: Thus mellowed to that tender light Which heaven to gaudy day denies.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Beauty is power  a smile is its sword.
author: Charles Reade

quote: Remember that the most beautiful things in the world are the most useless  peacocks and lilies  for instance.
author: John Ruskin

quote: In bed we laugh  in bed we cry  And born in bed  in bed we die  The near approach a bed may show Of human bliss to human woe.
author: Isaac De Benserade

quote: As you make your bed you must lie in it.
author: English proverb

quote: The bed has become a place of luxury to me! I would not exchange it for all the thrones in the world.
author: Napoleon

quote: The bee is more honored than other animals  not because she labors  but because she labors for others.
author: St. Chrysostom

quote: The bee that hath honey in her mouth hath a sting in her tail.
author: John Lyly

quote: How doth the little busy bee Improve each shining hour  And gather honey all the day From every opening flower.
author: Isaac Watts

quote: Set a beggar on horseback  and he will ride a gallop.
author: Henry Burton

quote: Better a living beggar than a buried emperor.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Borrowing is not much better than begging.
author: Gotthold E. Lessing

quote: Well begun is half done.
author: Horace

quote: He that climbs a ladder must begin at the first round.
author: Walter Scott

quote: It is the beginning of the end.
author: Talleyrand

quote: The first step  my son  which one makes in the world  is the one on which depends the rest of our days.
author: Voltaire

quote: A youth with his first cigar makes himself sick  a youth with his first girl makes everybody sick.
author: Mary Wilson Little

quote: Love at first sight is easy to understand  it's when two people have been looking at each other for a lifetime that it becomes a miracle.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Love is what happens to men and women who don't know each other.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: To love deeply in one direction makes us more loving in all others.
author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

quote: No  this trick won't work. . . . How on earth are you ever going to explain in terms of chemistry and physics so important a biological phenomenon as first love?
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Love is. the flower of life  and blossoms unexpectedly and without law  and must be plucked where it is found  and enjoyed for the brief hour of its duration.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: First love is a kind of vaccination which saves a man from catching the complaint the second time.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: At the touch of love  everyone becomes a poet.
author: Plato

quote: Love is like quicksilver in the hand. Leave the fingers open and it stays. Clutch it  and it darts away.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Love is a madness  if thwarted it develops fast.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Love is like war  easy to begin but hard to end.
author: Anonymous

quote: Falling in love consists merely in uncorking the imagination and bottling the common-sense.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: I have learned not to worry about love  but to honor its coming with all my heart.
author: Alice Walker

quote: I believe in love  but I don't sit around waiting for it.
author: Renee Zellweger

quote: What is irritating about love is that it is a crime that requires an accomplice.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: I cannot fix on the hour  or the spot  or the look  or the words  which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun.
author: Fitzwilliam Darcy

quote: Many people when they fall in love look for a little haven of refuge from the world  where they can be sure of being admired when they are not admirable  and praised when they are not praiseworthy.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The art of love ... is largely the art of persistence.
author: Albert Ellis

quote: It is an extra dividend when you like the girl you've fallen in love with.
author: Clark Gable

quote: You can't buy love  but you can pay heavily for it.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: How delicious is the winning of a kiss at love's beginning.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: Love is a deep well from which you may drink often  but into which you may fall but once.
author: Ellye Howell Glover

quote: We don't believe in rheumatism and true love until after the first attack.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: Love is like an hourglass  with the heart filling up as the brain empties.
author: Jule Renard

quote: Gravitation cannot be held responsible for people falling in love.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I was nauseous and tingly all over. I was either in love or I had smallpox.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Love doesn't just sit there  like a stone  it has to be made  like bread  remade all the time  made new.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: Man reaches the highest point of lovableness at 12 to 17 - to get it back  in a second flowering  at the age of 70 to 90.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: Love is a smoke raised with the fume of sighs  Being purged  a fire sparkling in lovers' eyes  Being vex'd a sea nourish'd with lovers' tears: What is it else? a madness most discreet  A choking gall and a preserving sweet.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Men willingly believe what they wish.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Believe only half of what you see and nothing that you hear.
author: Dinah Mulock Craik

quote: A man must not swallow more beliefs than he can digest.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: He that believeth not shall be damned.
author: Bible

quote: Nothing is so firmly believed as what we least know.
author: Michel Montaigne

quote: She deceiving  I believing  What need lovers wish for more?
author: Sir Charles Sedley

quote: Curfew must not ring tonight.
author: Rosa H. Thorpe

quote: Those evening bells! those evening bells! How many a tale their music tells!
author: George Moore

quote: Ring out the old  ring in the new  Ring  happy bells  across the snow.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Biography is the only true history.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: One anecdote of a man is worth a volume of biography.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Lives of great men all remind us We can make our lives sublime  And  departing  leave behind us Footprints on the sands of time.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: To be ignorant of the lives of the most celebrated men of antiquity is to continue in a state of childhood all our days.
author: Plutarch

quote: Every great man nowadays has his disciples  and it is always Judas who writes the biography.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: O thrush  your song is passing sweet  But never a song that you have sung Is half so sweet as thrushes sang When my dear love and I were young.
author: William Morris

quote: Birds of a feather will flock together.
author: Minsheu

quote: And the Raven  never flitting  Still is sitting  still is sitting On the pallid bust of Pallas Just above my chamber door  And his eyes have all the seeming Of a demon's that is dreaming  And the lamplight o'er him streaming Throws his shadow on the floor  And my soul from out that shadow  That lies floating on the floor  Shall be lifted - nevermore.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Acorns are planted silently by some unnoticed breeze.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The egg it is the source of all To everyone's ancestral hall.
author: Clarence Day

quote: Being pregnant is a very boring six months. I am not particularly maternal. It's an occupational hazard of being a wife.
author: Princess Anne

quote: The government is concerned about the population explosion  and the population is concerned about the government explosion.
author: Ruth Rankin

quote: We have been God-like in our planned breeding of our domestic plants and animals  but rabbit-like in our unplanned breeding of ourselves.
author: Arnold Toynbee

quote: Some are born to sweet delight  Some are born to endless night.
author: William Blake

quote: In my beginning is my end.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: When I was born I did lament and cry And now each day doth shew the reason why.
author: Richard Watkyns

quote: Where  unwilling  dies the rose  Buds the new  another year.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Husbands don't really count ... in the miracle of birth.
author: Doug Spettigue

quote: And when I was born  I drew in the common air  and fell upon the earth  which is of like nature  and the first voice which I uttered was crying  as all others do . . . For all men have one entrance into life. The Apocrypha Monday's child is fair of face  Tuesday's child is full of grace  Wednesday's child is full of woe Thursday's child has far to go Friday's child is loving and giving  Saturday's child works hard for a living  But the child born on the Sabbath day Is happy and wise and good and gay.
author: Anonymous

quote: As the births of living creatures at first are ill-shapen  so are all innovations  which are the births of time.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Born on Monday  fair in the face  Born on Tuesday  full of God's grace  Born on Wednesday  sour and sad  Born on Thursday  merry and glad  Born on Friday  worthily given
author: Anonymous

quote: I can't tell you his age  but when he was born the wonder drug was Mercurochrome.
author: Milton Berle

quote: You know you're getting older when you don't care where your wife goes  just so you don't have to go along.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: Enjoy how sweet  how thoughtful  how kind I'm being on your birthday. Because tomorrow it's back to the same old crap.
author: Melvin Helitzer

quote: As one cat said to another: Birthdays are like fur balls - the more you have  the more you gag.
author: Maria Morgan

quote: You can live to be a hundred  if you give up all the things that make you want to live to a hundred.
author: Woody Allen

quote: She claims she just turned thirty  but it must have been a U-turn!
author: Elmer Pasta

quote: She's not pushing forty  she's dragging it.
author: Anonymous

quote: My wife never lies about her age. She just tells everyone she's as old as I am. Then she lies about my age.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Looking fifty is great - if you're sixty.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: Middle age is having a choice between two temptations and choosing the one that'll get you home earlier.
author: Dan Bennett

quote: For weeks I've been telling him not to buy anything for my birthday  and he still forgot to bring me something.
author: Tanya Noe

quote: The age of some women is like the speedometer on a used car - you know it's set back  but you don't know how far.
author: Anonymous

quote: What can you say when your husband says: 'You can't expect me to remember your birthday when you never look any older."
author: Toni Anderson

quote: The best contraceptive for old people is nudity.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: Pushing fifty is exercise enough.
author: Anonymous

quote: After thirty  a body has a mind of its own.
author: Bette Midler

quote: Of all the things I miss  the thing I miss the most is my mind.
author: Lotus Weinstock

quote: My health is good  it's my age that's bad.
author: Roy Acuff

quote: I stay away from natural foods. At my age I need all the preservatives I can get.
author: George Burns

quote: At eighty-eight how do you feel when getting up in the morning? . . . Amazed!
author: Ludwig von Mises

quote: Wisdom doesn't automatically come with old age. Nothing does - except wrinkles. It's true  some wines improve with age. But only if the grapes were good in the first place.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: He's so old his social security number is two digits.
author: Brian Morgan

quote: Sometimes I feel that I'm not just aging . . . I'm decomposing.
author: Fletcher Anderson

quote: My notion of a wife at forty is that a man should be able to change her  like a banknote  for two twenties.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Middle age is when your old classmates are so gray and wrinkled and bald they don't recognize you.
author: Bennett Cerf

quote: It's a sobering thought: When Mozart was my age  he had been dead for two years.
author: Tom Lehrer

quote: You know you're getting old when you stoop to tie your shoes and wonder what else you can do while you're down there.
author: George Burns

quote: When I think of my dad as a little boy  I tend to think of him in black and white.
author: Anonymous

quote: The really frightening thing about middle age is the knowledge that you'll grow out of it.
author: Doris Day

quote: I don't generally feel anything until noon  then it's time for my nap.
author: Bob Hope

quote: The years between fifty and seventy are the hardest. You are always asked to do things  and you are not yet decrepit enough to turn them down.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: It's an awful thing to grow old by yourself. My wife hasn't had a birthday in seven years.
author: Robert Orben

quote: I'm sixty-five  but if there were fifteen months in every year  I'd only be forty-eight.
author: James Thurber

quote: Try to accept each other for what you are  and don't point out the fact that the hair he's losing on his head is now growing out of his nose - and his ears.
author: Peg Bundy

quote: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Middle age is when anything new in the way you feel is most likely a symptom.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: There's one advantage to being 102. There's no peer pressure.
author: Dennis Wolfberg

quote: Middle age is when you have met so many people that every new person you meet reminds you of someone else and usually is.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to forget it once.
author: E. Joseph Cossman

quote: Actually  being sixty-five isn't so bad. As a matter of fact I rather like being called a sexagenarian. At this time of life it sounds like flattery.
author: James Humes

quote: Middle age is when your narrow waist and broad mind begin to change places.
author: Ben Klitzner

quote: The secret to longevity is to keep breathing.
author: Sophie Tucker

quote: I'm at the stage of life when if a girl says no to me I'm profoundly grateful to her.
author: Woody Allen

quote: People who have the most birthdays live the longest.
author: Jean Bucher

quote: Middle age occurs when you are too young to take up golf and too old to rush up to the net.
author: Franklin Pierce Adams

quote: I have everything I had twenty years ago  only it's all a little bit lower.
author: Gypsy Rose Lee

quote: I may be forty  but every morning when I get up  I feel like a twenty-year-old. Unfortunately  there's never one around.
author: Robert Orben

quote: To what do you attribute your advanced age? Well  I suppose I must attribute it to the fact that I have not died.
author: Sir Malcolm Sargent

quote: Age is mind over matter. If you don't mind  it doesn't matter.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: She's too young for Medicare and too old for me to care.
author: Anonymous

quote: When she told me her age I believed her - why not? she hasn't changed her story for five years.
author: Anonymous

quote: There are three signs of old age: loss of memory ... I forget the other two.
author: Red Skelton

quote: She was born in the year of our Lord only knows. The years that a woman subtracts from her age are not lost. They are added to other women's.
author: Diane de Poitiers

quote: Old age is like everything else  to make a success of it you got to start young.
author: Fred Astaire

quote: I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The cost of living is going up and the chance of living is going down.
author: Flip Wilson

quote: I was just thinking  when I was a young girl  I never knew what every young girl was supposed to know. And now I am going to be an old lady  I don't know what every old lady is supposed to know.
author: Edith Bunker

quote: He is at an age that whenever a pretty girl smiles at him he immediately looks down to see what is unzipped.
author: Elmer Pasta

quote: Life begins at fifty  but so does bad eyesight  arthritis  and the habit of telling the same story three times to the same listeners.
author: Anonymous

quote: Women  don't get a tattoo. That butterfly looks great on your breast when you're twenty or thirty  but when you get to be seventy  it stretches into a condor.
author: Billy Elmer

quote: When Julia Child was asked to what she credited her longevity  she replied  "Red meat and gin."
author: Anonymous

quote: Once my wife gave me a wonderful birthday present. She let me win an argument.
author: Anonymous

quote: When we're young we want to change the world. When we're old we want to change the young.
author: Anonymous

quote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly  eat slowly  and lie about your age.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: I refuse to admit I'm more than fifty-two  even if that does make my sons illegitimate.
author: Lady Nancy Astor

quote: There are three ages of man: youth  middle age  and "Gee  you look good."
author: Red Skelton

quote: Old age is like a plane flying through a storm. Once you are aboard there is nothing you can do.
author: Golda Meir

quote: The age of a woman doesn't mean a thing. The best tunes are played on the oldest fiddles.
author: Sigmund Z. Engel

quote: I'm at an age where my back goes out more than I do.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: Remember when we used to laugh at old people when we were young? Do you recall what was so funny?
author: Anonymous

quote: If you want to know how old a woman is . . . ask her sister-in-law.
author: Edgar Howe

quote: You know you are getting older when "happy hour" is a nap.
author: Gray Kristofferson

quote: I wouldn't say someone is old just because his social security is in Roman numerals or because Mozart played at his senior prom.
author: Anonymous

quote: Gray hair is God's graffiti.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: If you think a lot of the comments made tonight are not funny  but are immature and tasteless  that's only because the sense of humor is the first thing to go.
author: Anonymous

quote: I was going to take you out to lunch for your birthday . . . but you already are.
author: Anonymous

quote: We've reached an age that when construction workers stare at us it's because they figure we might be considering a remodeling job.
author: Susan McClellan

quote: You're only young once  but you can always be immature.
author: Dave Barry

quote: When I was born I was so surprised I didn't talk for a year and a half.
author: Grade Allen

quote: Here we have a baby. It is composed of a bald head and a pair of lungs.
author: Eugene Field

quote: Men will now get up and walk with the baby in the middle of the night  change its diapers  and give it a bottle  but in their heart of hearts they still think they shouldn't have to.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: We learn from experience. A man never wakes up his second baby just to see it smile.
author: Grace Williams

quote: I'd like to start a family  but you have to have a date first.
author: Larry David

quote: Personally  I think any more than two or three kids is not a family  it's a litter.
author: Tracey Ullman

quote: Diaper backward spells repaid. Think about it.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: When you're the only pea in the pod  your parents are likely to get you confused with the Hope diamond.
author: Russell Baker

quote: I think of birth as the search for a larger apartment.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Always a godfather - never a god!
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: My husband and I are either going to buy a dog or have a child. We can't decide whether to ruin our carpet or ruin our lives.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: God bless me and my son John  Me and my wife  him and his wife  Us four  and no more.
author: Anonymous

quote: Blessings never come in pairs  misfortunes never come alone.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: God bless us every one.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: In the country of the blind the one-eyed man is king.
author: Erasmus

quote: If the blind lead the blind  both shall fall into the ditch.
author: Bible

quote: There's none so blind as they that won't see.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Whoso sheddeth man's blood  by man shall his blood be shed.
author: Bible

quote: The blood of the martyrs is the seed of the church.
author: Tertullian

quote: The old blood is bold blood  the wide world round.
author: Byron Webber

quote: A healthy body is a guest-chamber for the soul  a sick body is a prison.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: No knowledge can be more satisfactory to a man than that of his own frame  its parts  their functions and actions.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: We are bound to our bodies like an oyster to its shell.
author: Plato

quote: If any thing is sacred  the human body is sacred.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Fortune favours the bold.
author: Terence

quote: A stout heart breaks bad luck.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: All good fortune is a gift of the gods  and ... you don't win the favor of the ancient gods by being good  but by being bold.
author: Anita Brookner

quote: Fortune reveres the brave  and overwhelms the cowardly.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Fortune sides with him who dares.
author: Virgil

quote: Chance favors the prepared mind.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: You have to be eligible for luck to strike  and I think that's a matter of education and preparation  and character and all the other solid attributes that sometimes people laugh at.
author: James A. Michener

quote: Get as much experience as you can  so that you're ready when luck works. That's the luck.
author: Henry Fonda

quote: You've got to be in a position for luck to happen. Luck doesn't go around looking for a stumblebum.
author: Darrell Royal

quote: Luck is the residue of design.
author: Branch Rickey

quote: Luck affects everything. Let your hook be always cast. In the stream where you least expect it  there will be fish.
author: Ovid

quote: Chance does nothing that has not been prepared beforehand.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: Luck is being ready for the chance.
author: J. Frank Dobie

quote: Chance usually favors the prudent man.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Combine common sense and the Golden Rule  and you will have very little bad luck.
author: Anonymous

quote: Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: A lexicographer  a writer of dictionaries  a harmless drudge.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they really happened and after you are finished reading one you feel that it all happened to you and after which it all belongs to you.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: All the glory of the world would be buried in oblivion  unless God had provided mortals with the remedy of books.
author: Richard De Bury

quote: Books are the most mannerly of companions  accessible at all times  in all moods  frankly declaring the author's mind  without offense.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quote: Everyone who knows how to read has it in their power to magnify themselves  to multiply the ways in which they exist  to make their life full  significant  and interesting.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Having your book turned into a movie is like seeing your oxen turned into bouillon cubes.
author: John he Carri

quote: He has only half learned the art of reading who has not added to it the even more refined accomplishments of skipping and skimming.
author: Arthur Balfour

quote: If a book is worth reading at all  it is worth reading more than once. Suspense is the lowest of excitants  designed to take your breath away when the brain and heart crave to linger in nobler enjoyment. Suspense drags you on  appreciation causes you to linger.
author: William Gerhardie

quote: If you would not be forgotten as soon as you are dead  either write things worth reading or do things worth writing.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Neither is a dictionary a bad book to read. There is no cant in it  no excess of explanation  and it is full of suggestions  the raw material of possible poems and histories.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Nothing links man to man like the frequent passage from hand to hand of a good book.
author: Walter Sickert

quote: Some books are undeservedly forgotten  none are undeservedly remembered.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: The delight of opening a new pursuit  or a new course of reading  imparts the vivacity and novelty of youth even to old age.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The dust and silence of the upper shelf.
author: Bob Macaulay

quote: The fact of knowing how to read is nothing  the whole point is knowing what to read.
author: Jacques Ellul

quote: The habit of reading is the only enjoyment in which there is no alloy  it lasts when all other pleasures fade.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: The possession of a book becomes a substitute for reading it.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: The responsibility of a dictionary is to record a language  not set its style.
author: Phillip Babcock Gove

quote: To finish is both a relief and a release from an extraordinarily pleasant prison.
author: Robert Burchfield

quote: What is reading but silent conversation?
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: 'Sartor Resartus' is simply unreadable  and for me that always sort of spoils a book.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: You should read it  though there is much that is skip-worthy.
author: Herbert Asquith

quote: The greatest masterpiece in literature is only a dictionary out of order.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: When you read a classic you do not see in the book more than you did before. You see more in you than there was before.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: Properly we should read for power. Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Best-sellerism is the star system of the book world. A (best-seller) is a celebrity among books. It is a book known primarily (sometimes exclusively) for its well-knownness.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: The central theme of the novel is that they were glad to see each other.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Reading after a certain (time) diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The most technologically efficient machine that man has ever invented is the book.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Literature is news that stays news.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Just the knowledge that a good book is awaiting one at the end of a long day makes that day happier.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: Laws die  books never.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Master books  but do not let them master you. Read to live  not live to read.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: A good book is the precious life-blood of a master spirit  embalmed and treasured up on purpose to a life beyond life.
author: John Milton

quote: Any book which is at all important should be re-read immediately.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. They're never fattening  seldom sinful  and permanently personal.
author: Lenore Hershey

quote: Never lend books - nobody ever returns them  the only books I have in my library are those which people have lent me.
author: Anatole France

quote: Discretion is not the better part of biography.
author: Lytton Strachey

quote: A dictionary should be descriptive  not prescriptive.
author: Phillip Babcock Gove

quote: Book lovers never go to bed alone.
author: Anonymous

quote: It circulated for five years  through the halls of fifteen publishers  and finally ended up with Vanguard Press  which as you can see is rather deep into the alphabet.
author: Patrick Dennis

quote: The first book of the nation is the dictionary of its language.
author: Contanitin, Comte de Volney

quote: A novel is a mirror carried along a main road.
author: Stendhal

quote: I read part of it all the way through.
author: Sam Goldwyn

quote: A successful book cannot afford to be more than ten percent new.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: First publication is a pure  carnal leap into that dark which one dreams is life.
author: Hortense Calisher

quote: Books give not wisdom where none was before. But where some is  there reading makes it more.
author: John Harington

quote: A good book has no ending.
author: R. D. Dimming

quote: Oh that my words were now written! Oh that they were printed in a book!
author: Bible

quote: What a sense of security in an old book which time has criticized for us!
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: I hate books  they teach us only to talk about what we do not know.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Tis the good reader that makes the good book.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The telephone book is full of facts but it doesn't contain a single idea.
author: Mortimer J. Adler

quote: In the case of good books  the point is not to see how many of them you can get through  but rather how many can get through to you.
author: Mortimer J. Adler

quote: Books think for me.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Dictionaries are like watches. The worst is better than none at all and even the best cannot be expected to run quite true.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Does it afflict you to find your books wearing out? I mean literally .. . the mortality of all inanimate things is terrible to me  but that of books most of all.
author: William Dean Howells

quote: The true university of these days is a collection of books.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: I keep my books at the British Museum and at Mudies.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: One man is as good as another until he has written a book.
author: Benjamin Jowett

quote: If a book is worth reading  it is worth buying.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Reading is sometimes an ingenious device for avoiding thought.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: The oldest books are still only just out to those who have not read them.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: A book is a mirror: if an ass peers into it  you can't expect an apostle to look out.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: The man who does not read good books has no advantage over the man who can't read them.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Ordinary people know little of the time and effort it takes to learn to read. I have been eighty years at it  and have not reached my goal.
author: Goethe

quote: I am a part of all I have read.
author: John Kieran

quote: Reading is the work of the alert mind  is demanding  and under ideal conditions produces finally a sort of ecstasy. This gives the experience of reading a sublimity and power unequalled by any other form of communication.
author: E. B. White

quote: I do not know any reading more easy  more fascinating  more delightful than a catalogue.
author: Anatole France

quote: To me the charm of an encyclopedia is that it knows - and I needn't.
author: Francis Yeats-Brown

quote: A best-seller was a book which somehow sold well simply because it was selling well.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: A good title is the title of a successful book.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: Books should be tried by a judge and jury as though they were crimes.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Reading  like prayer  remains one of our few private acts.
author: William Jovanovich

quote: My education was the liberty I had to read indiscriminately and all the time  with my eyes hanging out.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: A publisher is somebody looking for someone who has something to say.
author: Lome Pierce

quote: There are perhaps no days of our childhood we lived so fully as those we believe we left without having lived them: those we spent with a favourite book.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Some books are to be tasted  others to be swallowed  and some few to be chewed and digested.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: If you would understand your own age  read the works of fiction produced in it. People in disguise speak freely.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: Camerado  this is no book. Who touches this  touches a man.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: A book is like a garden carried in the pocket.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The walls of books around him  dense with the past  formed a kind of insulation against the present world and its disasters.
author: Ross MacDonald

quote: There are still a few of us booklovers around despite the awful warnings of Marshall McLuhan with his TV era and his pending farewell to Gutenberg.
author: Frank Davies

quote: Some books are to be tasted  others to be swallowed  and some few to be chewed and digested.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Laws die  Books never.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: A book is the only immortality.
author: Rufus Choate

quote: Beware of the man of one book.
author: Isaac D'Israeli

quote: Except a living man there is nothing more wonderful than a book! a message to us from... human souls we never saw... And yet these arouse us  terrify us  teach us  comfort us  open their hearts to us as brothers.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: The writings of the wise are the only riches our posterity cannot squander.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written or badly written. That is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A good book is the precious life-blood of a master-spirit  embalmed and treasured up on purpose to a life beyond life.
author: John Milton

quote: As good almost kill a man as kill a good book: who kills a man kills a reasonable creature  God's image  but he who destroys a good book kills reason itself  kills the image of God  as it were  in the eye.
author: John Milton

quote: A best-seller is the gilded tomb of a mediocre talent.
author: Logan P. Smith

quote: All the known world  excepting only savage nations  is governed by books.
author: Voltaire

quote: Camerado  this is no book. Who touches this  touches a man.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: A healthy male adult bore consumes each year one and a half times his own weight in other people's patience.
author: John Updike

quote: He is an old bore  even the grave yawns for him.
author: Herbert Beerbohm Tree

quote: How is it that we remember the least triviality that happens to us  and yet not remember how often we have recounted it to the same person?
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: We may be willing to tell a story twice  never to hear it more than once.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Some people can stay longer in an hour than others can in a week.
author: William Dean Howells

quote: A bore is a man who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company.
author: Gian Vincenzo Cravina

quote: A bore is a man who  when you ask him how he is  tells you.
author: Bert Leston Taylor

quote: The man who suspects his own tediousness has yet to be born.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: Ennui has made more gamblers than avarice  more drunkards than thirst  and perhaps as many suicides as despair.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The inexorable boredom that is at the core of life.
author: Jacques-Binigne Bossuet

quote: He has returned from Italy a greater bore than ever  he bores on architecture  painting  statuary and music.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: O wad some power the giftie gie us to see some people before they see us.
author: Ethel Watts Mumford

quote: The most costly disease is not cancer or coronaries. The most costly disease is boredom - costly for both individual and society.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: The devil's name is dullness.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: The basic fact about human existence is not that it is a tragedy  but that it is a bore.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: His shortcoming is his long staying.
author: Lewis L. Lewisohn

quote: Uncertainty and mystery are energies of life. Don't let them scare you unduly  for they keep boredom at bay and spark creativity.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: Boredom is a vital problem for the moralist  since at least half the sins of mankind are caused by the fear of it.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Dullness is a misdemeanour.
author: Ethel Wilson

quote: When people are bored  it is primarily with their own selves.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: A variety of nothing is superior to a monotony of something.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: We often forgive those who bore us  but can't forgive those whom we bore.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: A man can stand almost anything except a succession of ordinary days.
author: Goethe

quote: Any idiot can face a crisis - it's this day-to-day living that wears you out.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: The secret of boring people lies in telling them everything.
author: Voltaire

quote: Boredom turns a man to sex  a woman to shopping  and it drives newscasters berserk.
author: Bruce Herschensohn

quote: Blessed is the man who  having nothing to say  refrains from giving wordy evidence of the fact.
author: George Eliot

quote: Boredom is rage spread thin.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Almost all human affairs are tedious. Everything is too long. Visits  dinners  concerts  plays  speeches  pleadings  essays  sermons  are too long. Pleasure and business labour equally under this defect  or  as I should rather say  this fatal superabundance.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: Bore: a person who talks when you wish him to listen.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Society is now one polished horde  Formed of two mighty tribes  the Bores and Bored.
author: Lord Byron

quote: He says a thousand pleasant things  -  But never says "Adieu"
author: J. G. Saxe

quote: Normal day  let me be aware of the treasure you are. Let me learn from you  love you  bless you before you depart. Let me not pass you by in quest of some rare and perfect tomorrow. Let me hold you while I may  for it may not always be so. One day I shall dig my nails into the earth  or bury my face in the pillow  or stretch myself taut  or raise my hands to the sky and want  more than all the world  your return.
author: Mary Jean Iron

quote: Either you reach a higher point today  or you exercise your strength in order to be able to climb higher tomorrow.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: One appreciates that daily life is really good when one wakes from a horrible dream  or when one takes the first outing after a sickness. Why not realize it now?
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: This is the day which the Lord hath made  we will rejoice and be glad.
author: Bible

quote: That man is happiest who lives from day to day and asks no more  garnering the simple goodness of a life.
author: Euripides

quote: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Sunshine is delicious  rain is refreshing  wind braces us  snow is exhilarating  there is no such thing as bad weather  only different kinds of good weather.
author: John Ruskin

quote: A man can stand almost anything except a succession of ordinary days.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: We look wishfully to emergencies  to eventful  revolutionary times ... and think how easy to have taken our part when the drum was rolling and the house was burning over our heads.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Poets are like baseball pitchers. Both have their moments. The intervals are the tough things.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Any idiot can face a crisis-it's day to day living that wears you out.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: They sicken of the calm that know the storm.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Peace is not only better than war  but infinitely more arduous.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Peace hath higher tests of manhood Than battle ever knew.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: Man lives by habits indeed  but what he lives for is thrill and excitements. ... From time immemorial war has been ... the supremely thrilling excitement.
author: William James

quote: It is not merely cruelty that leads men to love war  it is excitement.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The statistics of suicide show that  for non-combatants at least  life is more interesting in war than in peace.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Boredom is rage spread thin.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Ennui has made more gamblers than avarice  more drunkards than thirst  and perhaps as many suicides as despair.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Boredom ... causes us to neglect more duties than does interest.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Boredom is a vital problem for the moralist  since at least half of the sins of mankind are caused by the fear of it.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Boredom slays more of existence than war.
author: Norman Mailer

quote: One of the worst forms of mental suffering is boredom  not knowing what to do with oneself and one's life. Even if man had no monetary  or any other reward  he would be eager to spend his energy in some meaningful way because he could not stand the boredom which inactivity produces.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Monotony is the awful reward of the careful.
author: A. G. Buckham

quote: Boredom is the most horrible of wolves.
author: Jean Giono

quote: If your daily life seems poor  do not blame it  blame yourself  tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Banality is a terribly likely consequence of the underuse of a good mind.
author: Cynthia Propper Seton

quote: Somebody's boring me  I think it's me.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
author: Ellen Parr

quote: Being bored is an insult to oneself.
author: Jules Renard

quote: The amount of satisfaction you get from life depends largely on your own ingenuity  self-sufficiency  and resourcefulness. People who wait around for life to supply their satisfaction usually find boredom instead.
author: Dr. William Menninger

quote: When you stop learning  stop listening  stop looking and asking questions  always new questions  then it is time to die.
author: Lillian Smith

quote: When people are bored  it is primarily with their own selves that they are bored.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Is not life a hundred times too short for us to bore ourselves?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Nothing is interesting if you're not interested.
author: Helen Maclnness

quote: Boredom is a sickness of the soul.
author: Anonymous

quote: Boredom is simply the lack of imagination.
author: Julie O. Smith

quote: Perhaps the world's second worst crime is boredom. The first is being a bore.
author: Cecil Beaton

quote: In the ancient recipe  the three antidotes for dullness or boredom are sleep  drink  and travel. It is rather feeble. From sleep you wake up  from drink you become sober  and from travel you come home again. And then where are you? No  the two sovereign remedies for dullness are love or a crusade.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: You can learn new things at any time in your life if you're willing to be a beginner. If you actually learn to like being a beginner  the whole world opens up to you.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: As for boredom ... I notice that it leaves me as soon as I am doing something that has got to be done.
author: John Jay Chapman

quote: Uncertainty and mystery are energies of life. Don't let them scare you unduly  for they keep boredom at bay and spark creativity.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: If something is boring after two minutes  try it for four. If still boring  try it for eight  sixteen  thirty-two  and so on. Eventually  one discovers that it is not boring  but very interesting.
author: Zen saying

quote: Nobody is bored when he is trying to make something that is beautiful  or to discover something that is true.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: The one sure means of dealing with boredom is to care for someone else  to do something kind and good.
author: Theodore Haecker

quote: Everything considered  work is less boring than amusing oneself.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Man is the only animal that can be bored.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: The only unhappiness is a life of boredom.
author: Stendhal

quote: Getting bored is not allowed.
author: Kay Thompson

quote: One can be bored until boredom becomes a mystical experience.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: One must choose in life between boredom and suffering.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: We often forgive those who bore us  but can't forgive those whom we bore.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Dullness is a misdemeanor.
author: Ethel Wilson

quote: Over-excitement and boredom are states of mind which I equally shun.
author: E. V. Knox

quote: Passions are less mischievous than boredom  for passions tend to diminish and boredom increase.
author: Jules Barbey d'Aurevilly

quote: It is better to be happy for the moment and be burned up with beauty than to live a long time and be bored all the while.
author: Don Marquis

quote: Boredom: the desire for desires.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The only menace is inertia.
author: Saint John Perse

quote: Boredom is useful to me when I notice it and think: Oh I'm bored  there must be something else I want to be doing ... boredom acts as an initiator of originality by pushing me into new activities or new thoughts.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: Boredom  like necessity  is very often the mother of invention.
author: Anonymous

quote: One of man's finest qualities is described by the simple word "guts"-the ability to take it. If you have the discipline to stand fast when your body wants to run  if you can control your temper and remain cheerful in the face of monotony or disappointments  you have "guts" in the soldiering sense.
author: Colonel John S. Roosman

quote: Life is as tedious as a twice-told tale  vexing the dull ear of a drowsy man.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: An enthusiast may bore others  but he has never a dull moment himself.
author: John Kieran

quote: Three-quarters of a soldier's life is spent in aimlessly waiting about.
author: Eugene Rosenstock-Huessy

quote: Debt is a bottomless sea.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Borrowing from Peter to pay Paul.
author: Cicero

quote: The borrower is servant to die lender.
author: Bible

quote: Neither a borrower nor a lender be: For loan oft loses both itself and friend  And borrowing dulls the edge of husbandry.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Who goeth a borrowing Goeth a sorrowing.
author: Thomas Tusser

quote: And this is good old Boston  The home of the bean and the cod  Where the Lowells talk to the Cabots  And the Cabots talk only to God.
author: J. C. Bossidy

quote: Then here's to the City of Boston  The town of the cries and the groans  Where the Cabots can't see the Kabotschniks  And the Lowells won't speak to the Cohns.
author: Franklin P. Adams

quote: One boy is more trouble than a dozen girls.
author: English proverb

quote: Boys will be boys.
author: English proverb

quote: A boy is  of all wild beasts  the most difficult to manage.
author: Plato

quote: How sleep the brave  who sink to rest  By all their country's wishes blest!
author: Anonymous

quote: Bravery is a cheap and vulgar quality  of which the brightest instances are frequently found in the lowest savages.
author: Paul Chatfield

quote: True bravery is shown by performing without witness what one might be capable of doing before all the world.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: None but the brave deserves the fair.
author: John Dryden

quote: Physical bravery is an animal instinct  moral bravery is a much higher and truer courage.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Man doth not live by bread only.
author: Bible

quote: Cast thy bread upon the waters: for thou shalt find it after many days.
author: Bible

quote: Bread is the staff of life.
author: English Saying

quote: I know on which side my bread is buttered.
author: John Heywood

quote: Better is half a loaf than no bread.
author: John Heywood

quote: What man is there of you  whom if his son ask bread  will he give him a stone?
author: Bible

quote: Jesus said unto them  I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger  and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.
author: Bible

quote: Give us this day our daily bread.
author: Bible

quote: Oh  God! that bread should be so dear  And flesh and blood so cheap!
author: Thomas Hood

quote: I won't quarrel with my bread and butter.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Let thy speech be short  comprehending much in few words.
author: Bible

quote: The more you say  the less people remember. The fewer the words  the greater the profit.
author: Francois Fenelon

quote: The fewer the words  the better prayer.
author: Martin Luther

quote: The wisdom of nations lies in their proverbs  which are brief and pithy.
author: William Penn

quote: God helps the brave.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: Brevity is the soul of wit.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Every man has his price.
author: Sir Robert Walpole

quote: The universe would not be rich enough to buy the vote of an honest man.
author: St. Gregory

quote: Few men have virtue to withstand the highest bidder.
author: George Washington

quote: Am I my brother's keeper?
author: Bible

quote: A new commandment I give unto you  That ye love one another  as I have loved you  that ye also love one another.
author: Bible

quote: The crest and crowning of all good  Life's final star  is Brotherhood.
author: Edwin Markham

quote: When man to man shall be a friend and brother.
author: Gerald Massey

quote: Old houses mended
author: Anonymous

quote: Cost little less than new before they're ended.
author: Colley Cibber

quote: Never build after you are five and forty  have five years' income in hand before you lay a brick  and always calculate the expense at double the estimate.
author: Anonymous

quote: In show business the key word is honesty. Once you've learned to fake that  the rest is easy.
author: George Burns

quote: The consumer is not a moron  she is your wife.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: To make a long story short  . . . there's nothing like having the boss walk in.
author: Anonymous

quote: Committee: A group of men who keep minutes and waste hours.
author: Milton Berle

quote: A decorator can make lots of money -  assuming she wins the lottery.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: An expert is one who knows more and more about less and less.
author: Nicholas M. Butler

quote: Nothing in fine print is ever good news.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up 'cause they're looking for ideas.
author: Paula Poundstone

quote: He's always been known to be entrepenurious.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: After being on the road so much I want to spend more time with my family  who I hear are wonderful people.
author: Howie Mandel

quote: To be a leader you need a lot of people dumb enough to follow.
author: Anonymous

quote: Never burn bridges. Today's junior jerk  tomorrow's senior partner.
author: Sigourney Weaver

quote: Don't be humble. You're not that great.
author: Golda Meir

quote: Few things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.
author: Mark Twain

quote: No one leads the orchestra without turning his back on the crowd.
author: Anonymous

quote: I succeed him  no one could replace him.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: I often feel like the director of a cemetery. I have a lot of people under me  but nobody listens!
author: General John Gavin

quote: The whole world knows we have it made in America . . . made in China  made in Mexico  made in Japan.
author: Anonymous

quote: The motto in the workaholic Silicon Valley is "Stop for lunch and you are lunch."
author: Anonymous

quote: Christmas is over and Business is Business.
author: Anonymous

quote: Anybody can cut prices  but it takes brains to produce a better article.
author: P. D. Armour

quote: Business is religion  and religion is business. The man who does not make a business of his religion has a religious life of no force  and the man who does not make a religion of his business has a business life of no character.
author: Maltbie Babcock

quote: The nature of business is swindling.
author: August Bebel

quote: There are two times in a man's life when he should not speculate: when he can't afford it  and when he can.
author: Samuel L. Clemens

quote: They (corporations) cannot commit treason  nor be outlawed  nor excommunicated  for they have no souls.
author: Sir Edward Coke

quote: The business of America is business.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Business is likeoil. It won't mix with anything but business.
author: J. Graham

quote: Whose merchants are princes.
author: Bible

quote: Wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business ?
author: Bible

quote: We demand that big business give people a square deal  in return we must insist that when anyone engaged in big business honesdy endeavors to do right  he shall himself be given a square deal.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: That which is everybody's business  is nobody's business.
author: Izaak Walton

quote: Call on a business man at business times only  and on business  transact your business and go about your business  in order to give him time to finish his busmess.
author: Duke of Wellington

quote: The way to stop financial "joy-riding" is to arrest the chauffeur  not the automobile.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: It is not the crook in modern business that we fear  but the honest man who does not know what he is doing.
author: Owen D. Young

quote: Everyone lives by selling something.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: It is naught  it is naught  saith the buyer. But when he is gone his way  then he boasteth.
author: Bible

quote: Piracy  n: commerce without its folly-swaddles - just as God made it.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: A study of economics usually reveals that the best time to buy anything is last year.
author: Marty Allen

quote: A consumer is a shopper who is sore about something.
author: Harold Coffin

quote: Who buys has need of two eyes But one's enough to sell the stuff.
author: Anonymous

quote: Bargain: something you can't use at a price you can't resist.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: Don't buy the house  buy the neighborhood.
author: Russian proverb

quote: A fair price for oil is whatever you can get plus ten to twenty per cent.
author: Anonymous

quote: A decision is the action an executive must take when he has information so incomplete that the answer does not suggest itself.
author: Arthur William Radford

quote: An extravagance is anything you buy that is of no earthly use to your wife.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: What costs nothing is worth nothing.
author: Anonymous

quote: Keep thy shop and thy shop will keep thee.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: There is hardly anything in the world that some man can't make a little worse and sell a little cheaper  and the people who consider price only are this man's lawful prey.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Cheat me in the price but not in the goods.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: When you buy  use your eyes and your mind  not your ears.
author: Czechoslovakian proverb

quote: People will buy anything that's one to a customer.
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote: Cutting honest throats by whispers.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Calumniate  calumniate  there will always be something which sticks.
author: Pierre Beaumarchais

quote: Calumny is a vice of curious constitution  trying to kill it keeps it alive  leave it to itself and it will die a natural death.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: To persevere in one's duty and to be silent is the best answer to calumny.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Canada is like an old cow. The West feeds it. Ontario and Quebec milk it. And you can well imagine what it's doing in the Maritimes.
author: Tommy Douglas

quote: Canada is not so much a country as a clothesline nearly 4 000 miles long. St John's in Newfoundland is closer to Milan  Italy than to Vancouver.
author: Simon Hoggart

quote: Canada is so square even the female impersonators are women.
author: Anonymous

quote: No one is the worse for knowing two languages.
author: Oliver Mowat

quote: One of the cool  chaste countries - Canada or Sweden.
author: John Updike

quote: That long (Canadian) frontier from the Atlantic to the Pacific Ocean  guarded only by neighbourly respect and honourable obligations  as an example to every country and a pattern for the future of the world.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: To me it's very obvious there are huge cultural differences between Americans and Canadians. But a lot of what we are is American.
author: David Cronenberg

quote: You've never seen this country It's not the way you thought it was Look again.
author: Al Purdy

quote: The whole history of the Canadian north can be divided into two periods - before and after the aeroplane.
author: Hugh Keenleyside

quote: The Lord said 'let there be wheat' and Saskatchewan was born.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: The father of confederation is deadlock.
author: Goldwin Smith

quote: The first time I ever felt the necessity or inevitableness of verse  was in the desire to reproduce the peculiar quality of feeling which is induced by the flat spaces and wide horizons of the virgin prairie of western Canada.
author: T. E. Hulme

quote: Quebec is the original heart  the hardest and deepest kernel  the core of first time. All round  nine other provinces form the flesh of this still-bitter fruit called Canada.
author: Anne Hubert

quote: Ottawa - a sub-arctic lumber-village converted by royal mandate into a political cockpit.
author: Goldwin Smith

quote: Americans like to make money: Canadians like to audit it. I know no country where accountants have a higher social and moral status.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: I suppose the half-breeds in Manitoba  in 1870  did not fight for two hundred forty acres of land  but it is to be understood there were two societies who treated together. One was small  but in its smallness it had its rights. The other was great  but in its greatness it had no greater rights than the rights of the small  because the right is the same for everyone.
author: Louis Riel

quote: Canada's national bird is the grouse.
author: Stuart Keate

quote: Separatism is a very healthy movement within culture. It's a disastrous movement within politics and economics.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: An arena large as Europe Silent waiting the contest
author: F. R. Scott

quote: There has never been a war of Canadian origin  nor for a Canadian cause.
author: William Arthur Deacon

quote: Canada is a collection often provinces with strong governments loosely connected by fear.
author: Dave Broadfoot

quote: Canada is a good country to be from. It has a gentler  slower pace - it lends perspective.
author: Paul Anka

quote: My generation of Canadians grew up believing that  if we were very good or very smart  or both  we would some day graduate from Canada.
author: Robert Fulford

quote: We are being swallowed up by the popular culture of the United States  but then the Americans are being swallowed up by it too. It's just as much a threat to American culture as it is to ours.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Never hear anything bad about Canada  that's one thing - in fact  I guess it's the only thing.
author: Walter Stewart

quote: Canada is a society  rather than a nation.
author: Kildare Dobbs

quote: Living next to the United States is in some ways like sleeping with an elephant. No matter how friendly and even-tempered is the beast  one is affected by every twitch and grunt.
author: Pierre Elliott Trudeau

quote: Canada reminds me of vichyssoise - it's cold  half-French and difficult to stir.
author: Stuart Keate

quote: Our country has shown a lack of will to resist its own disintegration .. . Canada is practically the only country left in the world which is a pure colony  colonial in psychology as well as in mercantile economics.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Americans assume Canada to be bestowed as a right and accept this bounty  as they do air  without thought or appreciation.
author: Dean Acheson

quote: Americans are benevolently ignorant about Canada  while Canadians are malevolently well informed about the United States.
author: J. Bartlet Brebner

quote: 'Old Tomorrow.'
author: Sir John A. Macdonald

quote: 'Rich by nature  poor by policy' might be written over Canada's door.
author: Goldwin Smith

quote: Canadian politics in British Columbia is an adventure  on the Prairies a cause  in Ontario a business  in Quebec a religion  in the Maritimes a disease.
author: Paul St. Pierre

quote: (Canada) - the most parochial nationette on earth ... I have been living in this sanctimonious icebox ... painting portraits of the opulent Methodists of Toronto. Methodism and money in this city have produced a sort of hell of dullness.
author: Wyndham Lewis

quote: When I stand on a street in a Canadian city and look across the street  it couldn't be anywhere but Canada  but how can I prove it?
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Newfoundland is a great English ship  moored near the Banks during the fishing season for the convenience of the English fishermen.
author: A. H. Mcintosh

quote: The land too poor for any other crop  is best for raising men.
author: R. Pocock

quote: I want history to jump on Canada's spine with sharp skates.
author: Leonard Cohen

quote: Is heaven more beautiful than the country of the muskox in summer when sometimes the mist blows over the lakes  and sometimes the water is blue  and the loons cry very often?
author: Saltatha Inuit

quote: Much will have to change in Canada if the country is to stay the same.
author: Abraham Rotstein

quote: The Greeks  who knew everything  understood that without the orgy there is no middle ground between bedlam and Toronto ... we need the healing grace of the orgy in this country.
author: Hugh MacLennan

quote: Canada is a live country - live  but not  like the States  kicking.
author: Rupert Brooke

quote: There was a small boy of Quebec Who was buried in snow to the neck: When they said 'Are you friz?' He replied 'Yes  I is - But we don't call this cold in Quebec!'
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The mighty voice of Canada will ever call to me.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: Saskatchewan is much like Texas - except it's more friendly to the United States.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: If the national mental illness of the United States is megalomania  that of Canada is paranoid schizophrenia.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Canada is not a country for the cold of heart or the cold of feet.
author: Pierre Elliott Trudeau

quote: We sing about the North  but live as far south as possible.
author: J. B. McGeachy

quote: Canada has no cultural unity  no linguistic unity  no religious unity  no economic unity  no geographic unity. All it has is unity.
author: Kenneth Boulding

quote: So long as the majority of Canadians have two countries  one here and one in Europe  national unity will remain a myth and a constant source of internecine quarrels.
author: Henri Bourassa

quote: We French-Canadians belong to one country  Canada: Canada is for us the whole world: but the English-Canadians have two countries  one here and one across the sea.
author: Wilfrid Laurier

quote: My father spoke French with a Bank of Montreal accent.
author: Hartland de Montarville Molson

quote: If a player continues transgressing the rules  his side shall lose him.
author: Anonymous

quote: That one never asks a question unless he knows the answer is basic to parliamentary questioning.
author: John G. Diefenbaker

quote: Love Canada or give it back.
author: Indian saying in Saskatchewan

quote: The Americans are our best friends - whether we like it or not.
author: Robert Thompson

quote: Scenery here in Canada is by the mile  whereas in England it is by the foot. In England there is a great wealth of 'pretty bits'. In Canada there is a great lack of them. But there are grandeur  vastness and expansive views.
author: A. Brooker Klugh

quote: Canada's climate is nine months winter and three months late in the fall.
author: Evan Esar

quote: The Canadian is often a baffled man because he feels different from his British kindred and his American neighbours  sharply refused to be lumped together with either of them  yet cannot make plain his difference.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: He wants to be different from everyone else and daydreams of winning the global race  Parents unmarried and living abroad  relatives keen to bag the estate  schizophrenia not excluded  will he learn to grow up before it's too late?
author: Earle Birney

quote: To be Canadian is to live in relative calm and with great dignity.
author: William Davis

quote: John Kenneth Galbraith and Marshall McLuhan are the two greatest modern Canadians that the U.S. has produced.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: Canadians have been accustomed to define themselves by saying what they are not.
author: William Kilbourn

quote: I know that through the grace of God  I am the founder of Manitoba.
author: Louis Riel

quote: Actually  when it comes to knocking the Canadian cultural scene  nobody outdoes Canadians  myself included. We are veritable masters of self-deprecation.
author: Mordecai Richler

quote: Canadians are generally indistinguishable from Americans  and the surest way of telling the two apart is to make the observation to a Canadian.
author: Richard Staines

quote: A Torontonian is a man who leaves culture to his wife.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: Toronto has no social classes - only the Masseys and the masses.
author: B. K. Sandwell

quote: TheSc ots are the backbone of Canada. They are all right in their three vital parts - head  heart and haggis.
author: William Osier

quote: Listen your Lordship  I'm a respecter of institutions. Even in Paris  I remained a Canadian. I puffed hashish  but I didn't inhale.
author: Mordecai Richler

quote: One man out of every five who lands on our shores is a foreigner- i.e. non-Anglo-Saxon. He comes here with a foreign tongue  foreign ideals  foreign religion  with centuries of ignorance and oppression behind him  often bringing with him problems that the best statesmen of Europe have failed to solve.
author: W. D. Reid

quote: I think a stalwart peasant in a sheepskin coat  born on the soil  whose forefathers have been farmers for ten generations  with a stout wife and a half-dozen chickens  is good quality.
author: Clifford Sifton

quote: The Canadian spirit is cautious  observant and critical where the American is assertive.
author: V. S. Pritchett
