quote: If we can find out why the idea rather than the nation of Canada can win a growing loyalty rather than commanding it  then  it seems to me  we shall have come very near to trapping the elusive creature  the Canadian Identity.
author: George Woodcock

quote: Beneath their work the moral core of Canadian nationhood is found in the fact that Canada is a monarchy and in the nature of monarchial allegiance. As America is united at bottom by the covenant  Canada is united at the top by allegiance. Because Canada is a nation founded on allegiance and not on compact  there is no pressure for uniformity  there is no Canadian way of life. Any one  French  Irish  Ukrainian or Eskimo  can be a subject of the Queen and a citizen of Canada without in any way changing or ceasing to be himself.
author: W. L. Morton

quote: If ever Confederation fails  it will not be because Quebec - the political voice of French Canada - has separated from it. It will be because the way to keep Quebec in it has not been found.
author: Jean Lesage

quote: When the white man came  we had the land and they had the bibles. Now they have the land and we have the bibles.
author: Chief Dan George

quote: We shall be Canadians first  foremost  and always  and our policies will be decided in Canada and not dictated by any other country.
author: John G. Diefenbaker

quote: The situation is one something like living with your wife. Sometimes it is difficult and even irritating to live with her  but it is always impossible to live without her.
author: Lester Pearson

quote: The Ottawa river flows out of Protestant Ontario into Catholic Quebec.
author: Hugh MacLennan

quote: The twentieth century belongs to Canada.
author: Wilfrid Laurier

quote: We often say that we fear no invasion from the south  but the armies of the south have already crossed the border - American enterprise  American capital is taking rapid possession of our mines and our water power  our oil areas and our timber limits.
author: Sara Jeannette Duncan

quote: The Canadian dialect of English . . . seems roughly to be the result of applying British syntax to an American vocabulary.
author: Lister Sinclair

quote: The habitant is the true Canadian  for he has no other country.
author: Ramsay Traquair

quote: The immigrant who comes to Canada really sees the country much more as a whole. He doesn't know the nuances which are so important and so dearly beloved by the Torontonian or the Montrealer.
author: Brian Moore

quote: Give us men to match our mountains  Give us men to match our plains: Men with empires in their purpose And new eras in their brains.
author: H. T. Miller

quote: Ottawa is a city where nobody lives  though some of us may die there.
author: Michael Macklem

quote: Canada was settled  in the main  by people with a lower middle-class outlook  and a respect  rather than an affectionate familiarity  for the things of the mind.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: The trouble with this whole country is that it's divided up into little puddles with big fish in each one of them.
author: Hugh MacLennan

quote: Historically  a Canadian is an American who rejects the Revolution.
author: Northrop Frye nobody

quote: belongs anywhere  even the Rocky Mountains are still moving.
author: George Bowering

quote: Let us be French as the Americans are English.
author: Henri Bourassa

quote: Confederation is only yet in the gristle  and it will require five years more before it hardens into bone.
author: John A. Macdonald

quote: You are a big country now  but you still tend to feel small and fragile. If the United States gets a cold  you get pneumonia.
author: Herman Kahn

quote: I was brought up in southwestern Ontario where we were taught that Canadian patriotism should not withstand anything more than a five-dollar-a-month wage differential. Anything more than that and you went to Detroit.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: You can be a French Canadian or an English Canadian  but not a Canadian. We know how to live without an identity  and this is one of our marvellous resources.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: Not necessarily conscription  but conscription if necessary.
author: William Lyon Mackenzie King

quote: Whenever the Germans found the Canadian Corps coming into the line  they prepared for the worst.
author: David Lloyd George

quote: Canadian nationalism was systematically encouraged and exploited by American capital. Canada moved from colony to nation to colony.
author: Harold A. Innis

quote: Ours is a sovereign nation Bows to no foreign will But whenever they cough in Washington They spit on Parliament Hill.
author: Joe Wallace

quote: Of course  Canadians are different. There is no malice in us. We are the family doctor whom no one has called in for consultation. We are the children of the midday who see all in the clear  shallow light.
author: Charles Ritchie

quote: I know that Nature designs that this whole continent  not merely these thirty-six states  shall be  sooner or later  within the magic circle of the American union.
author: William Seward

quote: In Canada we have enough to do keeping up with two spoken languages ... so we just go right ahead and use English for literature  Scotch for sermons  and American for conversation.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: The story of Canada is that if one meeting fails  you have another meeting.
author: Robert Rae

quote: Capital is a result of labor  and is used by labor to assist it in further production. Labor is the active and initial force  and labor is therefore the employer of capital.
author: Henry George

quote: Labor is prior to  and independent of  capital. Capital is only the fruit of labor  and could never have existed if labor had not first existed. Labor is the superior of capital  and deserves much the higher consideration.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Capital is dead labor that  vampirelike  lives only by sucking living labor  and lives the more  the more labor it suck.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Each needs the other: capital cannot do without labor  nor labor without capital.
author: Pope Leo

quote: You cannot strengthen the weak by weakening the strong. You cannot help the wage earner by pulling down the wage payer. You cannot help the poor by destroying the rich. You cannot help men permanently by doing for them what they could and should do for themselves.
author: John Henry Boetcker

quote: Those who can  do  those who can't  teach  and those who can do neither  administer.
author: Collet Calverley

quote: There can be no return to prosperity while the government (of Ontario) believes that taking money from the people who have earned it and giving it away to the people who haven't  in exchange for their votes and regardless of merit  is the essence of fairness.
author: Conrad Black

quote: Anti-intellectualism has long been the anti-Semitism of the business man.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: No-wher so bisy a man as he ter nas  And yet he semed bisier that he was.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: As one retiring chief executive said to his successor "Yesterday was the last day you heard the truth from your subordinates."
author: Robert W. McMurry

quote: Commerce is greedy. Ideology is blood-thirsty.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Crime is a logical extension of the sort of behaviour that is often considered perfectly respectable in legitimate business.
author: Robert Rice

quote: Entrepreneurship is the last refuge of the trouble-making individual.
author: James K. Glassman

quote: The big print giveth and the fine print taketh away.
author: Monsignor J. Fulton Sheen

quote: Expenditure rises to meet income.
author: C. Northcote Parkinson

quote: I am a Millionaire. That is my religion.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: If you fail to plan  you plan to fail.
author: Old saying

quote: It is an economic axiom as old as the hills that goods and services can be paid for only with goods and services.
author: Albert J. Nock

quote: Man exploits man. Under communism  it's just the opposite.
author: Russian saying

quote: It might be termed the Law of Triviality. Briefly stated  it means that the time spent on any item of the agenda will be in adverse proportion to the sum involved.
author: Northcote Parkinson

quote: It takes no more actual sagacity to carry on the everyday hawking and haggling of the world  or to ladle out its normal doses of bad medicine and worse law  than it takes to operate a taxi cab or fry a pan of fish.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Live together like brothers and do business like strangers.
author: Anonymous

quote: Managers don't have to cook the books to manipulate earnings  they often have all the power they need in the leeway built into accounting rules.
author: Fred S. Worthy

quote: Mere parsimony is not economy . . . expense  and great expense  may be an essential part of true economy.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: One of the best ways to persuade others is with your ears - by listening to them.
author: Dean Rusk

quote: Remember that when an employee enters your office  he is in a strange land.
author: Erwin H. Schell

quote: The best way to destroy the capitalist system is to debauch the currency. By a continuing process of inflation  governments can confiscate  secretly and unobserved  an important part of the wealth of their citizens.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quote: The big unions served a noble purpose once  and bless them for it. Now they're part of the problem and must give way if America is to move and to participate in management and achieve reasonable productivity.
author: Robert Townsend

quote: Luck is infatuated with the efficient.
author: Persian proverb

quote: One of the best-kept secrets in America is that people are aching to make a commitment  if they only had the freedom and environment in which to do so.
author: John Naisbitt

quote: The big-business mergers and the big-labour mergers have the appearance of dinosaurs mating.
author: John Naisbitt

quote: The corporation is an artificial being  invisible  intangible  and existing only in contemplation of law.
author: John Marshall

quote: The forces in a capitalist society  if left unchecked  tend to make the rich richer and the poor poorer.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: The manager with the in-basket problem does not yet understand that he must discipline himself to take care of activities that fail to excite him.
author: Priscilla Elfrey

quote: To business that we love we rise betime  And go to it with delight.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The white man knows how to make everything  but he does not know how to distribute it.
author: Sitting Bull

quote: There are an enormous number of managers who have retired on the job.
author: Peter F. Drucker

quote: There is only one social responsibility of business - to use its resources and engage in activities designed to increase its profits without deception or fraud.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: Things have to be made to happen in a way you want them to happen. Without management  without the intervention of organized willpower the desired result simply cannot be obtained.
author: Robert Heller

quote: Today's sales should be better than yesterday's - and worse than tomorrow's.
author: Old saying

quote: Twenty generations ago - around the year 1390 - you had 1 048 576 ancestors. In the 21st generation of your family that number will double again.
author: Genealogical Research Library

quote: We have yet to find a significant case where the company did not move in the direction of the chief executive's home.
author: Ken Patton

quote: You are never giving  nor can you ever give  enough service.
author: James R. Cook

quote: In matters of commerce the fault of the Dutch Is offering too little and asking too much. The French are with equal advantage content  So we clap on Dutch bottoms just 20%.
author: George Canning

quote: Christmas is over  and Business is Business.
author: Franklin Pierce Adams

quote: People of privilege will always risk their complete destruction rather than surrender any material part of their advantage.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: Competition means decentralized planning by many separate persons.
author: Friedrich Hayek

quote: All business sagacity reduces itself in the last analysis to a judicious use of sabotage.
author: Thorstein Veblen

quote: Expansion means complexity and complexity decay.
author: Northcote Parkinson

quote: One man's wage rise is another man's price increase.
author: Harold Wilson

quote: Few have heard of Fra Luca Parioli  the inventor of double-entry bookkeeping  but he has probably had more influence on human life than has Dante or Michelangelo.
author: Herbert J. Muller

quote: When you've got them by their wallets  their hearts and minds will follow.
author: Fern Naito

quote: Chaplin is no businessman - all he knows is that he can't take anything less.
author: Sam Goldwyn

quote: What kind of society isn't structured on greed? The problem of social organization is how to set up an arrangement under which greed will do the least harm  capitalism is that kind of a system.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: Barbaric accuracy - whimpering humility.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: Patience is a most necessary quality for business  many a man would rather you heard his story than grant his request.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: A holding company is the people you give your money to while you're being searched.
author: Will Rogers

quote: In economics  the majority is always wrong.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: Whenever you see a successful business  someone once made a courageous decision.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: Pounds are the sons  not of pounds  but of pence.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: Business? It's quite simple. It's other people's money.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: A man isn't a man until he has to meet a payroll.
author: Ivan Shaffer

quote: As a rule  from what I've observed  the American Captain of Industry doesn't do anything out of business hours. When he has put the cat out and locked up the office for the night  he just relapses into a state of coma from which he emerges only to start being a Captain of Industry again.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: I don't believe in just ordering people to do things. You have to sort of grab an oar and row with them.
author: Harold Geneen

quote: Executive ability is deciding quickly and getting somebody else to do the work.
author: J. C. Pollard

quote: Capitalism in the United States has undergone profound modification  not just under the New Deal but through a consensus that continued to grow after the New Deal. Government in the U.S. today is a senior partner in every business in the country.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: Going to work for a large company is like getting on a train. Are you going sixty miles an hour or is the train going sixty miles an hour and you're just sitting still?
author: Paul Getty

quote: The happiest time in any man's life is when he is in red-hot pursuit of a dollar with a reasonable prospect of overtaking it.
author: Josh Billings

quote: In a hierarchy every employee tends to rise to his level of incompetence.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: What recommends commerce to me is its enterprise and bravery. It does not clasp its hands and pray to Jupiter.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Business is a combination of war and sport.
author: Andri Maurois

quote: Net - the biggest word in the language of business.
author: Herbert Casson

quote: Big business is basic to the very life of this country  and yet many -perhaps most - Americans have a deep-seated fear and an emotional repugnance to it. Here is monumental contradiction.
author: David Lilienthal

quote: The secret of business is to know something that nobody else knows.
author: Aristotle Onassis

quote: Don't gamble  take all your savings and buy some good stock and hold it till it goes up  then sell it. If it don't go up  don't buy it.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Good management consists of showing average people how to do the work of superior people.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: All business proceeds on beliefs  on judgements of probabilities  and not on certainties.
author: Charles W. Eliot

quote: Corporations cannot commit treason  nor be outlawed  nor excommunicated  for they have no souls.
author: Edward Coke

quote: People of the same trade seldom meet together  even for merriment and diversion  but the conversation ends in a conspiracy against the public  or in some contrivance to raise prices.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Capital is past savings accumulated for future production.
author: Jackson Martindell

quote: The business of America is business.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Power over a man's subsistence amounts to a power over his will.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: In the history of enterprise  most of the protagonists of major new products and companies began their education - not in the classroom  where the old ways are taught  but in the factories and labs where new ways are wrought ... nothing has been so rare in recent years as an Ivy League graduate who has made a significant innovation in American enterprise.
author: George Gilder

quote: If a cluttered desk is an indication of a cluttered mind  what is indicated by an empty desk?
author: Anonymous

quote: A businessman is a hybrid of a dancer and a calculator.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Had there been a computer a hundred years ago  it would probably have predicted that by now there would be so many horse-drawn vehicles it would be impossible to clear up all the manure.
author: K. William Kapp

quote: The Middle East is a region where oil is thicker than blood.
author: James Holland

quote: All professions are a conspiracy against the country.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Labour is not a commodity  or a standard  or a means to an ulterior end  but an end in itself.
author: George Brockway

quote: Without some dissimulation no business can be carried on at all.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Along this tree From root to crown Ideas flow up And vetoes down.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: A criminal is a person with predatory instincts who has not sufficient capital to form a corporation.
author: Howard Scott

quote: Profitability is the sovereign criterion of the enterprise.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: Business is more exciting than any game.
author: Lord Beaverbrook

quote: A company is judged by the president it keeps.
author: James Hulbert

quote: Inflation is defined as the quality that makes balloons larger and candy bars smaller.
author: General Features Corporation

quote: I think that there is nothing  not even crime  more opposed to poetry  to philosophy  ay  to life itself than this incessant business.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: It is not the employer who pays wages - he only handles the money. It is the product that pays wages.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Business is really more agreeable than pleasure  it interests the whole mind . . . more deeply. But it does not look as if it did.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: The ability to deal with people is as purchasable a commodity as sugar or coffee. And I pay more for that ability than for any other under the sun.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: In all modern depressions  recessions  or growth-correction  as variously they are called  we never miss the goods that are not produced. We miss only the opportunities for the labour - for the jobs - that are not provided.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: The solid wealth of insurance companies and the success of those who organize gambling are some indication of the profits to be derived from the efficient use of chance.
author: Edward de Bono

quote: To convert an hourly wage to an approximate yearly salary  double the wage and change the decimal to a comma.
author: Don Tichnor

quote: After an eight-hour day  workers require three overtime hours to produce two regular hours of results.
author: Anonymous

quote: Gross National Product is our Holy Grail.
author: Stuart Udall

quote: When two men in business always agree  one of them is unnecessary.
author: William Wrigley

quote: Few great men could pass Personnel.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: You build on cost and you borrow on value.
author: Paul Reichmann

quote: By pursuing his own interest (the individual) frequently promotes that of the society more effectually than when he really intends to promote it. I have never known much good done by those who affected to trade for the public good.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Management is now where the medical profession was when it decided that working in a drug store was not sufficient training to become a doctor.
author: Lawrence Appley

quote: The Bell System is like a damn big dragon. You kick it in the tail  and two years later  it feels it in its head.
author: Frederick Kappel

quote: Benefits should be granted little by little  so that they may be better enjoyed.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: The price spoils the pleasure.
author: French proverb

quote: Whose bread I eat  his song I sing.
author: German proverb

quote: To carry care to bed is to sleep with a pack on your back.
author: Thomas Haliburton

quote: The night shall be filled with music And the cares that infest the day Shall fold their tents like the Arabs  And as silently steal away.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Old Care has a mortgage on every estate  And that's what you pay for the wealth that you get.
author: J. G. Saxe

quote: Providence has given us hope and sleep as a compensation for the many cares of life.
author: Voltaire

quote: For want of a nail the shoe was lost  for want of a shoe the horse was lost  and for want of a horse the rider was lost  being overtaken and slain by the enemy  all for want of care about a horseshoe nail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Carelessness does more harm than a want of knowledge.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The wife of a careless man is almost a widow.
author: Hungarian proverb

quote: Ding  dong  bell  Pussy's in the well  Who put her in? Little Tommy Green. Who pulled her out? Little Johnny Stout.
author: Anonymous

quote: When the cat's away the mice will play.
author: English proverb

quote: It has been die providence of nature to give this creature nine lives instead of one.
author: Pilpay

quote: There is not room to swing a cat.
author: George Smollett

quote: A cat may look at a king.
author: John Heywood

quote: There is one basic cause of all effects.
author: Giordano Bruno

quote: In war events of importance are the result of trivial causes.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Christian Science explains all cause and effect as mental  not physical.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: God befriend us  as our cause is just!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Everything in nature is a cause from which there flows some effect.
author: Spinoza

quote: The first springs of great events  like those of great rivers  are often mean and little.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: If your lips would keep from slips five things observe with care: To whom you speak  of whom you speak  And how  and when  and where.
author: Anonymous

quote: Hasten slowly.
author: Augustus Caesar

quote: A wise man does not trust all his eggs to one basket.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: When you go to buy use your eyes  not your ears.
author: Czech proverb

quote: Be slow of tongue and quick of eye.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: The cautious seldom err.
author: Confucius

quote: Among mortals second thoughts are wisest.
author: Euripides

quote: Little boats should keep near shore.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Caution is the eldest child of wisdom.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Drink nothing without seeing it  sign nothing without reading it.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: It is a good thing to learn caution by the misfortunes of others.
author: Syrus

quote: To limit the press is to insult a nation  to prohibit reading of certain books is to declare the inhabitants to be either fools or slaves.
author: Claude Adrien Helvetius

quote: The dirtiest book of all is the expurgated book.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: No member of a society has a right to teach any doctrine contrary to what society holds to be true.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written or badly written.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Knowledge cannot defile  nor consequently the books  if the will and conscience be not defiled.
author: John Milton

quote: We can never be sure that the opinion we are endeavouring to stifle is a false opinion  and if we were sure  stifling it would be an evil still.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: No government ought to be without censors  and where the press is free  no one ever will.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Censorship  like charity  should begin at home  but unlike charity  it should end there.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: Obscenity is whatever gives a judge an erection.
author: Anonymous American Lawyer

quote: You censure this with difficulty because you have allowed it to become customary.
author: St. Jerome

quote: I am mortified to be told that  in the United States of America  the sale of a book can become a subject of inquiry  and of criminal inquiry too.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: If there had been a censorship of the press in Rome we should have had today neither Horace nor Juvenal  nor the philosophical writings of Cicero.
author: Voltaire

quote: Every burned book enlightens the world.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I make the most of all that comes  And the least of all that goes.
author: Sara Teasdale

quote: If you do not expect it  you will not find the unexpected  for it is hard to find and difficult.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Two roads diverged in a wood and I - I took the one less travelled by  And that has made all the difference.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Unless a man has trained himself for his chance  the chance will only make him ridiculous.
author: W. Matthews

quote: Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast. In the pool where you least expect it  will be a fish.
author: Ovid

quote: Chance is the pseudonym of God when he did not want to sign.
author: Anatole France

quote: The harder you work  the luckier you get.
author: Gary Player

quote: I think we consider too much the good luck of the early bird and not enough the bad luck of the early worm.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Fortune favours the bold.
author: Terence

quote: The luck of having talent is not enough  one must also have a talent for luck.
author: Hector Berlioz

quote: In the field of observation  chance favours the prepared mind.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: If you were born lucky  even your rooster will lay eggs.
author: Russian proverb

quote: Depend on the rabbit's foot if you will  but remember it didn't work for the rabbit!
author: R. E. Shay

quote: Those who mistake their good luck for their merit are inevitably bound for disaster.
author: J. Christopher Herold

quote: Luck is being ready for the chance.
author: J. Frank Dobie

quote: Every man  even the most blessed  needs a little more than average luck to survive this world.
author: Vance Bourjaily

quote: With luck on your side you can do without brains.
author: Giordano Bruno

quote: If fortune turns against you  even jelly breaks your tooth.
author: Persian proverb

quote: Fortune brings in some boats that are not steered.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I'm a great believer in luck. I find the harder I work  the more I have of it.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: Vexed sailors curse the rain For which poor shepherds prayed in vain.
author: Edmund Waller

quote: A permanent state of transition is man's most noble condition.
author: Juan Ramon Jimenez

quote: Change is not made without inconvenience  even from worse to better.
author: Richard Hooker

quote: All things are subject to change  and we change with them. (Omnia mutantur  nos et mutamur in illis.)
author: Anonymous

quote: If you want things to stay as they are  things will have to change.
author: Giuseppe di Lampedusa

quote: The days come and go like muffled and veiled figures sent from a distant friendly party  but they say nothing  and if we do not use the gifts they bring  they carry them as silently away.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The more things change  the more they stay the same. (Plus ca change  plus c'est la meme chose.)
author: Alphonse Karr

quote: There are three things which the public will always clamor for  sooner or later: namely  novelty  novelty  novelty.
author: Thomas Hood

quote: There is nothing permanent except change.
author: Heraclitus

quote: You can't step into the same river twice.
author: Heraclitus

quote: What is actual is actual only for one time. And only for one place.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: As one gets older  one discovers everything is going to be exactly the same with different hats on.
author: Noel Coward

quote: All changes  even the most longed for  have their melancholy  for what we leave behind us is apart of ourselves  we must die to one life before we can enter into another.
author: Anatole France

quote: When you get there  there isn't any there there.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Change must be measured from a known base line.
author: Evan Shute

quote: I can generally bear the separation  but I don't like the leave-taking.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: All things must change to something new  to something strange.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Every new adjustment is a crisis in self-esteem.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: I see gr-reat changes takin' place ivry day  but no change at all ivry fifty years.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: 'Change' is scientific  'progress' is ethical  change is indubitable  whereas progress is a matter of controversy.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Turbulence is life force. It is opportunity. Let's love turbulence and use it for change.
author: Ramsay Clark

quote: Would that life were like the shadow cast by a wall or a tree  but it is like the shadow of a bird in flight.
author: The Talmud

quote: Everything passes  everything wears out  everything breaks.
author: French proverb

quote: I've learned only that you never say never.
author: Marina von Neumann Whitman

quote: Always! That is the dreadful word ... it is a meaningless word  too.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The most ominous of fallacies: the belief that things can be kept static by inaction.
author: Freya Stark

quote: What is actual is actual only for one time  and only for one place.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Our days are a kaleidoscope. Every instant a change takes place. ... New harmonies  new contrasts  new combinations of every sort. ... The most familiar people stand each moment in some new relation to each other  to their work  to surrounding objects.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Just when I think I have learned the way to live  life changes.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: We change  whether we like it or not.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The one unchangeable certainty is that nothing is certain or unchangeable.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: All things must change to something new  to something strange.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Because things are the way they are  things will not stay the way they are.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: The moral world is as little exempt as the physical world from the law of ceaseless change  of perpetual flux.
author: Sir James Frazer

quote: Wherever we are  it is but a stage on the way to somewhere else  and whatever we do  however well we do it  it is only a preparation to do something else that shall be different.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: All is change  all yields its place and goes.
author: Euripides

quote: O visionary world  condition strange  Where naught abiding is but only change.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Things alter for the worse spontaneously  if they be not altered for the better designedly.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: For good and evil  man is a free creative spirit. This produces the very queer world we live in  a world in continuous creation and therefore continuous change and insecurity.
author: Joyce Cary

quote: All things change  nothing is extinguished.
author: Ovid

quote: Life is always at some turning point.
author: Irwin Edman

quote: Everything flows  nothing stays still.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Nothing in this world is permanent.
author: German proverb

quote: There are no permanent changes because change itself is permanent.
author: Ralph L. Woods

quote: Nothing is permanent but change.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Time  in the turning-over of days  works change for better or worse.
author: Pindar

quote: Impermanence is the law of the universe.
author: Carlene Hatcher Polite

quote: Everything changes but change itself.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Would that life were like the shadow cast by a wall or a tree  but it is like the shadow of a bird in flight.
author: Talmud

quote: Some people are still unaware that reality contains unparalleled beauties. The fantastic and unexpected  the ever-changing and renewing is nowhere so exemplified as in real life itself.
author: Berenice Abbott

quote: Life is change. Growth is optional. Choose wisely.
author: Karen Kaiser Clark

quote: Change is the law of life.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Life is measured by the rapidity of change  the succession of influences that modify the being.
author: George Eliot

quote: To live is to change  and to be perfect is to change often.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: One must never lose time in vainly regretting the past or in complaining against the changes which cause us discomfort  for change is the essence of life.
author: Anatole France

quote: A living thing is distinguished from a dead thing by the multiplicity of the changes at any moment taking place in it.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: When you're through changing  you're through.
author: Bruce Barton

quote: Change is the only evidence of life.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: To exist is to change  to change is to mature  to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly.
author: Henri Bergson

quote: Life belongs to the living  and he who lives must be prepared for changes.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Someday change will be accepted as life itself.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: What is more enthralling to the human mind than this splendid  boundless  colored mutability!-Life in the making?
author: David Grayson

quote: You must change in order to survive.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: The basic fact of today is the tremendous.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: Each new season grows from the leftovers from the past. That is the essence of change  and change is the basic law.
author: Hal Borland

quote: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.
author: John Dewey

quote: All that is not eternal is eternally out of date.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: When people shake their heads because we are living in a restless age  ask them how they would like to life in a stationary one  and do without change.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Variety is the soul of pleasure.
author: Aphra Behn

quote: If one sticks too rigidly to one's principles  one would hardly see anybody.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: I'm tired of playing worn-out depressing ladies in frayed bathrobes. I'm going to get a new hairdo and look terrific and go back to school and even if nobody notices  I'm going to be the most self-fulfilled lady on the block.
author: Joanne Woodward

quote: The healthy being craves an occasional wildness  a jolt from normality  a sharpening of the edge of appetite  his own little festival of the Saturnalia  a brief excursion from his way of life.
author: Robert Maclver

quote: Impermanence is the very essence of joy-the drop of bitterness that enables one to perceive the sweet.
author: Myrtle Reed

quote: There is a certain relief in change  even though it be from bad to worse  as I have found in traveling in a stagecoach  it is often a comfort to shift one's position and be bruised in a new place.
author: Washington Irving

quote: None of us knows what the next change is going to be  what unexpected opportunity is just around the corner  waiting to change all the tenor of our lives.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: The art of living does not consist in preserving and clinging to a particular mood of happiness  but in allowing happiness to change its form ... happiness  like a child  must be allowed to grow up.
author: Charles L. Morgan

quote: In embracing change  entrepreneurs ensure social and economic stability.
author: George Gilder

quote: Fluidity and discontinuity are central to the reality in which we live.
author: Mary Bateson

quote: Change does not change tradition. It strengthens it. Change is a challenge and an opportunity  not a threat.
author: Prince Phillip of England

quote: Changes are not only possible and predictable  but to deny them is to be an accomplice to one's own unnecessary vegetation.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: I have found that sitting in a place where you have never sat before can be inspiring.
author: Dodie Smith

quote: Continuity gives us roots  change gives us branches  letting us stretch and grow and reach new heights.
author: Pauline R. Kezer

quote: I've learned that you'll never be disappointed if you always keep an eye on uncharted territory  where you'll be challenged and growing and having fun.
author: Kirstie Alley

quote: The things we fear most in organizations-fluctuations  disturbances  imbalances-are the primary sources of creativity.
author: Margaret J. Wheatley

quote: It is in changing that things find purpose.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Turbulence is a life force. It is opportunity. Let's love turbulence and use it for change.
author: Ramsay Clark

quote: In all change  well looked into  the germinal good out-vails the apparent ill.
author: Francis Thompson

quote: The time is ripe  and rotten-ripe  for change  then let it come.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Society can only pursue its normal course by means of a certain progression of changes.
author: Anonymous

quote: Continuity in everything is unpleasant.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: We emphasize that we believe in change because we were born of it  we have lived by it  we prospered and grew great by it. So the status quo has never been our god  and we ask no one else to bow down before it.
author: Carl T. Rowan

quote: If you do what you've always done  you'll get what you've always gotten.
author: Anonymous

quote: Man needs  for his happiness  not only the enjoyment of this or that  but hope and enterprise and change.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: To remain young one must change.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: Where the old tracks are lost  new country is revealed with its wonders.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Weep not that the world changes- did it keep a stable  changeless state  it were a cause indeed to weep.
author: William Cullen Bryant

quote: Only in growth  reform  and change  paradoxically enough  is true security to be found.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: If folks can learn to be racist  then they can learn to be antiracist. If being sexist ain't genetic  then  dad gum  people can learn about gender equality.
author: Johnnetta Betsch Cole

quote: Change is inevitable in a progressive society. Change is constant.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: All bonafide revolutions are of necessity revolutions of the spirit.
author: Sonia Johnson

quote: We can say "Peace on Earth." We can sing about it  preach about it or pray about it  but if we have not internalized the mythology to make it happen inside us  then it will not be.
author: Betty Shabazz

quote: We're just getting started. We're just beginning to meet what will be the future-we've got the Model T.
author: Grace Murray Hopper

quote: Why do we shrink from change? What can come into being save by change?
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The challenges of change are always hard. It is important that we begin to unpack those challenges that confront this nation and realize that we each have a role that requires us to change and become more responsible for shaping our own future.
author: Hillary Rodham Clinton

quote: Progress is impossible without change  and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The mind of the most logical thinker goes so easily from one point to another that it is not hard to mistake motion for progress.
author: Margaret Collier Graham

quote: The world hates change  yet it is the only thing that has brought progress.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quote: The art of progress is to preserve order amid change  and to preserve change amid order.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Change is the watchword of progression. When we tire of well-worn ways  we seek for new. This restless craving in the souls of men spurs them to climb  and to seek the mountain view.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: He that will not apply new remedies must expect new evils.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: In a moving world readaptation is the price of longevity.
author: George Santayana

quote: A person needs at intervals to separate himself from family and companions and go to new places. He must go without his familiars in order to be open to influences  to change.
author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quote: Every saint has a past  and every sinner has a future.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: It's quite possible to leave your home for a walk in the early morning air and return a different person- beguiled  enchanted.
author: Mary Chase

quote: We must always change  renew  rejuvenate ourselves  otherwise we harden.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: On the human chessboard  all moves are possible.
author: Miriam Schiff

quote: There is nobody who totally lacks the courage to change.
author: Rollo May

quote: I've never met a person  I don't care what his condition  in whom I could not see possibilities. I don't care how much a man may consider himself a failure  I believe in him  for he can change the thing that is wrong in his life anytime he is prepared and ready to do it. Whenever he develops the desire  he can take away from his life the thing that is defeating it. The capacity for reformation and change lies within.
author: Preston Bradley

quote: The most amazing thing about little children ... was their fantastic adaptability.
author: Kristin Hunter

quote: Let a man turn to his own childhood-no further-if he will renew his sense of remoteness  and of the mystery of change.
author: Alice Meynell

quote: All love shifts and changes. I don't know if you can be wholeheartedly in love all the time.
author: Julie Andrews

quote: People change and forget to tell each other.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: When you have a baby  you set off an explosion in your marriage  and when the dust settles  your marriage is different from what it was. Not better  necessarily  not worse  necessarily  but different.
author: Nora Ephron

quote: There is change in all things. You yourself are subject to continual change and some decay  and this is common to the entire universe.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: No one can persuade another to change. Each of us guards a gate of change that can only be opened from the inside. We cannot open the gate of another  either by argument or emotional appeal.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: We measure success and depth by length and time  but it is possible to have a deep relationship that doesn't always stay the same.
author: Barbara Hershey

quote: One of the dreariest spots on life's road is the point of conviction that nothing will ever again happen to you.
author: Faith Baldwin

quote: I realized that if what we call human nature can be changed  then absolutely anything is possible. And from that moment  my life changed.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: A woman's life can really be a succession of lives  each revolving around some emotionally compelling situation or challenge  and each marked off by some intense experience.
author: Wallis Simpson

quote: Readjusting is a painful process  but most of us need it at one time or another.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: For many men  the acquisition of wealth does not end their troubles  it only changes them.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Our being is continually undergoing and entering upon changes. ... We must  strictly speaking  at every moment give each other up and let each other go and not hold each other back.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Change the fabric of your own soul and your own visions  and you change all.
author: Vachel Lindsay

quote: A person needs at intervals to separate himself from family and companions and go to new places. He must go without his familiars in order to be open to influence  to change.
author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quote: There are people who not only strive to remain static themselves  but strive to keep everything else so ... their position is almost laughably hopeless.
author: Odell Shepard

quote: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am  then I can change.
author: Carl Rogers

quote: Very often a change of self is needed more than a change of scene.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: There is not a single ill-doer who could not be turned to some good.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Things do not change  we change.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: We do not succeed in changing things according to our desire  but gradually our desire changes.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: The old woman I shall become will be quite different from the woman I am now. Another I is beginning.
author: George Sand

quote: The absurd man is he who never changes.
author: Auguste Barthelemy

quote: Man would be "otherwise." That's the essence of the specifically human.
author: Antonio Machado

quote: Never swap horses crossing a stream
author: American Proverb

quote: Earth changes  but thy soul and God stand sure.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: I am not now That which I have been.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There is a certain relief in change  even though it be from bad to worse  as I have found in travelling in a stagecoach  that it is often a comfort to shift one's position and be bruised in a new place.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Can the Ethiopian change his skin  or the leopard his spots?
author: Bible

quote: The world goes up and the world goes down  And the sunshine follows the rain  And yesterday's sneer and yesterday's frown Can never come over again.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: All things must change To something new  to something strange.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Revolutions are not made  they come.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: The old order changeth  yielding place to new.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Everything changes but change.
author: Israel Zangwill

quote: A prohibitionist is the sort of man one wouldn't care to drink with - even if he drank.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Abstainer: a weak man who yields to the temptation of denying himself a pleasure.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: He was not of an age but for all time.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: As time requireth  a man of marvellous mirth and past times  and sometimes of as sad gravity  as who say: a man for all seasons.
author: Robert Whittington

quote: At every single moment of one's life  one is going to be no less than what one has been.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Dogs often remind us of the human  ail-too human. Cats  never.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Don't compromise yourself. You are all you've got.
author: Janis Joplin

quote: Evil be to him who evil thinks. (Honi soit qui mal y pense.)
author: Motto for the Order of the Garter

quote: Good breeding  a union of kindness and independence.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If you can keep your head when all about you Are losing theirs and blaming it on you  If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you  But make allowance for their doubting too  If you can wait and not be tired by waiting  Or being lied about  don't deal in lies  Or being hated  don't give away to hating And yet don't look too good nor talk to wise  If you can dream - and not make dreams your master  If you can think - and not make thoughts your aim  If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster  And treat those two imposters just the same  If you can make one heap of all your winnings And risk it on one turn of pitch-and-toss  And lose  and start again at your beginnings And never breathe a word about your loss . . . If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue  Or walk with Kings nor lose the common touch  If neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you  If all men count with you  but none too much  If you can fill the unforgiving minute With sixty seconds' worth of distance run  Yours is the Earth and everything that's in it  And - which is more - you'll be a Man my son!
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Good  but not religious-good.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: He has not a single redeeming defect.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: His life was gentle  and the elements So mixed in him that nature might stand up
author: William Shakespeare

quote: And say to all the world  "This was a man!"
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Humility is no substitute for a good personality.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: I am a deeply superficial person.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: I believe that this neglected  wounded  inner child of the past is the major source of human misery.
author: John Bradshaw

quote: I can't believe that out of 100 000 sperm  you were the quickest.
author: Steven Pearl

quote: I mean by this Sacrament an outward and visible sign of an inward and spiritual grace.
author: Book of Common Prayer

quote: I'm not hard  I'm frightfully soft. But I will not be hounded.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: If Ford Madox Ford were placed stark naked in a room totally empty he would contrive to turn it into a mess.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: If I try to be like him  who will be like me?
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: Individualism is rather like innocence  there must be something unconscious about it.
author: Louis Kronenberger

quote: It is thus with most of us  we are what other people say we are. We know ourselves chiefly by hearsay.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Lord Ronald said nothing  he flung himself from the room  flung himself upon his horse and rode madly off in all directions.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: Oozing charm from every pore  He oiled his way around the floor.
author: Alan Jay Lerner

quote: Self-denial is not a virtue  it is only the effect of prudence on rascality.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The first time you meet Winston [Churchill] you see all his faults and the rest of your life you spend in discovering his virtues.
author: Lady Constance Lytton

quote: The proper time to influence the character of a child is about 100 years before he is born.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: There is a secret person undamaged in every individual.
author: Paul Shepard

quote: They are proud in humility  proud that they are not proud.
author: Robert Burton

quote: We only become what we are by the radical and deep-seeded refusal of that which others have made of us.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: When they came to shoe the horses  the beetle stretched out his leg.
author: English proverb

quote: It is native personality  and that alone  that endows a man to stand before presidents or generals  or in any distinguished collection  with aplomb -and not culture  or any intellect whatever.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Talents are best nurtured in solitude: character is best formed in the stormy billows of the world.
author: Goethe

quote: Style  personality - deliberately adopted and therefore a mask - is the only escape from the hot-faced bargainers and money-changers.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Show me a good and gracious loser  and I'll show you a failure.
author: Knute Rockne

quote: Everyone is a moon and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I'd rather be strongly wrong than weakly right.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: Altruism declares that any action taken for the benefit of others is good  and any action taken for one's own benefit is evil. Thus the beneficiary of an action is the only criterion of moral value - and so long as that beneficiary is anybody other than oneself  anything goes.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: To enjoy the things we ought  and to hate the things we ought  has the greatest bearing on excellence of character.
author: Aristotle

quote: Character building begins in our infancy  and continues until death.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Character is perfectly educated will.
author: Novalis

quote: Character is long-standing habit.
author: Plutarch

quote: I was born modest  not all over  but in spots.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Moderation is an ostentatious proof of our strength of character.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: If you think about what you ought to do for other people  your character will take care of itself.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: You cannot dream yourself into a character  you must hammer and forge yourself one.
author: James A. Froude

quote: A modest man is usually admired - if people ever hear of him.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: The clock struck eleven with the respectful unobtrusiveness of one whose mission in life is to be ignored.
author: Saki

quote: Some people approach every problem with an open mouth.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: My specialty is detached malevolence.
author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

quote: Every one is as God made him and oftentimes a good deal worse.
author: Cervantes

quote: Character is that which can do without success.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Character is what God and the angels know of us  reputation is what men and women think of us.
author: Horace Mann

quote: One can acquire everything in solitude except character.
author: Stendhal

quote: Every man has three characters - that which he exhibits  that which he has  and that which he thinks he has.
author: Alphonse Kan

quote: If I take care of my character  my reputation will take care of itself.
author: D. L. Moody

quote: A wise and an understanding heart.
author: Bible

quote: Everyone ought to bear patiently the results of his own conduct.
author: Phaedrus

quote: Every man has his follies - and often they are the most interesting things he has got.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Indecision is like a stepchild: if he doesn't wash his hands  he is called dirty  if he does  he is wasting the water.
author: African proverb

quote: Tis e'er the wont of simple folk to prize the deed and overlook the motive  and of learned folk to discount the deed and lay open the soul of the doer.
author: John Barth

quote: Learn to say 'No'  it will be of more use to you than to be able to read Latin.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: To dream of the person you would like to be is to waste the person you are.
author: Anonymous

quote: Character is like a tree  and reputation like its shadow. The shadow is what we think of it  the tree is the real thing.
author: Anonymous

quote: Every man in the world is better than some one else. And not as good as some one else.
author: William Saroyan

quote: In Victorian times the purpose of life was to develop a personality once and for all and then stand on it.
author: Ashley Montagu

quote: Charm is a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question.
author: Albert Camus

quote: I'm not the heroic type  really. I was beaten up by Quakers.
author: Woody Allen

quote: A person's reputation is a mixture of what his friends  enemies  and relatives say behind his back.
author: Anonymous

quote: Always do right. This will gratify some people  and astonish the rest.
author: Mark Twain

quote: He's an honest man - you could shoot craps with him over the telephone.
author: Earl Wilson

quote: The man whose conscience never troubles him must have it pretty well trained.
author: Anonymous

quote: Conscience is a treacherous thing  and mine behaves badly whenever there is a serious danger of being found out.
author: Margaret Lane

quote: Too often when conscience tries to speak  the line seems to be busy.
author: Anonymous

quote: He liked to like people  therefore people liked him.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Generous people are rarely mentally ill people.
author: Karl Menninger

quote: When wealth is lost  nothing is lost  When health is lost  something is lost  When character is lost  all is lost!
author: Anonymous

quote: Every one is as God made him  and often a great deal worse.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: The great hope of society is individual character.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: You must look into people as well as at them.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Human improvement is from within outward.
author: James Froude

quote: Talent is nurtured in solitude  character is formed in the stormy billows of the world.
author: Goethe

quote: O Douglas  O Douglas! Tender and true.
author: Sir Richard Holland

quote: Only what we have wrought into our character during life can we take away with us.
author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quote: Every man has three characters - that which he exhibits  that which he has  and that which he thinks he has.
author: Alphonse Karr

quote: Not in the clamor of the crowded street  Not in the shouts and plaudits of the throng  But in ourselves  are triumph and defeat.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Who knows nothing base  Fears nothing known.
author: Owen Meredith

quote: In men whom men condemn as ill I find so much of goodness still  In men whom men pronounce divine I find so much of sin and blot I do not dare to draw a line Between the two  where God has not.
author: Joaquin Miller

quote: In this world a man must either be anvil or hammer.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: It is more blessed to give than to receive.
author: Anonymous

quote: Charity is the perfection and ornament of religion.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: My poor are my best patients. God pays for them.
author: Herman Boerhaave

quote: Though I have all faith  so that I could remove mountains  and have not charity  I am nothing.
author: I Corinthians

quote: And now abideth faith  hope  charity  these three  but the greatest of these is charity.
author: I Corinthians

quote: What we frankly give  forever is our own.
author: George Granville

quote: As the purse is emptied the heart is filled.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: That charity which longs to publish itself  ceases to be charity.
author: Ulrich von Hutton

quote: He who waits to do a great deal of good at once  will never do anything.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I was an hungred  and ye gave me meat  I was thirsty  and ye gave me drink  I was a stranger  and ye took me in.
author: Matthew

quote: Organized charity  scrimped and iced  In the name of the cautious  statistical Christ.
author: John Boyle O'Reilly

quote: Charity shall cover the multitude of sins.
author: Bible

quote: Our charity begins at home  And mostly ends where it begins.
author: Horace Smith

quote: Steady as a clock  busy as a bee  and cheerful as a cricket.
author: Martha Washington

quote: I'm not happy  I'm cheerful. There's a difference. A happy woman has no cares at all. A cheerful woman has cares but has learned how to deal with them.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: The clearest sign of wisdom is continued cheerfulness.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Cheerfulness is as natural to the heart of man in strong health as color to his cheek  and wherever there is habitual gloom there must be either bad air  unwholesome food  improperly severe labor or erring habits of life.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Cheerfulness prepares a glorious mind for all the noblest acts.
author: Elizabeth Ann Seton

quote: A man of gladness seldom falls into madness.
author: Anonymous

quote: Always let them think of you as singing and dancing.
author: Anita Brookner

quote: Developing a cheerful disposition can permit an atmosphere wherein one's spirit can be nurtured and encouraged to blossom and bear fruit. Being pessimistic and negative about our experiences will not enhance the quality of our lives.
author: Barbara W. Winder

quote: Gaiety alone  as it were  is the hard cash of happiness  everything else is just a promissory note.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: I exhort you to be of good cheer.
author: Anonymous

quote: He who sings frightens away his ills.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: A cheerful look makes a dish a feast
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: Cheer up  the worst is yet to come.
author: Philander Johnson

quote: Let us be of good cheer  remembering that the misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never happen.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: A good laugh is sunshine in a house.
author: William Thackeray

quote: Do ye hear the children weeping  O my brothers?
author: E. B. Browning

quote: When I was a child  I spake as a child  I understood as a child  I thought as a child  but when I became a man  I put away childish things.
author: Anonymous

quote: A little curly-headed  good-for-nothing  And mischief-making monkey from his birth.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Better to be driven out from among men than to be disliked of children.
author: R. H. Dana

quote: Children should be seen and not heard.
author: English proverb

quote: Spare the rod and spoil the child.
author: English proverb

quote: Teach your child to hold his tongue  He'll learn fast enough to speak.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: There was a little girl  And she had a little curl  Right in the middle of her forehead  When she was good she was very  very good  When she was bad she was horrid.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Suffer the little children to come unto me  and forbid them not  for of such is the kingdom of God.
author: Bible

quote: A wise son maketh a glad father.
author: Bible

quote: It is a wise child that knows his own father.
author: Homer

quote: Rachel weeping for her children  and would not be comforted  because they are not.
author: Matthew

quote: The childhood shows the man  As morning shows the day.
author: John Milton

quote: The children in Holland take pleasure in making What the children in England take pleasure in breaking.
author: Old Nursery Rhyme

quote: The wildest colts make the best horses.
author: Plutarch

quote: Train up a child in the way he should go  and when he is old he will not depart from it.
author: Bible

quote: How dear to this heart are the scenes of my childhood  When fond recollection presents them to view.
author: Samuel Woodworth

quote: I think that saving a little child And bringing him to his own  Is a derned sight better business Than loafing around the throne.
author: John Hay

quote: It is a wise father that knows his own child.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: It is very nice to think The world is full of meat and drink With little children saying grace In every Christian kind of place.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The best way to make children good is to make them happy.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The child is father of the man.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: A child's a plaything for an hour.
author: Mary Lamb

quote: An adolescent is both an impulsive child and a self-starting adult.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Beat your child once a day. If you don't know why  he does.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Children have no use for psychology. They detest sociology. They still believe in God  the family  angels  devils  witches  goblins  logic  clarity  punctuation  and other such obsolete stuff. When a book is boring  they yawn openly. They don't expect their writer to redeem humanity  but leave to adults such childish allusions.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Juvenile appraisals of other juveniles make up in clarity what they lack in charity.
author: Edgar Z. Friedenberg

quote: Of all animals  the boy is the most unmanageable.
author: Plato

quote: Childhood - a period of waiting for the moment when I could send everyone and everything connected with it to hell.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: The great cathedral space which was childhood.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: A child thinks twenty shillings and twenty years can scarce ever be spent.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: If children grew up according to early indications  we should have nothing but geniuses.
author: Goethe

quote: What children expect from grownups is not to be 'understood'  but only to be loved  even though this love may be expressed clumsily or in sternness. Intimacy does not exist between generations - only trust.
author: Carl Zucker

quote: Healthy children will not fear life if their elders have integrity enough not to fear death.
author: Erik Erikson

quote: William Blake really is important  my cornerstone. Nobody ever told me before he did that childhood was such a damned serious business.
author: Maurice Sendak

quote: Out of the mouths of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength.
author: Bible

quote: When I was a child  I spake as a child  I understood as a child  I thought as a child  but when I became a man I put away childish things.
author: Bible

quote: Children have more need of models than of critics.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Children are remarkable for their intelligence and ardour  for their curiosity  their intolerance of shams  the clarity and ruthlessness of their vision.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The events of childhood do not pass but repeat themselves like seasons of the year.
author: Eleanor Farjeon

quote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders  but they have never failed to imitate them.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Ask your child what he wants for dinner only if he is buying.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: All children wear the sign: 'I want to be important NOW.' Many of our juvenile delinquency problems arise because nobody reads the sign.
author: Dan Pursuit

quote: If a child lives with approval  he learns to live with himself.
author: Dorothy Law Nolte

quote: Your children are not dead. They are just waiting until the world deserves them.
author: Robert Browning

quote: What's done to children  they will do to society.
author: Karl Menninger

quote: The hardest job kids face today is learning good manners without seeing any.
author: Fred Astaire

quote: Unlike grownups  children have little need to deceive themselves.
author: Goethe

quote: We've had bad luck with our kids - they've all grown up.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots  the other  wings.
author: Hodding Carter

quote: Give me the children until they are seven and anyone may have them afterwards.
author: St. Francis Xavier

quote: There are only two things a child will share willingly - communicable diseases and his mother's age.
author: Benjamin Spock

quote: Do not mistake a child for his symptom.
author: Erik Erikson

quote: Babies are such a nice way to start people.
author: Don Herold

quote: Children need love  especially when they do not deserve it.
author: Harold S. Hulbert

quote: If a child is to keep alive his inborn sense of wonder without any such gift from the fairies  he needs the companionship of at least one adult who can share it  rediscovering with him the joy  excitement and mystery of the world we live in.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: Nothing has a stronger influence psychologically on their environment  and especially on their children  than the unlived lives of the parents.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Books ... rarely  if ever  talk about what children can make of themselves  about the powers that from the day or moment of birth are present in every child.
author: John Holt

quote: I do not choose to run for President in 1928.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Betwixt the devil and the deap sea.
author: Erasmus

quote: There's small choice in rotten apples.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: When to elect there is but one  Tis Hobson's Choice  take that or none.
author: Thomas Ward

quote: For many are called  but few are chosen.
author: Matthew

quote: In every pang that rends the heart The Man of Sorrows had a part.
author: Michael Bruce

quote: The sages and heroes of history are receding from us  and history contracts the record of their deeds into a narrower and narrower page. But time has no power over the name and deeds and words of Jesus Christ.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Jesus Christ the same yesterday  and today  and forever.
author: Hebrews

quote: The foxes have holes  and the birds of the air have nests  but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.
author: Matthew

quote: Jesus... was made a little lower than the angels.
author: Hebrews

quote: All His glory and beauty come from within  and there He delights to dwell  His visits there are frequent  His conversation sweet  His comforts refreshing  and His peace passing all understanding.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: Alexander  Caesar  Charlemagne and I myself have founded empires  but upon what do these creations of our genius depend? Upon force. Jesus alone founded His empire upon love  and to this very day millions would die for Him.
author: Napoleon

quote: If the life and death of Socrates were those of a sage  the life and death of Jesus were those of a God.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: A Christian is God Almighty's gentleman.
author: A. W. Hare

quote: Onward  Christian soldiers  Marching as to war  With the cross of Jesus Going on before.
author: Sabine Baring-Gould

quote: Servant of God  well done! Well hast thou fought The better fight.
author: John Milton

quote: To be like Christ is to be a Christian.
author: William Penn

quote: Whatever makes men good Christians  makes them good citizens.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Christianity is completed Judaism  or it is nothing.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: His Christianity was muscular.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Christianity ruined emperors  but saved peoples.
author: Alfred de Musset

quote: Christianity is a battle  not a dream
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: I desire no other evidence of the truth to Christianity than the Lord's Prayer.
author: Mme. De Stael

quote: Christianity  with its doctrine of humility  of forgiveness  of love  is incompatible with the state  with its haughtiness  its violence  its punishment  its wars.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Christianity is part of the Common Law of England.
author: Mathew Hale

quote: Christianity  if false  is not important. If Christianity is true  however  it is of infinite importance. What it cannot be is moderately important.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Organized religion is making Christianity political rather than making politics Christian.
author: Laurens Van der Post

quote: The idea of Christ is much older than Christianity.
author: George Santayana

quote: Unlike Christianity  which preached a peace that it never achieved  Islam unashamedly came with a sword.
author: Stephen Runciman

quote: Why do born-again people so often make you wish they'd never been born the first time?
author: Katharine Whitehorn

quote: Somewhere  and I can't find where  I read about an Eskimo hunter who asked the local missionary priest  'If I did not know about God and sin  would I go to hell?' 'No'  said the priest  'not if you did not know.' 'Then why ' asked the Eskimo earnestly  'did you tell me?'
author: Annie Dillard

quote: Christians have burned each other  quite persuaded That all the apostles would have done as they did.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Christian: one who believes that the New Testament is a divinely inspired book admirably suited to the spiritual needs of his neighbour.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Most people believe that the Christian commandments are intentionally a little too severe - like setting a clock half an hour ahead to make sure of not being late in the morning.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: A Christian is nothing but a sinful man who has put himself to school for Christ for the honest purpose of becoming better.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen. Not only because I see it  but because I see everything by it.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: A Christian is a man who feels Repentance on a Sunday For what he did on Saturday And is going to do on Monday.
author: Thomas R. Ybarra

quote: Hatred of Judaism is at bottom hatred of Christianity.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: It is not by driving away our brother that we can be alone with God.
author: George Macdonald

quote: God will forgive me. That's his business.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Ethical man - a Christian holding four aces.
author: Mark Twain

quote: People in general are equally horrified at hearing the Christian religion doubted  and at seeing it practised.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Christian life consists of faith and charity.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Many a sober Christian would rather admit that a wafer is God than that God is a cruel and capricious tyrant.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: If you go to church  and like the singing better than the preaching  that's not orthodox.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Let's dance and sing and make good cheer  For Christmas comes but once a year.
author: G. MacFarren

quote: 0 little town of Bethlehem  How still we see thee lie! Above thy deep and dreamless sleep The silent stars go by.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: No Santa Claus! Thank God  he lives  and he lives forever. A thousand years from now  Virginia  nay  ten times ten thousand years from now  he will continue to make glad the heart of childhood.
author: Francis P. Church

quote: I heard the bells on Christmas Day Their old  familiar carols play  And wild and sweet The words repeat Of peace on earth  good-will to men!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: For unto you is born this day in the city of David  a Saviour  which is Christ the Lord.
author: Luke

quote: God rest ye  little children  let nothing you affright  For Jesus Christ  your Saviour  was born this happy night  Along the hills of Galilee the white flocks sleeping lay  When Christ  the Child of Nazareth  was born on Christmas day.
author: Dinah Mulock Craik

quote: Twas the night before Christmas  when all through the house  Not a creature was stirring - not even a mouse  The stockings were hung by the chimney with care  In hopes that St. Nicholas soon would be there.
author: Clement C. Moore

quote: Hark the herald angels sing  "Glory to the new-born king." Peace on earth  and mercy mild  God and sinners reconciled!
author: Charles Wesley

quote: Cathedrals  Luxury liners laden with souls  Holding to the east their hulls of stone.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: It was founded upon a rock.
author: Matthew

quote: The nearer the church  the further from God.
author: Bishop Andrews

quote: Whenever God erects a house of prayer The devil always builds a chapel there  And 'twill be found  upon examination  The latter has the largest congregation.
author: Daniel Defoe

quote: Division has done more to hide Christ from the view of men than all the infidelity that has ever been spoken.
author: George Macdonald

quote: I never weary of great churches. It is my favourite kind of mountain scenery. Mankind was never so happily inspired as when it made a cathedral.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: See the Gospel Church secure  And founded on a Rock! All her promises are sure  Her bulwarks who can shock? Count her every precious shrine  Tell  to after-ages tell  Fortified by power divine  The Church can never fail.
author: Charles Wesley

quote: The itch of disputing is the scab of the churches.
author: Sir Henry Wotton

quote: The long arm of coincidence.
author: Anonymous

quote: Man is not the creature of circumstances  Circumstances are the creatures of men.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Circumstances alter cases.
author: Thomas Haliburton

quote: The happy combination of fortuitous circumstances.
author: Walter Scott

quote: The circumstances of others seem good to us  while ours seem good to others.
author: Syrus

quote: A tourist is a fellow who drives thousands of miles so he can be photographed standing in front of his car.
author: Emile Ganest

quote: When we can't get away for a vacation  we get the same feeling by staying home and tipping every person that smiles.
author: Susie Spanos

quote: One certainty when you travel is the moment you arrive in a foreign country  the American dollar will fall like a stone.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: The trouble with all these other countries is they're all being run by foreigners.
author: Anonymous

quote: My wife loves Europe  but to me it's a bad day at a theme park.
author: Jay Leno

quote: This summer one-third of the nation will be ill-housed  ill-nourished  and ill-clad. Only they call it a vacation.
author: Joseph Salak

quote: My wife tells me she doesn't care what I do when I'm away  as long as I'm not enjoying it.
author: Lee Trevino

quote: On cable TV  they have a weather channel - twenty-four hours of weather. We had something like that where I grew up. We called it a window.
author: Dan Spencer

quote: There's a lot of nice things about Denver. I just don't  for the life of me  know what they are.
author: Judy Hampton

quote: The people of Seattle deny they get much rain  while the rest of the country thinks of it as America's bladder.
author: Anonymous

quote: Cold! If the thermometer had been an inch longer we'd all have frozen to death.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The tanned appearance of many New Englanders is not sunburn - it is rust.
author: Anonymous

quote: I hate Billings  Montana. They have a fashion show at Sears Roebuck - no models. You open a catalog and point.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: Hollywood is a place where people from Iowa mistake each other for movie stars.
author: Fred Allen

quote: L.A.'s large convenience stores are so big they can accommodate up to twenty armed robbers at one time.
author: Jay Leno

quote: After years of mocking L.A. for its smog  the people of Denver are now coughing out of the other side of their mouths.
author: Anonymous

quote: There's nothing wrong with Southern California that a rise in the ocean level wouldn't cure.
author: Ross MacDonald

quote: It looks as if Hollywood brides keep the bouquets and throw away the groom.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: It is possible to live in San Francisco for $35 000 a year. Obviously  that doesn't include food or lodging.
author: Kenn Carlson

quote: L.A. bumper sticker: Keep honking - I'm reloading.
author: Anonymous

quote: Miami bumper sticker: My horn is broken-so watch for my finger.
author: Anonymous

quote: Miami drivers will attempt to pass you inside a car wash.
author: Dave Barry

quote: I lived in Miami for a while  in a section with a lot of really old people. The average age in my apartment house was dead.
author: Gabe Kaplan
