quote: I have no respect for gangs today. None. They just drive by and shoot people. At least in the old days  like in West Side Story  the gangs used to dance with each other.
author: Robert G. Lee

quote: A car is useless in New York  essential everywhere else. The same with good manners.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: I feel about New York as a child whose father is a bank robber. Not perfect  but I still love him.
author: Woody Allen

quote: New Yorkers are so impersonal  if it wasn't for muggings there wouldn't be any contact at all!
author: Robert Orben

quote: Living in New York is like being at some terrible late-night party. You're tired  you've had a headache since you arrived  but you can't leave because then you'd miss the party.
author: Simon Hoggart

quote: Living in California adds ten years to a man's life. And those extra ten years I'd like to spend in New York.
author: Harry Ruby

quote: I have just returned from Boston  it is the only sane thing to do if you find yourself up there.
author: Fred Allen

quote: A small town is usually divided by a railroad  a main street  two churches  and a lot of opinions.
author: Anonymous

quote: texan starting eternity: I never dreamed heaven would be so much like Texas. companion: Who said this was heaven?
author: Anonymous

quote: Flying from the U.S. to Tokyo takes approximately as long as law school.
author: Dave Barry

quote: I would say that the single most important conclusion I reached  after traveling through Japan  as well as countless hours reading  studying  and analyzing this fascinating culture  is that you should always tighten the cap on the shampoo bottle before you put it in your suitcase.
author: Dave Barry

quote: I asked Tom if countries always apologized when they had done wrong  and he said: "Yes: the little one does."
author: Mark Twain

quote: France is the only country where the money falls apart and you can't tear the toilet paper.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: How can you be expected to govern a country that has 246 kinds of cheese?
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: In Paris they simply stared when I spoke to them in French  I never did succeed in making those idiots understand their own language.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Good Americans  when they die  go to Paris.
author: T. G. Appleton

quote: My father never lived to see his dream come true of an all-Yiddish-speaking Canada.
author: David Steinberg

quote: London: A place you go to get bronchitis.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: Take a perfect day  add six hours of rain and fog  and you have instant London.
author: Anonymous

quote: Always remember that you are an Englishman and therefore have drawn first prize in the lottery of life.
author: Cecil Rhodes

quote: I once saw a pin on a Delta Airlines employee  and I asked him what the letters in Delta stand for. He said  "Don't Expect Luggage To Arrive."
author: Adam Christing

quote: When people ask me if I have any spare change  I tell them I have it at home in my spare wallet.
author: Nick Arnette

quote: When I first came to this country  I didn't have a nickel in my pocket - now I have a nickel in my pocket.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Thank God we're living in a country where the sky's the limit  the stores are open late  and  thanks to television  you can shop in bed.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: I love the polite drivers in La Jolla. At an intersection . . . most expensive car goes first.
author: Kee Flynn

quote: We had a very successful trip to Russia we got back.
author: Bob Hope

quote: There is nothing safer than flying -  it's crashing that is dangerous.
author: Theo Cowan

quote: I would love to speak a foreign language  but I can't. So I grew hair under my arms instead.
author: Sue Kolensky

quote: Chicago was started by a bunch of New Yorkers who said "Gee  I'm enjoying the crime and the poverty  but it just isn't cold enough."
author: Richard Jeni

quote: I am a citizen  not of Athens or Greece  but of the world.
author: Socrates

quote: Paul said  I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus  a city in Cilicia  a citizen of no mean city.
author: Anonymous

quote: This poor little one-horse town.
author: S. L. Clemens

quote: If you would know and not be known  live in a city.
author: Walter Colton

quote: God made the country  and man made the town.
author: William Cowper

quote: Cities force growth  and make men talkative and entertaining  but they make them artificial.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: In the busy haunts of men.
author: Felicia D. Hemans

quote: Far from gay cities  and the way of men.
author: Homer

quote: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hid.
author: Matthew

quote: The people are the city.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Civilization is nothing more than the effort to reduce the use of force to the last resort.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Each new generation is a fresh invasion of savages.
author: Harvey Allen

quote: Respectability is the dickey on the bosom of civilization.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The human race has improved everything except the human race.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: A civilized society is one that exhibits the five qualities of truth  beauty  adventure  art and peace.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: There is such a thing as too much couth.
author: S. J. Perelman

quote: We are in the first age since the dawn of civilization in which people have dared to think it practicable to make the benefits of civilization available to the whole human race.
author: Arnold Toynbee

quote: The human landscape of the New World shows a conquest of nature by an intelligence that does not love it.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Let us humour if we can The vertical man Though we value none But the horizontal one.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: Our lifetime may be the last that will be lived out in a technological society.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: To be able to fill leisure intelligently is the last product of civilization.
author: Arnold Toynbee

quote: So I should say that civilizations begin with religion and stoicism: they end with scepticism and unbelief  and the undisciplined pursuit of individual pleasure. A civilization is born stoic and dies epicurean.
author: Will Durant

quote: We are all afraid - for our confidence  for the future  for the world. That is the nature of the human imagination. Yet every man  every civilization  has gone forward because of its engagement with what it has set itself to do. The personal commitment and the emotional commitment working together as one  has made the Ascent of Man.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: Civilization is just a slow process of learning to be kind.
author: Charles L. Lucas

quote: Civilization is a movement - not a condition  a voyage - not a harbour.
author: Arnold Toynbee

quote: Since barbarism has its pleasures it naturally has its apologists.
author: George Santayana

quote: We sit by and watch the barbarian. We tolerate him in the long stretches of peace  we are not afraid. We are tickled by his irreverence  his comic inversion of our old certitudes and our fixed creed refreshes us  we laugh. But as we laugh we are watched by large and awful faces from beyond  and on these faces there are no smiles.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: A race preserves its vigour so long as it harbours a real contrast between what has been and what may be  and so long as it is nerved by the vigour to adventure beyond the safeties of the past. Without adventure  civilization is in full decay.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Civilizations die from philosophical calm  irony  and the sense of fair play quite as surely as they die of debauchery.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: The three great elements of modern civilization  Gunpowder  Printing  and the Protestant Religion.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: A savage is simply a human organism that has not received enough news from the human race.
author: John Ciardi

quote: This is the way the world ends Not with a bang but a whimper.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: A tablecloth restaurant is still one of the great rewards of civilization.
author: Harry Golden

quote: The end of the human race will be that it will eventually die of civilization.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If you would civilize a man  begin with his grandmother.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: To be a man is to feel that one's own stone contributes to building the edifice of the world.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A sufficient measure of civilization is the influence of good women.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We think our civilization near its meridian  but we are yet only at the cock-crowing and the morning star.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The path of civilization is paved with tin cans.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Nations  like individuals  live and die  but civilization cannot die.
author: Guiseppe Mazzini

quote: Civilization is a movement and not a condition  a voyage and not a harbor.
author: Arnold Toynbee

quote: All will come out in the washing.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Wash you  make you clean.
author: Isaiah

quote: God loveth the clean.
author: Koran

quote: If dirt was trumps  what hands you would hold!
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Certainly this is a duty  not a sin. "Cleanliness is indeed next to godliness."
author: John Wesley

quote: If you would lift me you must be on a higher ground.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Politics and the pulpit are terms that have little agreement.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: As a career  the business of an orthodox preacher is about as successful as that of a celluloid dog chasing an asbestos cat through Hell.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The life of a conscientious clergyman is not easy. I have always considered a clergyman as the father of a larger family than he is able to maintain. I would rather have chancery suits upon my hands than the cure of souls.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The defects of a preacher are soon spied.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Cleverness is serviceable for everything  sufficient for nothing.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: Be good  sweet maid  and let who will be clever.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: The clothes make the man.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Whenas in silks my Julia goes  Then  then  methinks  how sweetly flows The liquefaction of her clothes!
author: Robert Herrick

quote: Costly thy habit as thy purse can buy  But not express'd in fancy  rich  not gaudy  For the apparel oft proclaims the man.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The soul of this man is his clothes.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: She wears her clothes as if they were thrown on her with a pitchfork.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: The ideal committee is one with me as chairman  and two other members in bed with flu.
author: Lord Milverton

quote: If Moses had been a committee  the Israelites would still be in Egypt.
author: J. B. Hughes

quote: A committee of one gets things done.
author: Joe Ryan

quote: A camel is a horse designed by a committee.
author: Anonymous

quote: If Columbus had had an advisory committee he would probably still be at the dock.
author: Justice Arthur Goldberg

quote: An institution is the lengthening shadow of one man.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I do not care to belong to a club that accepts people like me as members.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Those mausoleums of inactive masculinity are places for men who prefer armchairs to women.
author: V. S. Pritchett

quote: What is a committee? A group of the unwilling  picked from the unfit  to do the unnecessary.
author: Richard Harkness

quote: No grand idea was ever born in a conference  but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Life is my college. May I graduate well  and earn some honors!
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: College is the best time of your life. When else are your parents going to spend several thousand dollars a year just for you to go to a strange town and get drunk every night?
author: David Wood

quote: Those who go to college and never get out are called professors.
author: Anonymous

quote: Life is my college. May I graduate well  and earn some honors!
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: College is the best time of your life. When else are your parents going to spend several thousand dollars a year just for you to go to a strange town and get drunk every night?
author: David Wood

author: Louisa May Alcott

author: David Wood

quote: Those who go to college and never get out are called professors.
author: Anonymous

quote: Colors speak all languages.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Blue is true  Yellow's jealous  Green's forsaken  Red's brazen  White is love  And black is death.
author: Anonymous

quote: More pernicious nonsense was never devised by man than treaties of commerce.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Commerce links all mankind in one common brotherhood of mutual dependence and interests.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Commerce is the equalizer of the wealth of nations.
author: William E. Gladstone

quote: Whatever has a tendency to promote the civil intercourse of nations by an exchange of benefits is a subject as worthy of philosophy as of politics.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: What distinguishes the majority of men from the few is their ability to act accordingly to their beliefs.
author: Henry Miller

quote: What a man believes  he will die for. What a man merely thinks  he will change his mind about.
author: Anonymous

quote: When you have decided what you believe  what you feel must be done  have the courage to stand alone and be counted.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The eloquent man is he who is no beautiful speaker  but who is inwardly and desperately drunk with a certain belief.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A belief which does not spring from a conviction in the emotions is no belief at all.
author: Evelyn Scott

quote: Whether you are really right or not doesn't matter  it's the belief that counts.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: Many a man has walked up to the opportunity for which he has long been preparing himself  looked it full in the face  and then begun to get cold feet... when it comes to betting on yourself and your power to do the thing you know you must do or write yourself down a failure  you're a chicken-livered coward if you hesitate.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: The wise man puts all his eggs in one basket and watches the basket.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: Poverty is uncomfortable  as I can testify: but nine times out of ten the best thing that can happen to a young man is to be tossed overboard and compelled to sink or swim for himself.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Anytime you play golf for whatever you've got  that's pressure. I'd like to see H.L. Hunt go out there and play for $3 billion.
author: Lee Trevino

quote: There is a point at which everything becomes simple and there is no longer any question of choice  because all you have staked will be lost if you look back. Life's point of no return.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Even now we can draw back. But once we cross that little bridge  we must settle things by the sword.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: You don't know what pressure is until you play for $5 with only $2 in your pocket.
author: Lee Trevino

quote: The fixed determination to have acquired the warrior soul  to either conquer or perish with honor  is the secret of victory.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: In war there is no substitute for victory.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Victory at all costs  victory in spite of all terror  victory however long and hard the road may be  for without victory there is no survival.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Better that we should die fighting than be outraged and dishonored. Better to die than to live in slavery.
author: Emmeline Pankhurst

quote: I sincerely wish war was a pleasanter and easier business than it is  but it does not admit of holidays.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Every attempt to make war easy and safe will result in humiliation and disaster.
author: General William T. Sherman

quote: If you start to take Vienna  take Vienna.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The worth of every conviction consists precisely in the steadfastness with which it is held.
author: Jane Adams

quote: The moment one definitely commits oneself  the Providence moves  too. All sorts of things occur to help that would never otherwise have occurred. A stream of events issues from the decision  raising unforeseen incidents and meetings and material assistance  which no man could have dreamt would have come his way.
author: WH. Murray

quote: There is no strong performance without a little fanaticism in the performer.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If you don't wake up with something in your stomach every day that makes you think  "I want to make this movie " it'll never get made.
author: Sherry Lansing

quote: We can do whatever we wish to do provided our wish is strong enough. But the tremendous effort needed- one doesn't always want to make it-does one? ... But what else can be done? What's the alternative? What do you want most to do? That's what I have to keep asking myself  in the face of difficulties.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: I am a stranger to half measures.
author: Marita Golden

quote: Perform without fail what you resolve.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: To say yes  you have to sweat and roll up your sleeves and plunge both hands into life up to the elbows. It is easy to say no  even if saying no means death.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: What one has  one ought to use  and whatever he does  he should do with all his might.
author: Cicero

quote: Nothing's far when one wants to get there.
author: Queen Marie of Rumania

quote: Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do  do it with thy might.
author: Bible

quote: He that rides his hobby gently must always give way to him that rides his hobby hard.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Stay up and really burn the midnight oil. There are no compromises.
author: Leontyne Price

quote: Nothing of worthy or weight can be achieved with half a mind  with a faint heart  and with a lame endeavor.
author: Isaac Barrow

quote: Don't ask me to give in to this body of mine. I can't afford it. Between me and my body there must be a struggle until death.
author: Saint Margaret of Cortona

quote: Morality  like physical cleanliness  is not acquired once and for all: it can only be kept and renewed by a habit of constant watchfulness and discipline.
author: Victoria Ocampo

quote: Firmness of purpose is one of the most necessary sinews of character  and one of the best instruments of success. Without it  genius wastes its efforts in a maze of inconsistencies.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: My face is set  my gait is fast  my goal is Heaven  my road is narrow  my way is rough  my companions are few  my guide is reliable  my mission is clear. I cannot be bought  compromised  detoured  lured away  turned back  diluted  or delayed. I will not flinch in the face of sacrifice  hesitate in the presence of adversity  negotiate ... at the table of the enemy  ponder at the pool of popularity  or meander in a maze of mediocrity. I won't give up  shut up  let up  or slow up.
author: Robert Moorehead

quote: To have no loyalty is to have no dignity  and in the end  no manhood.
author: Peter Taylor Forsyth

quote: If you are ashamed to stand by your colors  you had better seek another flag.
author: Anonymous

quote: Great minds have purposes  others have wishes.
author: Washington Irving

quote: I don't want people who want to dance  I want people who have to dance.
author: George Balanchine

quote: What a man wants to do he generally can do  if he wants to badly enough.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Never grow a wishbone  daughter  where your backbone ought to be.
author: Clementine Paddleford

quote: Happy are those who dream dreams and are ready to pay the price to make them come true.
author: L. J. Cardinal Suenens

quote: He turns not back who is bound to a star.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: One advantage of marriage  it seems to me  is that when you fall out of love with him  or he falls out of love with you  it keeps you together until you maybe fall in love again.
author: Judith Viorst

quote: You can't try to do things  you simply must do them.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: I am in earnest  I will not equivocate  I will not excuse  I will not retreat a single inch  and I will be heard.
author: William Lloyd Garrison

quote: If you don't make a total commitment to whatever you're doing  then you start looking to bail out the first time the boat starts leaking. It's tough enough getting that boat to shore with everybody rowing  let alone when a guy stands up and starts putting his life jacket on.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: When I stand before God at the end of my life  I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left  and could say  "I used everything you gave me."
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: It seems safe to say that significant discovery  really creative thinking  does not occur with regard to problems about which the thinker is lukewarm.
author: Mary Henle

quote: If a man hasn't discovered something that he will die for  he isn't fit to live.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Moderation in war is imbecility.
author: Admiral John Fisher

quote: Let my name stand among those who are willing to bear ridicule and reproach for the truth's sake  and so earn some right to rejoice when the victory is won.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Getting ahead in a difficult profession requires avid faith in yourself. You must be able to sustain yourself against staggering blows. There is no code of conduct to help beginners. That is why some people with mediocre talent  but with great inner drive  go much further than people with vastly superior talent.
author: Sophia Loren

quote: The wonderful thing about saints is that they were human. They lost their tempers  got hungry  scolded God  were egotistical or impatient in their turns  made mistakes and regretted them. Still they went on doggedly blundering toward heaven.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times  always with the same person.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Winners are men who have dedicated their whole lives to winning.
author: Woody Hayes

quote: Those who love a cause are those who love the life which has to be led in order to serve it.
author: Simone Weil

quote: Unless you can find some sort of loyalty  you cannot find unity and peace in your active living.
author: Josiah Royce

quote: Sometimes success is due less to ability than zeal. The winner is he who gives himself to his work body and soul.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: Now I am steel-set: I follow the call to the clear radiance and glow of the heights.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Love me  please  I love you  I can bear to be your friend. So ask of me anything ... I am not a tentative person. Whatever I do  I give up my whole self to it.
author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

quote: I don't care a damn for your loyal service when you think I am right  when I really want it most is when you think I am wrong.
author: General Sir John Monash

quote: One's lifework  I have learned  grows with the working and the living. Do it as if your life depended on it  and first thing you know  you'll have made a life out of it. A good life  too
author: Theresa Helburn

quote: If you don't stand for something  you'll fall for anything.
author: Michael Evans

quote: If you deny yourself commitment  what can you do with your life?
author: Harvey Fierstein

quote: The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
author: Cecil B. DeMille

quote: Theirs is not to reason why  theirs is but to do or die.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Either do not attempt at all  or go through with it.
author: Ovid

quote: If you start to take Vienna  take Vienna.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: If you aren't going all the way  why go at all?
author: Joe Namath

quote: You can be an ordinary athlete by getting away with less than your best. But if you want to be a great  you have to give it all you've got-your everything.
author: Duke P. Kahanamoku

quote: Put your heart  mind  intellect and soul even to your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
author: Swami Sivananda

quote: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
author: General Douglas MacArthur

quote: Men  like snails  lose their usefulness when they lose direction and begin to bend.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: It is by losing himself in the objective  in inquiry  creation  and craft  that a man becomes something.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: The height of your accomplishments will equal the depth of your convictions.
author: William F. Scolavino

quote: The dedicated life is the life worth living.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: The secret of living is to find a pivot  the pivot of a concept on which you can make your stand.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: There's nothing in the middle of the road but yellow stripes and dead armadillos.
author: Jim Hightower

quote: Standing in the middle of the road is very dangerous  you get knocked down by traffic from both sides.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: He who walks in the middle of the road gets hit from both sides.
author: George P. Shultz

quote: I never liked the middle ground-the most boring place in the world.
author: Louise Nevelson

quote: The hottest places in hell are reserved for those who  in a period of moral crisis  maintain their neutrality.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: The man who sees both sides of an issue is very likely on the fence or up a tree.
author: Anonymous

quote: The middle of the road is where the white line is  and that's the worst place to drive.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The principle of neutrality ... has increasingly become an obsolete conception  and  except under very special circumstances  it is an immoral and shortsighted conception.
author: John Foster Dulles

quote: We know what happens to people who stay in the middle of the road. They get run over.
author: Aneurin Bevan

quote: Show me a person who is not an extremist about some things  who is a "middle-of-the-roader" in everything  and I will show you someone who is insecure.
author: G. Aiken Taylor

quote: We should not permit tolerance to degenerate into indifference.
author: Margaret Chase Smith

quote: Most people are not for or against anything  the first object of getting people together is to make them respond somehow  to overcome inertia.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: There is nothing harder than the softness of indifference.
author: Juan Montalvo

quote: I could not  at any age  be content to take my place by the fireside and simply look on. Life was meant to be lived. Curiosity must be kept alive. One must never  for whatever reason  turn his back on life.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The accomplice to the crime of corruption is frequently our own indifference.
author: Bess Myerson

quote: Science may have found a cure for most evils  but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all-the apathy of human beings.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The only difference between a rut and a grave is their dimensions.
author: Ellen Glasgow

quote: We're swallowed up only when we are willing for it to happen.
author: Nathalie Sarraute

quote: The only place you can win a football game is on the field. The only place you can lose it is in your heart.
author: Darrell Royal

quote: I am seeking  I am striving  I am in it with all my heart.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: He did it with all his heart  and prospered.
author: Bible

quote: Wars may be fought with weapons  but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow  and of the man who leads  that gains the victory.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: It was my tongue that swore  my heart is unsworn.
author: Euripides

quote: Morale is the greatest single factor in successful wars.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Nothing can resist a will which will stake even existence upon its fulfillment.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Our future and our fate lie in our wills more than in our hands  for our hands are but the instruments of our wills.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Nothing is so common as unsuccessful men with talent. They lack only determination.
author: Charles Swindoll

quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.
author: Marshal Ferdinand Foch

quote: Strength is a matter of the made-up mind.
author: John Beecher

quote: Your own resolution to success is more important than any other one thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Common sense is very uncommon.
author: Horace Greeley

quote: Common sense is in spite of  not the result of  education.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Common sense is instinct  and enough of it is genius.
author: H. W. Shaw

quote: What is a Communist? One who hath yearnings For equal division of unequal earnings  Idler or bungler  or both  he is willing  To fork out his copper and pocket your shilling.
author: Ebenezer Elliott

quote: The Communist is a Socialist in a violent hurry.
author: G. W. Gough

quote: The theory of Communism may be summed up in one sentence: Abolish all private property.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Communism is the exploitation of the strong by the weak. In communism  inequality springs from placing mediocrity on a level with excellence.
author: Proudhon

quote: If you want to read about love and marriage you've got to buy two separate books.
author: Alan King

quote: When you are in love with someone you want to be near him all the time  except when you are out buying things and charging them to him.
author: Miss Piggy

quote: A happy marriage is a long conversation which always seems too short.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: The first duty of love is to listen.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: You don't marry someone you can live with - you marry the person who you cannot live without.
author: Anonymous

quote: Behind every successful man is a surprised woman!
author: Maryon Pearson

quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness  a tender look which becomes a habit.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: My most brilliant achievement was my ability to be able to persuade my wife to marry me.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Sexiness wears thin after a while and beauty fades  but to be married to a man who makes you laugh every day  ah  now that's a real treat.
author: Joanne Woodward

quote: Marriage is not a ritual or an end. It is a long  intricate  intimate dance together and nothing matters more than your own sense of balance and your choice of partner.
author: Amy Bloom

quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other  but in looking outward together in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

quote: I married the first man I ever kissed. When I tell this to my children  they just about throw up.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: Love: Two minds without a single thought.
author: Philip Barry

quote: Tenderness emerges from the fact that the two persons  longing  as all individuals do  to overcome the separateness and isolation to which we are all heir because we are individuals  can participate in a relationship that  for the moment  is not of two isolated selves but a union.
author: Rollo May

quote: I recently read that love is entirely a matter of chemistry. That must be why my wife treats me like toxic waste.
author: David Bissonette

quote: You can't put a price tag on love  but you can on all its accessories.
author: Melanie Clark

quote: When you love someone  all your saved-up wishes start coming out.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: No man is truly married until he understands every word his wife is NOT saying.
author: Anonymous

quote: To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.
author: Mark Twain

quote: "The whole world loves a lover" is an interesting theory  but a very bad legal defense.
author: Keith Sullivan

quote: I was married by a judge. I should have asked for a jury.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: They say love is blind . . . and marriage is an insritution. Well  I'm nor ready for an instirurion for rhe blind just yet.
author: Mae West

quote: I think men who have a pierced ear are better prepared for marriage. They've experienced pain and boughr jewelry.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: A woman can forgive a man for the harm he does her . . . but she can never forgive him for the sacrifices he makes on her account.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have  the older she gets  the more interested he is in her.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: So heavy is the chain of wedlock that it needs two to carry it  and sometimes three.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: In olden times sacrifices were made at the altar  a custom which is still continued.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: Keep your eyes wide open before marriage  half shut afterwards.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: In the race for love  I was scratched.
author: Joan Davis

quote: Marriage has no guarantees. If that's what you're looking for  go live with a car battery.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: To keep the fire burning brightly there's one easy rule: Keep the two logs together  near enough to keep each other warm and far enough apart - about a finger's breadth - for breathing room. Good fire  good marriage  same rule.
author: Marnie Reed Crowell

quote: Look for a sweet person. Forget rich.
author: Estee Lauder

quote: Love seems the swiftest but it is the slowest of all growths. No man or woman really knows what perfect love is until they have been married a quarter of a century.
author: Mark Twain

quote: One of the silliest lines ever said in a feature film came from Love Story  the 1970s hit  which immortalized the phrase  "Love means never having to say you're sorry." There are few people who would actually want to share a life with someone who held that concept near and dear.
author: Marge Kennedy

quote: Infatuation is when you think he's as sexy as Robert Redford  as smart as Henry Kissinger  as noble as Ralph Nader  as funny as Woody Allen  and as athletic as Jimmy Conners. Love is when you realize that he's as sexy as Woody Allen  as smart as Jimmy Connors  as funny as Ralph Nader  as athletic as Henry Kissinger and nothing like Robert Redford - but you'll take him anyway.
author: Judith Viorst

quote: Without love  what are we worth? Eighty-nine cents! Eighty-nine cents worth of chemicals walking around lonely.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Love is the magician that pulls man out of his own hat.
author: Ben Hecht

quote: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame  very pretty  often hot and fierce  but still only light and flickering. As love grows older  our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals  deep-burning and unquenchable.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: We waste time looking for the perfect lover  instead of creating the perfect love.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: Men love because they are afraid of themselves  afraid of the loneliness that lives in them  and need someone in whom they can lose themselves as smoke loses itself in the sky.
author: V. F. Calverton

quote: When you realize you want to spend the rest of your life with somebody  you want the rest of your life to start as soon as possible.
author: Harry Burns

quote: [Being in love] is something like poetry. Certainly  you can analyze it and expound its various senses and intentions  but there is always something left over  mysteriously hovering between music and meaning.
author: Muriel Spark

quote: We are so fond of each other because our ailments are the same.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: When I eventually met Mr. Right I had no idea that his first name was Always.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: What is there in the vale of life Half so delightful as a wife When Friendship  love and peace combine To stamp the marriage bond divine?
author: William Cowper

quote: Marrying for love may be a bit risky  but it is so honest that God can't help but smile on it.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Love is moral even without legal marriage  but marriage is immoral without love.
author: Ellen Key

quote: A virtuous wife is a man's best treasure.
author: Muhammad

quote: A wife is the joy of a man's heart.
author: Talmud

quote: I thought I was in love once  and then later I thought maybe it was just an inner-ear imbalance.
author: Benton Fraser

quote: When love is strong  a man and a woman can make their bed on a sword's blade. When love grows weak  a bed of 60 cubits is not large enough.
author: Talmud

quote: Of all the paths [that] lead to a woman's love Pity's the straightest.
author: Francis Beaumont

quote: To see her is to love her  And love but her forever  For Nature made her what she is  And never made another.
author: Robert Burns

quote: We have lived and loved together Through many changing years  We have shared each other's gladness  And wept each other's tears.
author: Charles Jefferys

quote: Being in therapy is great. I spend an hour just talking about myself. It's kinda like being the guy on a date.
author: Caroline Rhea

quote: Whenever you want to marry someone  go have lunch with his ex-wife.
author: Shelley Winters

quote: I sold my memoirs of my love life to Parker Brothers and they are going to make a game out of it.
author: Woody Allen

quote: I have learned that only two things are necessary to keep one's wife happy. First  let her think she's having her own way. And second  let her have it.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: Politics doesn't make strange bedfellows - marriage does.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Someone asked me why women don't gamble as much as men do  and I gave the commonsensical reply that we don't have as much money. That was a true and incomplete answer. In fact  women's total instinct for gambling is satisfied by marriage.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: The secret of a happy marriage remains a secret.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: I've given my memoirs far more thought than any of my marriages. You can't divorce a book.
author: Gloria Swanson

quote: Americans  who make more of marrying for love than any other people  also break up more of their marriages  but the figure reflects not so much the failure of love as the determination of people not to live without it.
author: Morton Hunt

quote: The highest prize in a world of men is the most beautiful woman available on your arm and living there in her heart loyal to you.
author: Normal Mailer

quote: Love is what makes two people sit in the middle of a bench when there is plenty of room at both ends.
author: Anonymous

quote: A man loves his sweetheart the most  his wife the best  but his mother the longest.
author: Irish proverb

quote: No woman ever falls in love with a man unless she has a better opinion of him than he deserves.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: The bravest thing that men do is love women.
author: Mort Sahl

quote: A woman has to love a bad man once or twice in her life  to be thankful for a good one.
author: Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings

quote: Love is passion  obsession  someone you can't live without. If you don't start with that  what are you going to end up with? Fall head over heels. I say find someone you can love like crazy and who'll love you the same way back. And how do you find him? Forget your head and listen to your heart.
author: William Parrisb

quote: One of the things my life has taught me is how important it is to try to say  "I love you" in ways that can be preserved  looked at  and read when you are alone or when there is adversity or when circumstances bring separation. In any case  . . . saying "I love you" is one of the "secrets" of the happy marriage that Ronnie and I have shared. Ronnie's letters move me to this day. They are his gift to me across the years  and throughout the decades of love.
author: Nancy Reagan

quote: The most wonderful of all things in life is the discovery of another human being with whom one's relationship has a growing depth  beauty and joy as the years increase. This inner progressiveness of love between two human beings is a most marvelous thing  it cannot be found by looking for it or by passionately wishing for it. It is a sort of divine accident  and the most wonderful of all things in life.
author: Hugh Walpole

quote: Tell me thy company and I will tell thee what thou art.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Two's a company  three's a crowd.
author: English proverb

quote: We are in the same boat
author: Pope Clement

quote: The right hands of fellowship.
author: Galatians

quote: Comparisons are odious.
author: Archbishop Boiardo

quote: Some say  compared to Bononcini  That Mynheer Handel's but a ninny  Others aver  that he to Handel Is scarcely fit to hold a candle: Strange all this difference should be  'Twixt Tweedle-dum and Tweedle-dee!
author: John Byrom

quote: The bee and the serpent often sip from the selfsame flower.
author: Pietro Metastasio

quote: If the poor man cannot always get meat  the rich man cannot always digest it.
author: Henry Giles

quote: Tis always morning somewhere in the world.
author: Richard Hengest Horne

quote: Nothing is pure and entire of a piece. All advantages are attended with disadvantages. A universal compensation prevails in all conditions of being and existence.
author: David Hume

quote: The prickly thorn often bears soft roses.
author: Ovid

quote: Those who complain most are most to be complained of.
author: Matthew Henry

quote: The usual fortune of complaint is to excite contempt more than pity.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Complaint is the largest tribute Heaven receives.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Compliments are only lies in court clothes.
author: Anonymous

quote: When two people compliment each other with the choice of anything  each of them generally gets that which he likes least.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Compliments and flattery oftenest excite my contempt by the pretension they imply  for who is he that assumes to flatter me? To compliment often implies an assumption of superiority in the complimenter. It is  in fact  a subtle detraction.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: All government - indeed  every human benefit and enjoyment  every virtue and every prudent act - is founded on compromise and barter.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Compromise makes a good umbrella  but a poor roof  it is a temporary expedient  often wise in party politics  almost sure to be unwise in statesmanship.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Better bend than break.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: No man was ever so much deceived by another as by himself.
author: Charles C. Grevvile

quote: The art of making much show with little substance.
author: Macaulay

quote: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? There is more hope of a fool than of him.
author: Bible

quote: The ability to concentrate and to use your time well is everything.
author: Lee lacocca

quote: It is only when I dally with what I am about  look back and aside  instead of keeping my eyes straight forward  that I feel these cold sinkings of the heart.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: A straight path never leads anywhere except to the objective.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Nothing interferes with my concentration. You could put on an orgy in my office and I wouldn't look up. Well  maybe once.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: To be able to concentrate for a considerable time is essential to difficult achievement.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: If there is anything that can be called genius  it consists chiefly in the ability to give that attention to a subject which keeps it steadily in the mind  till we have surveyed it accurately on all sides.
author: Thomas Reid

quote: If you don't concentrate  you'll end up on your rear.
author: Tai Babilonia

quote: If I have ever made any valuable discoveries  it has been owing more to patient attention than to any other talent.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: For him who has no concentration  there is no tranquility.
author: Bhagaved Gita

quote: The secret to success in any human endeavor is total concentration.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: The secret of concentration is the secret of self-discovery. You reach inside yourself to discover your personal resources  and what it takes to match them to the challenge.
author: Arnold Palmer

quote: Beware of dissipating your powers  strive constantly to concentrate them.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: One arrow does not bring down two birds.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: No horse gets anywhere until he is harnessed. No steam or gas ever drives anything until it is confined. No Niagara is ever turned into light and power until it is tunneled. No life ever grows great until it is focused  dedicated  disciplined.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: A man may be so much of everything that he is nothing of everything.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Concentrate your energies  your thoughts and your capital. ... The wise man puts all his eggs in one basket and watches the basket.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: One man  two loves. No good ever comes of that.
author: Euripides

quote: One cannot both feast and become rich.
author: Ashanti proverb

quote: The perplexity of life arises from there being too many interesting things in it for us to be interested properly in any of them.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: No country can act wisely simultaneously in every part of the globe at every moment of time.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: The field of consciousness is tiny. It accepts only one problem at a time.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: To do two things at once is to do neither.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: I like to laugh  but on the court  it is my work. I try to smile  but it is so difficult. I concentrate on the ball  not on my face.
author: Steffi Graf

quote: Successful minds work like a gimlet  to a single point.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: A bird can roost but on one branch. A mouse can drink no more than its fill from a river.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Each man is capable of doing one thing well. If he attempts several  he will fail to achieve distinction in any.
author: Plato

quote: This one thing I do ... I press toward the mark.
author: Bible

quote: All good is gained by those whose thought and life are kept pointed close to one main thing  not scattered abroad upon a thousand.
author: Stephen McKenna

quote: The first law of success ... is concentration: to bend all the energies to one point  and to go directly to that point  looking neither to the right nor the left.
author: William Matthews

quote: Give me a man who says this one thing I do  and not these fifty things I dabble in.
author: Dwight L. Moody

quote: A single idea  if it is right  saves us the labor of an infinity of experiences.
author: Jacques Maritain

quote: One thought driven home is better than three left on base.
author: James Liter

quote: Purity of heart is to will one thing.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: A man should remove not only unnecessary acts  but also unnecessary thoughts  for then superfluous activity will not follow.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: No man will swim ashore and take his baggage with him.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Many people who wonder why they don't amount to more than they do have good stuff in them  and are energetic  persevering  and have ample opportunities. It is all a case of trimming the useless branches and throwing the whole force of power into the development of something that counts.
author: Walter J. Johnston

quote: A great man is one who seizes the vital issue in a complex question  what we might call the jugular vein of the whole organism  and spends his energies upon that.
author: Joseph Rickaby

quote: While the work or play is on ... don't constantly feel you ought to be doing the other.
author: Franklin P. Adams

quote: When one is learning  one should not think of play  and when one is at play  one should not think of learning.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: The immature mind hops from one thing to another  the mature mind seeks to follow through.
author: Harry A. Overstreet

quote: If you want to hit a bird on the wing you must have all your will in focus  you must not be thinking about yourself and  equally  you must not be thinking about your neighbor: you must be living in your eye on that bird. Every achievement is a bird on the wing.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: The difference in men does not lie in the size of their hands  nor in the perfection of their bodies  but in this one sublime ability of concentration: to throw the weight with the blow  to live an eternity in an hour.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: I go at what I am about as if there was nothing else in the world for the time being.
author: Charles Lingsley

quote: Choice of attention  to pay attention to this and ignore that  is to the inner life what choice of action is to the outer.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Concentration is everything. On the day I'm performing  I don't hear anything anyone says to me.
author: Luciano Pavarotti

quote: The real essence of work is concentrated energy.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: You can't ring the bells and  at the same time  walk in the procession.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: I've learned ruthless concentration. I can write under any circumstances ... street noises  loud talk  music  you name it.
author: Sylvia Porter

quote: Do whatever you do intensely.
author: Robert Henri

quote: The effectiveness of work increases according to geometrical progression if there are no interruptions.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Other people's interruptions of your work are relatively insignificant compared with the countless times you interrupt yourself.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: If you direct your whole thought to work itself  none of the things which invade eyes or ears will reach the mind.
author: Quintilian

quote: A full mind is an empty baseball bat.
author: Branch Rickey

quote: There is time enough for everything in the course of the day if you do but one thing at once  but there is not time enough in the year if you will do two things at a time.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: If you direct your whole thought to work itself  none of the things which invade eyes or ears will reach the mind.
author: Quintilian

quote: Become so wrapped up in something that you forget to be afraid.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

quote: Attention to a subject depends upon our interest in it.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: I can't concentrate on golf or bowling. Those bowling pins aren't going to hurt me. I can concentrate in the ring because someone is trying to kill me.
author: Carmen Basilio

quote: When I come into a game in the bottom of the ninth  bases loaded  no one out and a one-run lead ... it takes people off my mind.
author: Tug McGraw

quote: Concentrate on finding your goal  then concentrate on reaching it.
author: Colonel Michael Friedman

quote: Those who set out to serve both God and Mammon soon discover that there is no God.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: When a man knows he is to be hanged in a fortnight  it concentrates his mind wonderfully.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Be swift to hear  slow to speak  slow to wrath.
author: Bible

quote: The integrity of men is to be measured by their conduct  not by their professions.
author: Junius

quote: Open confession is good for the soul.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: To confess a fault freely is the next thing to being innocent of it.
author: Syrus

quote: The confidence which we have in ourselves gives birth to much of that which we have in others.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Society is built upon trust.
author: Robert South

quote: Be courteous to all  but intimate with few  and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
author: George Washington

quote: Every man in it is a great man  an orator  a critic  a statesman  and therefore every man upon every question must show his oratory  his criticism  and his political abilities.
author: John Adams

quote: Fleas can be taught nearly anything that a Congressman can.
author: S. L. Clemens

quote: Some statesmen go to Congress and some go to jail. It is the same thing  after all.
author: Eugene Field

quote: How grand is victory  but how dear!
author: Anonymous

quote: He who surpasses or subdues mankind must look down on the hate of those below.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I came  I saw  I conquered.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: To rejoice in conquest is to rejoice in murder.
author: Lao-Tsze

quote: Self-conquest is the greatest of victories.
author: Plato

quote: Conscience is a mother-in-law whose visit never ends.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Conscience is a cur that will let you get past it but that you cannot keep from barking.
author: Anonymous

quote: Conscience is but a word that cowards use  Devised at first to keep the strong in awe.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Conscience reigns but it does not govern.
author: Paul Valery

quote: A man's vanity tells him what is honour  a man's conscience what is justice.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: Conscience does make cowards of us all.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Conscience is thoroughly well-bred  and soon leaves off talking to those who do not wish to hear it.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Conscience is a coward  and those faults it has not strength enough to prevent  it seldom has justice enough to accuse.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: I feel bad that I don't feel worse.
author: Michael Frayn

quote: Shame arises from the fear of man  conscience from the fear of God.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Nor ear can hear nor tongue can tell The tortures of that inward hell!
author: Lord Byron

quote: The only incorruptible thing about us.
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Liberty of conscience (when people have consciences) is rightly considered the most indispensable of liberties.
author: Haddon Chambers

quote: There is no pillow so soft as a clear conscience.
author: French proverb

quote: Conscience is a sacred sanctuary where God alone may enter as judge.
author: Felicite Robert de Lamennais

quote: I am more afraid of my own heart than of the pope and all his cardinals. I have within me the great pope  self.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Thus conscience does make cowards of us all  And thus the native hue of resolution Is sicklied o'er with the pale cast of thought  And enterprises of great pith and moment  With this regard  their currents turn awry  And lose the name of action.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The soft whispers of the God in man.
author: Edward Young

quote: A statesman who is enamored of existing evils  as distin-quished from the Liberal  who wishes to replace them with others.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: We are reformers in spring and summer  in autumn and winter we stand by the old  reformers in the morning  conservers at night. Reform is affirmative  conservatism negative  conservatism goes for comfort  reform for truth.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A conservative is a man who will not look at the new moon  out of respect for that "ancient institution " the old one.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: What is conservatism? Is it not adherence to the old and tried  against the new and untried?
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Inconsistency is the only thing in which men are consistent.
author: Horace Smith

quote: Nothing that is not a real crime makes a man appear so contemptible and little in the eyes of the world as inconsistency.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Like all weak men he laid an exaggerated stress on not changing one's mind.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds  adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines. With consistency a great soul has simply nothing to do. He may as well concern himself with his shadow on the wall. Speak what you think now in hard words and tomorrow speak what tomorrow thinks in hard words again  though it contradict everything you said today.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Consistency requires you to be as ignorant today as you were a year ago.
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Conservatism is the maintenance of conventions already in force.
author: Thorstein Veblen

quote: There are those who would misteach us that to stick in a rut is consistency - and a virtue  and that to climb out of the rut is inconsistency - and a vice.
author: Mark Twain

quote: People who honestly mean to be true  really contradict themselves much more rarely than those who try to be 'consistent'.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: The only man who can change his mind is the man who's got one.
author: Edward Noyes Westcott

quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds  adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Inconsistency is the only thing in which men are consistent.
author: Horace Smith

quote: Shoemaker  stick to your last.
author: Pliny

quote: Constitutions should consist only of general provisions  the reason is that they must necessarily be permanent  and that they cannot calculate for the possible change of things.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: We are under a Constitution  but the Constitution is what the judges say it is.
author: Charles Evans Hughes

quote: In questions of power let no more be heard of confidence in man  but bind him down from mischief by the chains of the constitution.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: A good constitution is infinitely better than the best despot.
author: Macaulay

quote: Enjoy your own life without comparing it with that of another.
author: Marquis de Condorcet

quote: I earn that I eat  get that I wear  owe no man hate  envy no man's happiness  glad of other men's good  content with my harm.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: He is well paid that is well satisfied.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: It is not for man to rest in absolute contentment.
author: Robert Southey

quote: No great advance has ever been made in science  politics  or religion  without controversy.
author: Lyman Beecher

quote: If a cause be good  the most violent attack of its enemies will not injure it so much as an injudicious defense of it by its friends.
author: Walter Colton

quote: Conversation is the fine art of mutual consideration and communication about matters of common interest that basically have some human importance.
author: Ordway Tead

quote: Great talkers are trying to fill the gap between themselves and others  but only widen it.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Pollution is nothing but the resources we are not harvesting. We allow them to disperse because we have been ignorant of their value.
author: Buckminster Fuller

quote: Speech is civilization itself.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: The habit of common and continuous speech is a symptom of mental deficiency. It proceeds from not knowing what is going on in other people's minds.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: The time to stop talking is when the other person nods his head affirmatively but says nothing.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: There is no such thing as conversation. It is an illusion. There are intersecting monologues. That is all.
author: Rebecca West

quote: He was one of those men whose constitutional inability to make small talk forfeits all one's sympathy  and makes one think that social grace is sometimes a moral duty.
author: James Morris

quote: He (Macaulay) has occasional flashes of silence that make his conversation perfectly delightful.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: As I got warmed up  and felt perfectly at home in talk  I heard myself boasting  lying  exaggerating. Oh  not deliberately  far from it. It would be unconvivial and dull to stop and arrest the flow of talk  and speak only after carefully considering whether I was telling the truth.
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Not a sentence or a word is independent of the circumstances under which it is uttered.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Communication is and should be hell fire and sparks as well as sweetness and light.
author: Aman Vivian Rakoff

quote: The really important things are said over cocktails and are never done.
author: Peter F. Drucker

quote: You never say a word of yourself  dear Lady Grey. You have that dreadful sin of anti-egotism.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: The real art of conversation is not only to say the right thing in the right place but to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.
author: Dorothy Nevill

quote: Listen or thy tongue will keep thee deaf.
author: American Indian proverb

quote: People love to talk but hate to listen. Listening is not merely not talking  though even that is beyond most of our powers  it means taking a vigorous  human interest in what is being told us. You can listen like a blank wall or like a splendid auditorium where every sound comes back fuller and richer.
author: Alice Duer Miller

quote: A man who listens because he has nothing to say can hardly be a source of inspiration. The only listening that counts is that of the talker who alternately absorbs and expresses ideas.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: When I think over what I have said  I envy dumb people.
author: Seneca

quote: That is the happiest conversation where there is no competition  no vanity  but a calm quiet interchange of sentiments.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: John Wesley's conversation is good  but he is never at leisure. He is always obliged to go at a certain hour. This is very disagreeable to a man who loves to fold his legs and have his talk out as I do.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: She had lost the art of conversation  but not  unfortunately  the power of speech.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Too much agreement kills a chat.
author: Eldridge Cleaver

quote: You can never hope to become a skilled conversationalist until you learn how to put your foot tactfully through the television set.
author: M. Dale Baughman

quote: Some persons talk simply because they think sound is more manageable than silence.
author: Margaret Halsey

quote: While the right to talk may be the beginning of freedom  the necessity of listening is what makes the right important.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: Listening is a magnetic and strange thing  a creative force. The friends who listen to us are the ones we move toward  and we want to sit in their radius. When we are listened to  it creates us  makes us unfold and expand.
author: Karl Menninger

quote: A ceremony of self-wastage - good talkers are miserable  they know that they have betrayed themselves  that they have taken material which should have a life of its own  to disperse it in noises upon the air.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Wit is the salt of conversation  not the food.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Debate is masculine  conversation is feminine.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Never hold any one by the button or the hand in order to be heard out  for if people are unwilling to hear you  you had better hold your tongue than them.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Conversation enriches the understanding  but solitude is the school of genius.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: Silence is one great art of conversation.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Conceit causes more conversation than wit.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: The less men think  the more they talk.
author: Charles Montesquieu

quote: A conservative believes nothing should be done for the first time.
author: Lynwood L. Giacomini

quote: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for  the evidence of things not seen.
author: Bible

quote: Genuine blasphemy  genuine in spirit and not purely verbal  is the product of partial belief  and is as impossible to the complete atheist as to the perfect Christian.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: I believe in the gods. Or rather  I believe that I believe in the gods. But I don't believe that they are great brooding presences watching over us  I believe they are completely absent-minded.
author: Jean Giraudoux

quote: I think that a society cannot live without a certain number of irrational beliefs. They are protected from criticism and analysis because they are irrational.
author: Claude Levi-Strauss

quote: What is dangerous about extremists is not that they are extreme  but that they are intolerant. The evil is not what they say about their cause  but what they say about their opponents.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: It is a perplexing and unpleasant truth that when men already have 'something worth fighting for'  they do not feel like fighting.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Martyrdom has always been a proof of the intensity  never of the correctness of a belief.
author: Arthur Schnitzler

quote: Belief is better than anything else  and it is best when rapt - above paying its respects to anybody's doubt whatsoever.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The peak of tolerance is most readily achieved by those who are not burdened with convictions.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: A belief is not merely an idea the mind possesses  it is an idea that possesses the mind.
author: Robert Bolton

quote: Every man who attacks my belief diminishes in some degree my confidence in it  and therefore makes me uneasy  and I am angry with him who makes me uneasy.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Penetrating so many secrets  we cease to believe in the unknowable. But there it sits nevertheless  calmly licking its chops.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Believe not your own brother - believe  instead  your own blind eye.
author: Russian proverb

quote: Whether you are really right or not doesn't matter  it's the belief that counts.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: I love an opposition that has convictions.
author: Frederick the Great

quote: Every man  wherever he goes  is encompassed by a cloud of comforting convictions  which move with him like flies on a summer day.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Convictions are the mainsprings of action  the driving powers of life. What a man lives are his convictions.
author: Bishop Francis Kelly

quote: The best lack all conviction  while the worst Are full of passionate intensity.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: (Conviction) is possible only in a world more primitive than ours can be perceived to be. A man can achieve a simply gnomic conviction only by ignoring the radical describers of his environment  or by hating them  as convinced men have hated  say  Darwin and Freud  as agents of some devil.
author: John Ciardi

quote: Those who serve a cause are not those who love that cause. They are those who love the life which has to be led in order to serve it - except in the case of the very purest  and they are rare.
author: Simone Weil

quote: The great thing in this world is not so much where we stand  as in what direction we are moving.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Orthodoxy is my doxy - heterodoxy is another man's doxy.
author: William Warburton

quote: Every dogma has its day.
author: Abraham Rotstein

quote: A man can believe in a considerable deal of rubbish  and yet go about his daily work in a rational and cheerful manner.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: Every life is a possession of faith  and exercises an inevitable and silent propaganda.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Soon after a hard decision something inevitably occurs to cast doubt. Holding steady against that doubt usually proves the decision.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: I may have faults but being wrong ain't one of them.
author: Jimmy Hoffa

quote: The discovery of a new dish does more for human happiness than the discovery of a new star.
author: Anthelme Brillat Savarin

quote: We may live without friends  we may live without books  But civilized man cannot live without cooks.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Too many cooks spoil the broth.
author: English proverb

quote: God sends meat  and the Devil sends cooks.
author: John Taylor

quote: The more corrupt the state  the more laws.
author: Tacitus

quote: Just for a handful of silver he left us  Just for a ribbon to stick in his coat.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: If the chief party  whether it be the people  or the army  or the nobility  which you think most useful and of most consequence to you for the conservation of your dignity  be corrupt  you must follow their humor and indulge them  and in that case honesty and virtue are pernicious.
author: Machiavelli

quote: I consider it the best part of an education to have been born and brought up in the country
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: The town is man's world  but this (country life) is of God.
author: William Cowper

quote: In Chinese  the word for crisis is weiji  composed of the character wei  which means danger  and ji  which means opportunity.
author: Jan Wong

quote: My advice to you  if you should ever be in a hold up  is to line up with the cowards and save your bravery for an occasion when it may be of some benefit to you.
author: O. Henry

quote: It is easy enough to praise men for the courage of their convictions. I wish I could teach the sad young of this mealy generation the courage of their confusions.
author: John Ciardi

quote: It takes a kind of shabby arrogance to survive in our time  and a fairly romantic nature to want to.
author: Edgar Z. Friedenberg

quote: Growth demands a temporary surrender of security.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anais Nin

quote: No one provokes me with impunity (nemo me impune lacessit)
author: Motto of Scotland

quote: Neither have they hearts to stay  Nor wit enough to run away.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Respectability: the offspring of a liaison between a bald head and a bank account.
author: Anonymous

quote: Until the day of his death  no man can be sure of his courage.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: There is no such thing as bravery  only degrees of fear.
author: John Wainwright

quote: "Why not" is a slogan for an interesting life.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: You don't learn to hold your own in the world by standing on guard  but by attacking  and getting well hammered yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Here I stand. I can do no other. God help me. Amen.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Many become brave when brought to bay.
author: Norwegian proverb

quote: O God  give us serenity to accept what cannot be changed  courage to change what should be changed  and wisdom to distinguish the one from the other.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: The first virtue in a soldier is endurance of fatigue  courage is only the second virtue.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
author: George S. Patton

quote: We could be cowards  if we had courage enough.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Showing up is eighty percent of life.
author: Woody Allen

quote: A high station in life is earned by the gallantry with which appalling experiences are survived with grace.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: A decline in courage may be the most striking feature which an outside observer notices in the West in our days. The Western world has lost its civic courage  both as a whole and separately  in each country  in each government  in each political party  and  of course  in the United Nations. Such a decline in courage is particularly noticeable among the ruling groups and the intellectual elite  causing an impression that the loss of courage extends to the entire society.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: Courage is doing what you're afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you're scared.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: One man with courage makes a majority.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: If one is forever cautious  can one remain a human being?
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way. And don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: The Ancient Mariner said to Neptune during a great storm  'O God  you will save me if you wish  but I am going to go on holding my tiller straight.'
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Fight on  my merry men all  I'm a little wounded  but I am not slain  I will lay me down for to bleed a while  Then I'll rise and fight with you again.
author: John Dryden

quote: The paradox of courage is that a man must be a little careless of his life even in order to keep it.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves  or on whom she simply depends  is want of courage.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Please understand there is no depression in this house and we are not interested in the possibilities of defeat. They do not exist.
author: Victoria, Queen of England

quote: Now the trumpet summons us again - not as a call to bear arms  though arms we need  not as a call to battle  though embattled we are  but a call to bear the burden of a long twilight struggle  year in and year out  'rejoicing in hope  patient in tribulation'  a struggle against the common enemies of man: tyranny  poverty  disease and war itself.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: To be brave one short instant is no easy matter  it is easier to die for a cause than to live for it.
author: Comtesse Diane

quote: The courage we desire and prize is not the courage to die decently  but to live manfully.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Have the courage to act instead of react.
author: Earlene Larson Jenks

quote: Courage! I have shown it for years  think you I shall lose it at the moment when my sufferings are to end?
author: Marie Antoinette

quote: Necessity does the work of courage.
author: George Eliot

quote: Courage is a quality so necessary for maintaining virtue that it is always respected  even when it is associated with vice.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The courage of life is often a less dramatic spectacle than the courage of a final moment  but it is no less a magnificent mixture of triumph and tragedy. A man does what he must - in spite of personal consequences  in spite of obstacles and dangers and pressures - and that is the basis of all morality.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: He was a bold man that first ate an oyster.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Unless one says goodbye to what one loves  and unless one travels to completely new territories  one can expect merely a long wearing away of oneself.
author: Jean Dubuffet

quote: A decent boldness ever meets with friends.
author: Homer

quote: Courage is resistance to fear  mastery of fear  not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.
author: Andri Gide

quote: The fly ought to be used as the symbol of impertinence and audacity  for whilst all other animals shun man more than anything else  and run away even before he comes near them  the fly lights upon his very nose.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Valour lies just halfway between rashness and cowardice.
author: Cervantes

quote: Never undertake anything for which you wouldn't have the courage to ask the blessings of heaven.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: As to moral courage  I have very rarely met with the two o'clock in the morning kind. I mean unprepared courage  that which is necessary on an unexpected occasion  and which  in spite of the most unforeseen events  leaves full freedom of judgement and decision.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The guts carry the feet  not the feet the guts.
author: Cervantes

quote: Clothes and courage have much to do with each other.
author: Sara Jeannette Duncan

quote: A great part of courage is the courage of having done the thing before.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Courage - fear that has said its prayers.
author: Dorothy Bernard

quote: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees all others.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Constant exposure to dangers will breed contempt for them.
author: Seneca

quote: (Courage) a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger  and a mental willingness to endure it.
author: William T. Sherman

quote: Not simply one of the virtues but the form of every virtue at the testing point  which means at the point of highest reality.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: At the bottom of a good deal of the bravery that appears in the world there lurks a miserable cowardice. Men will face powder and steel because they cannot face public opinion.
author: E. H. Chapin

quote: Whether it be to failure or success  the first need of being is endurance -to endure with gladness if we can  with fortitude in any event.
author: Bliss Carman

quote: I'm not funny. What I am is brave.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Courage is the first of the human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees all the others.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Courage to be is the key to revelatory power of the feminist revolution.
author: Mary Daly

quote: Without courage  all other virtues lose their meaning.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Success is never found. Failure is never fatal. Courage is the only thing.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Courage is the most important of all virtues  because without it we can't practice any other virtue with consistency.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues  but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Courage is the ladder on which all other virtues mount.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: Courage is the basic virtue for everyone so long as he continues to grow  to move ahead.
author: Rollo May

quote: Courage is the greatest of all the virtues. Because if you haven't courage  you may not have an opportunity to use any of the others.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The courage of life is often a less dramatic spectacle than the courage of a final moment  but it is no less a magnificent mixture of triumph and tragedy. A man does what he must- in spite of personal consequences  in spite of obstacles and dangers and pressures-and that is the basis of all morality.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Nothing but courage can guide life.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Wealth lost-something lost  Honor lost-much lost  Courage lost-all lost.
author: Old German proverb

quote: Why not go out on a limb? Isn't that where the fruit is?
author: Frank Scully

quote: In politics  guts is all.
author: Barbara Castle

quote: In difficult situations  when hope seems feeble  the boldest plans are safest.
author: Livy
